There are a couple restaurants, and I don't think my family of 3 ate for less than $40 at any of them. (That of course does not include any alcohol) There is a $40/day resort fee, which includes internet, the Oasis Water Park, and the newspaper (?), a wonderful Fitness Center ***def not a hotel treadmill room, but rather a FULL gym***, valet service to a nearby mall and the restaurants on their property. This fee was not included in the package I booked on Allegiant - but I was aware of it from previous reviews. Would be nice if they could just include it in the package price. I spent half a day at the spa. It was nice - relatively expensive, but nice. My husband golfed at the resort and gives the course an overall rating of 8 out of 10. My daughter enjoyed the water park, as we did we all, but it was $4.92 for a fountain soda in a clear plastic cup smaller than any Red Solo. Overall, we really enjoyed ourselves and found that the resort provided us with a restful family vacation - but it came at somewhat high price. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: BCEagle88
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 kids and I just spent 5 days at the Grand. Overal the hotel is very nice. We were there during Spring break, and the hotel did appear to suffer with the volume of people. In particular, waits at the on-property dining - even the coffee shop - were excessive and aggravating. Due to the volume, we were not able to get a late check out but the hotel did offer the use of the gym/spa facilities for showering prior to our evening flight home, which was appreciated. Our room was pretty standard issue Embassy Suites style. No problems, although the bathroom was very, very small. We had a room near the water park/gym/hiking, which was convenient. The water park was great for the kids (10 and 12) and not bad for adults. Everything was very clean and the staff there was very attentive. The hotel is adjacent to some wonderful hiking, so be sure to take advantage. We were here for baseball, and the Angels ballpark was within minutes and Camelback was a managable drive. There are many posts complaining about the resort fee. The fee is similar to what we have paid at other Phoenix resorts (Biltmore) and the amenities (gym/spa, water park, internet and parking) were a fair exchange for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best spring break ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Justindale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand last year and liked it so much we came again this year. Awesome for the kids with the water park right out your hotel door. We loved this resort and will be returning for future family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Another GREAT Family Spring Break!”
Reviews.Author: twolfpack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand for our family Spring Break (3/10 to 3/17) and had a Great time! From the very beinging everything want well. I had called the morning we were to check-in and talked to Tim at the front desk and told him that we wanted to stay in the Camelback Suites, on an upper floor and overlooking to waterpark. He said he would take care of it and he did our suite was EXACTLY what we wanted. Thanks again Tim! The rest of the staff was also very friendly and helpful from the wait staff, athletic club staff, cleaning staff, and the Oasis Staff (who would greet us everytime we would leave and return!) We had a problem with our door lock and told a staff member named Kyle and he was on it having it replaced right away! Thanks again! We also thought the food was good and enjoyed happy hour in the lobby nightly. Everything was very clean and the kids ( 10 and 7) could not get enough of the water park and the nightly activities. It is to bad that others didn't have as great of a time as we did because our family can't wait to go back! We were all over the resort and we didn't see anybody who looked like they were not having FUN! GO AND ENJOY THE ARIZONA GRAND!

Reviews.Title: “Great property-wear shoes to/from the pool/water park!”
Reviews.Author: PartridgeCK
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Arizona Grand Resort via airplane from Atlanta, GA with Grandma, my husband and I and our 3 boys ages 6,7,8. We all loved this property and would return! There is a steak house with a live bull and the resort's restaurant is great...try the French Toast for breakfast! The water park that is an amenity of this resort is wonderful. The only issue we had was the heat. We didn't realize you can't go barefooted even from the pool to the lounge chair. You MUST wear shoes to walk anywhere. We actually got 2nd degree burns on the bottoms of our feet walking from the pool area to the water park area. People had to put down towels for us to walk on! The Phoenix Zoo was great and we actually saw a Roadrunner beside a Coyote!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU DON'T CARE ABOUT FOOD OR RUDENESS!”
Reviews.Author: Lisainnewyork
Reviews.Content: Holy cow! Today is my second to last day and I can't wait to leave! The waiters Interrupt conversations to clear your plate WHILE YOU ARE STILL EATING! They even reach across you and have no manners! Unreal honestly! The pool 'lifeguards' don't follow the same rules for all the kids.. If your kids are young, lifeguards will pick on them! We even spoke to the GM and he say he would 'do something' to make things right! No response! He didnt care! He cares more about the people here for business meetings than families! So, if you don't mind paying a lot for out dated rooms, buffets that are NOT buffets but self-serve , (one main dish, one side dish, one dessert) and staff that's not trained, young and rude, then you will feel right at home! I'm going BACK TO SQUAW Peak Hilton down the road or the Westin!! Never again! Now I'm heading outside the grounds for a decent meal, good service, A BAR OF SOAP (not a mini circle) and shampoo that's not 1oz for the family!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: joonbug72
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Arizona Grand for 2 nights in March. The facilities are beautiful, just like the pictures. The water park, slides, and lazy river were well-maintained and staffed. The food was over-priced/expensive. We bought chicken nachos for $10 and it looked and tasted terrible. We did eat the prime rib buffet and it was pretty good. Our room felt crowded as the bedroom portion had 2 queen beds (very comfy) that seemed to be stuffed into a small room and the bathroom was extremely small. The resort fee of $40 a day was steep. We did take advantage of the fitness center, classes, and the spa. The hiking on the hills around the resort was nice and gave a good view of the city. The area south of the resort was a little shady.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Place”
Reviews.Author: Ivett S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our family vacation over Spring Break. The hotel is very nice with large rooms for a family of 5 with small kids. It could use some updated rooms like replacing the carpet and the television (bad reception). The hidden daily resort fee that was high considering we didn't use the resort everyday but the pool was fantastic and the staff were helpful at every turn. The housekeeping service was slow but due to the personnel assigned to many rooms (had a converstion with housekeeping). When our room was cleaned, they did a very nice jo.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed”
Reviews.Author: Francis R
Reviews.Content: Went here on business and wasn't pleased at what we were charged. The rooms were very nice, they were kept nice and clean, so no complaints there; there were various areas of the resort, however, that were in disrepair, as in full sections were without lighting, so you would pass through them at night in complete darkness. A few things that upset me: We had 4 separate rooms, but we were in one vehicle; they charged us for parking for 4 vehicles & would not take that off the bill, even though we had 1. We were charged for using the water park, even though the water park was shut down the days we went there. That made absolutely no sense to us. The food was sub-par and very expensive. We ended up getting our food outside of the resort. They were charging premium prices for items you could walk down the street for. Were i to come back, I would go to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor and needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: 2012Familyof5
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there last week. We arrived at 3:00pm and our room was not ready. We stayed in the lobby area and went back at 4:0pm (check-in time) and the room was still not ready. I finally asked them to switch us to a different room in the same area. The woman who helped me initially gave me wristbands for the waterpark--not telling me only 4 wristbands come with the room fee. She was very rude and I felt like she was bothered with me checking in at 3:00. I had to go wait in line to purchase another wristband at $20/day! We finally got our key and the bellman met us as we left the hotel. He said there was no parking at our building. I asked if they were at capacity and he said no, it was because they built the Villas next door and did not add enough parking spaces. Every night we would have to park far away and walk to the room. Finally, we went to the pool and all of the chairs were taken. It took us a while to find two chairs together. My kids ended up getting a rash from the pool so we only went one day. I would not chose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy grounds, sadly outdated and sloppy maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Ulrica12
Reviews.Content: Yikes! We were charged a $40 per night "resort" fee in addition to fairly expensive lodging costs. The entire place is very very dirty, completely outdated and simply not kept up to par. Food trays were sitting outside of rooms for days, and the grounds are filthy. The "suites" are extremely old- very outdated TV, furniture and beds. Horrible mattresses and pillows. Definitely NOTHING luxurious about the place. The water areas are also dirty. Unless this places gets some major money infused into it and is managed properly, avoid it like the plague. The location is not great either. We will never ever stay here again and we certainly do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: My family had a great vacation at the Grand. The rooms were very nice, the waterpark kept my teens busy all day and the staff was very courteous and helpful. The management staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. We will definitely vacation at the Grand again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice-but can get expensive!”
Reviews.Author: jdt1971
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a really nice trip to Phoenix, and stayed at the Arizona Grand for 4 nights. I booked this resort as I am very active and liked the idea that I could golf, hike, run and horseback ride all in the resort and close by. My only complaints were the $40 plus tax) nightly resort fee (seemed excessive), the very pricey food at the resort ($8.50 for a yogurt cup), and that our room faced a noisy parking lot. A phone call tht lasted less than a minute cost us $11.00. Maybe I am just cheap!\ The resort itself is very attractive, and I would have probably enjoyed myself more if I had spent more time at the resort/

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Grand Resort - Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: We just concluded the overall best one-week vacation of our life at this resort. I went for golf and baseball and my wife went for spa and baseball, and we each were 110% satisfied. The golf course has a wonderful layout and was in great condition ... super greens, and the spa (as I am told) was fantastic. Now add in the quality of the accommodations, and this was vacation heaven. Thank you to AGR!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property with Plenty to Do”
Reviews.Author: TGordL
Reviews.Content: I went down to Phoenix for a golf getaway with a few friends and we stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort. It was a great choice as we found the property to offer a lot and it would be even better for families with young kids. We enjoyed having a pool and hot tub steps from our door and relaxed at the larger water park facility near the lobby of the main building. The water slides, lazy river and wave pool are great attractions and we were hoping to get a round of golf in on the golf course but times weren't available that worked with the other times we booked for golf elsewhere. The service is great and the staff friendly. We stayed in the Sedona building and it is in good shape but could use a little updating, we still had the old style tv's and our bathtub faucet had a constant drip. The beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows and fresh soft sheets. The furniture was functional but still in reasonable shape. The resort is close to freeways and the large Arizona Mills mall but noise wasn't an issue. We did notice a lot of kids on the property and at times they had a tendency to fill up the hot tubs in the evenings. We managed to find a hot tub that wasn't busy at all but it's probably due to the fact that the hot tub water was warm and not hot. I'd love to come back with my partner and stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Arizona Grand!”
Reviews.Author: EJG55
Reviews.Content: Was here at a conference. The facilities for that were very nice, not to mention the service. The resort is exceptionally well-maintained, and the staff helpful and friendly. The resort is spread-out, so getting around required a lot of walking. But, if you needed a lift around the resort, they had shuttles available at a moments notice. The restaurants were good. I especially loved the steak at Rustler's Rooste. The Lobby Grill has very good food, but rather pricey. If you wanted to go off-resort for meals, a car is necessary. We stayed at the Sedona Buildings in Deluxe Suite. It was nicely furnished, albeit a bit cramped. The bed was outstanding! The cleanliness was top-notch. All in all, it was a wonderful stay. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Taglio9
Reviews.Content: Our family got exactly what we wanted from the Arizona Grand, a no-hassle long weekend in good weather. The options for pool and water park were just what our 8 and 5 year old kids wanted to do for a couple of days and my husband and I were able to relax in the sunshine and watch them play. Are the rooms completely up to date? No. Are the TVs perfect? No. But we didn't come to Arizona to sit in our rooms and watch TV, so we didn't care. The food service to the pool is not gourmet but the prices aren't too steep either. Bottom line, if you want an easy family vacation this is the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable hotel, terrible staff no customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Bmache
Reviews.Content: The water park is a great family attraction. Grounds are nice and rooms are clean (although clearly outdated. Televisions produce so much static they cannot be watched). Staff avoids work and takes the easy way out. They often seem like they are more interested in socializing with each other than their jobs. Food was okay, but overpriced. That is fair in my mind for a resort. Day three we returned at 4:30 to a room that had not been made up and had no clean towels or sheets. Horrible way to end a day trip. Called the front desk and got the run around from inexperienced employees. No apologies. Finally got a hold of a smug manager named Ryan who offered no apologies, explanation or an acceptable solution. I do not consider vochers to their own 200% mark up restaurants a solution. These employees, especially managers, have little knowledge of proper hospitality. He was smug and refused to admit that a room should have been turned over by 4:30. In fact, he acknowledged they usually aim to be done by then but often fail and guests should have no expectations unless they specifically request a time. If you're looking for a water park and expensive pool food (a lot of families are) this is your place. If you are looking for relaxation and hospitality, stay away. We are here for two more days and are unlikely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury but... cost effective !”
Reviews.Author: Riccardo C
Reviews.Content: My family (two adults and a child 11 years old) stayed three nights in August 2011. The weather was very hot, but there was plenty of pools and water games to chill out and have fun with my kid. Rooms and services stand up for high-levels standards, and the three restaurants available at the complex add up to the fun experience. We enjoyed a special discount rate, that gave us 100 bucks a day to spend in hotel premises (spa, restaurants, bar, etc.) and that's a great way to lower vacation's expenses. Phoenix city centre and museum are a bit distant, but the hotel is near a freeways intersection, so you can reach without hassle in a minutethe road to your favourite destination. All in all a great place to stay for a few days, maybe annoying for a longer period. Riccardo Corbetta

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: mac1962
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference. The special conference rate was $260/ night. I got it on Hotwire for $149/ night, which is just as well. The room was nice but the restaurant had variable service. It was never busy but staff was always frantic. You have a great view of the South Mountains and the grounds are nice, but you can't walk anywhere from here- the road outside the main gate is 6 lanes of the finest traffic Phoenix can produce. It's a mixed bag at best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little bit sneaky”
Reviews.Author: MMMMmmm_or_not
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time BUT be very careful...My husband had booked a room here through a travel agency for a work trip to a conference. When we arrived they showed a rate $60 more per night than what our information showed. Despite good documentation from the travel agency showing the rate and even the name of that particular type of rate, the desk person told us she is unable to make any changes to the rate that shows up in the computer. She instructed us to call someone else so they could explain it. I finally had to ask her, "Who do you think we are going to call...someone else who works here? Your supervisor? I don't know who can take care of this." At that point she told us to call the person in charge of the conference or the travel agency so they could tell us that we don't have the correct rate. Luckily another employee came over at this point, looked at our info, and said that a supervisor could help. She took the things into the back and came out a few minutes later with things corrected the lower rate. I don't know if they were really trying to sneak in a higher rate or just suffer from the bad combo of making a real mistake and giving their employees no empowerment to help customers. While staying there we did have a nice time. Use of the water park was included in the stay and was lots of fun. Hiking trails were pretty. The rooms are a bit dated but ours was clean except for the mini-bar fridge which was filthy. The fitness center had plenty of machines but it is an older system with only three tvs mounted in a central location. You use a radio to tune in to the one you want to listen to. The choices were CNN, Fox news, or Sports. Outdoor spaces with fire pits were cozy. To be honest it was fine but unless I got some kind of AMAZING deal I would not choose this for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: thornhill2009
Reviews.Content: I was with a friend for a short golf holiday to the Phoenix area and one of he courses I picked was the course at the Arizona Grand Resort. The only decent part of the course was the back nine, there were quite a few interesting desert type holes. The front nine however for the most part reminded me of a cheap municipal course that you might find anywhere. Also the practice range was terrible, it was a very small area and they had kind of sponge type balls which were really a waste of time hit. If you go to this place to play don't count on getting in any practice. Even the practice putting green was a joke, it was beside the first tee off area and the putting green was small and had but 3 holes on it. When I was there, there were about 12 people all trying to practice their putting with but the 3 holes! Besides the back nine which was decent, the only other plus for this place was their brunc h which was nice. The room was very pleasant with a nice view towards the golf course and the food selections were pretty good. Overall if you are mainly going for golf, my recommendation would be to find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Old Resort...Rooms NEED updating”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebee-travels
Reviews.Content: This resort is out of the way, not close to the areas we wanted to see. 30 minutes from downtown Phoenix where the restaurants & shops were as well as 30 minutes to Scottsdale. If you want a quiet get away in a quiet resort, and you don't care about how your room looks or that the mattresses are super old, then this might be for you. BUT the rooms are FAR from 4 or 5 star rooms. They are old, and the upholstery on the furniture & the carpets are terrible & dirty. I spent as little time as possible in the room. When we first checked in they gave us a room in the Camelback building and we had no patio or view, then they upgraded us, if that's what you call it, to another room in the Camelback with a patio right by the water park. My biggest complaint was the conditions of the room. VERY DIRTY!!!! I was creeped out by the black stained carpets...IKES!!! Oh and the mattresses are so old that you sink to the centre of the bed. Terrible sleep. The entrance of the hotel and the common areas were lovely & inviting and it had a beautiful golf course on the property. We enjoyed the adult pool but there was NO service at all at the pool. It was BYO everything. The resort had a lovely coffee shop that served Starbucks & some made daily amazing gelato.Word of caution if you were in a hurry in the morning you would have to come very early or pass as the line up every morning was a bit long and time consuming. They were quite understaffed, many mornings only one person trying to take care of every one. To sum it up, I got thru the 10 day stay, but have no plans to ever stay there again. If we could have left sooner we would have...very disappointing as it looked so beautiful online and when we were driving up to the hotel we were so thrilled but the rooms are definitely 2 stars....as well at the end of your stay you have to pay another $35/day(including taxes) resort fee for being there, no internet was included for that, you had to pay another $15/day for that. On the positive side, you are away from the hustle bustle, a beautiful golf course on the property, a water park, hiking right there from your resort to the South Mountain. The rooms are well insulated and very quiet, now if only they could get some new carpets, mattresses and furniture. This hotel has GREAT potential, but needs some $$$ put into it.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Fee $$$$$$ "Must Go"”
Reviews.Author: ABQGolferGal
Reviews.Content: The resort is gorgeous; staff is courteous; rooms are decorated nicely but for the "old" TV's. Luv'd the "Family Oriented" touch and the Golf course is a Golfer's paradise! However, a $40.00 resort fee is truly unreasonable which is added daily --that should be reviewed and modified. Not many folks impressed when told of the rise in resort fees/costs. Then you have a 23% tax added to "everything" is very confusing because it is not to deliver your beverages or for room services but to bring it from point A to point B. The percentage does not go to the wait staff that is an additional gratuity "fee". The Hotel staff are wonderful hard-working people doing such a great job! We spent an additional $300. just on "fees". Which should have gone toward another massage or a day of Golf... Enjoyed our stay but for those crazy, pesky bundle of fees that add up quickly does not allow me to leave completely satisfied but instead to rethink my next visit. #AvidGolfer

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for any occasion”
Reviews.Author: Eric C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location twice within the past year for business and cannot compliment this location enough for its professionalism and enjoyable atmosphere. The resort is also gorgeous. Although I have only stayed for business, I plan on vacationing with my family here very soon. The resort has everything you need from great restaurants on location, a water park, fitness center, business center and a gorgeous golf course. I highly recommend this resort to anyone staying in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing (ignore the 'complaint' reviews..)”
Reviews.Author: Meg A
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful resort. Everything on the resort was manicured to perfection! The lobby hotel was beautiful with a lovely restaraunt with an amazing patio out looking the golf course. There is a starbuck in the lobby (YES!) which had plenty of food like cereal etc. The staff were very polite and I found the house cleaning to be AMAZING! they vacuumed every day, washed out bathroom floors, clean, washed sheets every day. The even swept the balcony. Now for these people finding a reason to be CHEAP and COMPLAIN about everything. It's called fine print, read it and it says there is a resort fee... much like ALL resorts. $40 per room a night is really nothing.... it is not the hotels fault if you do not use the wifi etc. which is included in this fee. The water park is amazing, with a wave pool and my favorie; a Lazy River Run. Great location (close to Arizona Mills in which a shuttle will take you there... for FREE) My only complaint is that the TVs in the room were dated...

Reviews.Title: “Hidden resort fee”
Reviews.Author: krbecker1
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a trip through southwest vacation online for my husband and I, To Phoenix AZ we stayed at the Arizona Grand hotel . Our confirmation stated paid in full. No where in our reservation documentation did it state that we would have to pay an additional $203.88 resort fee upon arrival at the resort. This hidden fee was very disheartening to us. After arriving at the hotel and being made aware of this fee we tried to discuss this matter with several mangers and came up with nothing but arrogance by some managers we were told that we had to pay the fee. One manager stated that he would look into it and would get back to us, when my husband spoke with him again he stated that he was waiting for a phone call back from the booking agent from the resort we never heard back from him again. We spoke to another manager and she stated that it was a resort fee and we just had to pay it. We travel frequently and have never encountered hidden resort fees. Most 4 star resorts will include the resort fee in the price of the room. When a reservation states paid in full that is what the consumer expects. It seems that you must always read the fine print. A lesson learned. After we returned home we contacted the resort by e-mail we spoke with a person named Nathen who explained where we should have looked on the web site to see the fee's . I then sent the following email to Mr. nathen;"I did find this fee after following your directions how ever it states ( Resort fee is $25 plus tax per night, except during the season when the Waterpark is open (see below for Waterpark schedule and fee, subject to change). so help me understand why I was charged $30.00 a night plus tax when the water park was not open". He replied; " Good Morning Ms. Becker, The resort fee pricing had just changed as of February 17th however we did honor the resort fee amount that previously existed for anyone that made their reservations prior to our changeover. I do realize that in your case it was not a benefit in doing so. We would be happy to refund you the difference as described below: Date You Paid New Difference 02/12 30 25 -5 02/13 30 25 -5 02/14 30 25 -5 02/15 30 25 -5 02/16 30 25 -5 02/17 30 40 +10 Total $15 Owed Please let me know if there are any other questions or concerns and I would be happy to assist. Best regards, Nathan Smith Amazing first I get hit with a resort fee that I did not expect then after locating it on the web site. I find out they over charged me any way. I will not be re visiting the Arazona grand again. Which is to bad. because I really enjoyed the golf course and the grounds were beautiful. You know the 200 dollars was not the issue if i would have known there was a fee I would have paided it if i really wanted to stay a place. the problem is I don't like when I feel taken advantage of. we travel to phoenix every year in Feb to golf .

Reviews.Title: “Very fun stay at the Arizona Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: ontheroaddave
Reviews.Content: It is a great place for a family of 5. We spent 3 nights for a quick getaway. We were there for some sun and family fun and it fit the bill perfectly. The staff was friendly, the facilities were in great shape. The spring deal on their website was good with no surprises. We weren't there to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Resort Fee increase!”
Reviews.Author: SCBeachGal
Reviews.Content: First off, I'll start by saying that this was our sixth visit to Arizona Grand Resort (going back to the days of Pointe South Mountain Resort) and we really enjoy the place. We try and take our boys once a year and they absolutely love the waterpark. My husband and I like the resort and the Phoenix weather. This trip was also great - we had requested a hospitality suite (for a second bathroom) and that wasn't available, so they upgraded us to a one bedroom villa suite for a nominal upgrade fee. The suite was large, clean, luxurious and very close to the water park. Overall our stay was great, with very good service and meals. Our only complaint was the increase in the resort fee. When we booked (about a month ago), our reservation referenced a $30 resort fee, which we had paid on previous visits. However, when we checked out, our bill included a $40 per night resort fee. When I inquired, I was told that the fee had recently increased (to include wi-fi internet they said). This wasn't mentioned when we checked in (although I'll assume it was on the paperwork I initialed when checking in). In response to pointing out that our reservation quoted the $30 per night resort fee, we were told that the fine print on the reservation gave them the ability to change the fee any time they wished. This was a huge let down after our great stay. Based on the considerable amount we had spent at the resort, the $10 increase was insignificant, but a slap in the face. We'll probably end up going back next year, but right now I feel that the $40 per night resort fee is out of control and the manner in which it was increased was not up to the standards we have come to expect from this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Arizona Grand”
Reviews.Author: Janethallwong
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous 3 night getaway at the Arizona Grand over President's Weekend. Sure, it was a little chilly at night (it WAS February), but the grounds were nice, the pool was warm and there were a lot of other nice touches. We were upgraded to a nicer room and it was very spacious. The TVs were a little older than we're used to, but who needs TVs on vacation. The gym was nice as well. In all, I would highly recommend the hotel and DO have dinner at the Rustler's Rooste - it's a kick!

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand.”
Reviews.Author: Sallybess
Reviews.Content: We had an okay stay. The room was relatively clean, even though housekeeping did minimal-- and that means no sweeping in the bathroom, job on the 2nd and 3rd days. Carpet was gross. There was actually peeling paint on our room's walls. The TVs were a joke for the caliber of resort this is supposed to be. The bathroom was minuscule. The pool was cool, but they were silly about checking people. Who is going to sneak in to use a pool when it is 65 degrees out? The rooms on the first floor were very dark and it was very easy to hear our neighbors next door and their children even though I don't think they were overly loud. So, we weren't impressed and will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “almost a resort”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1869
Reviews.Content: The facilities were nice, most of the staff was nice. The restaurant Sunday buffet staff was not very accommodating. We had to speak to the manager in order to get coffee while we waited for a table, after we were told that Starbucks could get us coffee. The manager did get us seated right away in the bar area and we were able to get served without the 40 minute wait. It would have been nice if the staff had thought of this and not force us to complain to the Hotel manager. No vending machines of any kind (snack or otherwise) on site, which forced us to walk to the gift shop & spend $3 for a bottle of Pepsi (no coke products were available). Televisions in the room were old and the 13" TV in the bedroom was too small to see from the bed. Overall the property was older, but beautiful and the grounds kept nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, shoddy business practices”
Reviews.Author: photomikey
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, good service - the water park was outstanding. A $40 (yes, FOURTY DOLLAR) resort fee that applies to every room is excessive. If it applies to every room - it's not a fee, it's part of the rate. They are only making it a fee so their rate looks better on the booking sites - then gouge you for $40/day at the hotel. I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Grand's Oasis Water Park is Great”
Reviews.Author: swilson628
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand is situated very close to South Mountain and has great views of the desert vistas. While the rooms are a bit dated, but clear. The Oasis Water Park is great. The wave pool and water features are great for families with kids. The kids literally spent the entire day out by the pools. 25 person hot tub, a wave pool, lazy river and great slides are big hits with the kids and teens and the water park is for guests only. Even when the weather is hot, it is crowded and very popular. The restaurants are great. I love Aunt Chiladas (Mexican) and the Rustler's Rooste (Steaks and Western cuisine). The gulf course is beautiful as well. The location is close to Arizona Mills Mall and other attractions. Freeway access is close by. I recommend for families visiting Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but dated”
Reviews.Author: Mark1206
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here recently and overall the property was OK. The rooms are a little dated, like taking a trip back to the late 1990s. Bath faucet dripped constantly, wasting precious water. Two old box-style TVs. Very outdated elevator broke down for a day. Conference rooms and exhibition hall were well-accommodating for the 1,000 attendees. I marked this "wheelchair accessible" but to avoid all the stairways you really have to go out of your way to get to where you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: Kent S
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at this resort and found it a decent place. Was surprized that the room was a bit dated. Two TV's in the room but no flat screens. I've stayed in much lower priced joints and they have flat screens. Bed slept well and noise was very minimal from either adjoining rooms or outdoors. The waterpark was closed for seasonal maintenance so I can't report on that. The overall size of the resort makes the distances between some of the amentities quite large.Be ready to walk. Staff was very courteous and pleasant. One item that consistently confuses me is a high-end resort/hotel's need to charge for wifi when hotels costing much less have this included. They're nightly rates are significant higher and then they nickel and dime you with wifi costs.

Reviews.Title: “I definitaly want to go back to Phoenix but not the AGR.”
Reviews.Author: Livin_Lovin_Life
Reviews.Content: Being a business traveler, I have become accustomed to certain amenities found in newer or remodeled hotels. My room was a spacious suite. The furnishings in the living area were outdated and not very comfortable. No flat screen TV's in this joint! The faucet in the bathtub dripped constantly. The wet bar, which I was told I had access to, was locked and I was not given a key (not the biggest deal but still noteworthy). The grounds are huge and well kept! I found the citrus trees on the site charming. The resort is huge and tries to accommodate their guests by offering chauffeured golf carts to drive you to and from locations on the resort. But, the waits were sometimes lengthy. The conference center was very nice. No complaints here. And the staff were very friendly and helpful. One of the attributes of this resort that I was most excited about was it's proximity to the nature preserve and it's hiking trails. A friend and I attempted a hike but found the directions to the trail confusing and ended up going for a walk along the street instead. :( I tried to take advantage of the onsite spa so I scheduled a massage. Because of changing schedules I was forced to cancel my appointment. What they failed to tell me upon scheduling was that there was a $40 cancellation fee. If you call to cancel within 12 hrs of your appointment you're charged $40! Advanced notice would have been nice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting but in need of makeover”
Reviews.Author: a p
Reviews.Content: This resort came highly recommended but fell short in many areas. The complex I was in (Sedona) was very far from the reception and fitness center. The suites are decent size but bathroom cramped with chipped porcelain. Bathtub drains were very slow and probably clogged. Maintenence was told but never resolved. Bedroom TV older and remote quit working. The lighting in the catwalk to get access to room was very dark and there was no lighting near my door. Best bet is Camelback complex which is closer to everything and ask if the room has been upgraded. Staff assitstance was patchy. This is such a beautiful setting and good location near AZ Mills outlet mall and many chain restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Okay resort”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort for an international meeting. The place is huge, and not nearby anywhere at walking distance, so if you want to eat at a place that is not the expensive restaurants on the premises, you need to have a car. The same goes is you want to do some shopping (with the exception of a Fry's electronics across the street). The place has very impressive grounds, water park and golf course. The rooms seemed spacious, comfortable and clean, although the buildings seemed in need of urgent updates. Be prepared to pay for extras like WiFi and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful buildings and surroundings; great staff”
Reviews.Author: Gerbilator
Reviews.Content: Very striking venue, with huge grounds; lovely decor and very relaxed atmosphere where we quickly felt very relaxed. Rooms quiet spacious with good facilities - though the TVs are cathode-ray museum-pieces with pretty poor reception ! Extras like wi-fi, on-demand films and breakfast were pricey - was glad I was on a business trip, so was shielded from the impact of these.... Staff generally very friendly, esp. in the bar and coffee shop. They also helped us deal with hire-car arrangements, via their business link with Enterprise, which saved us bother at the airport. Food for routine meals was, well, routine, but at the special receptions was pretty good. Overall, perfectly good if a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Resort”
Reviews.Author: KareninColorado
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort in January 2012 for 5 nights. I was attending a conference at the resort as well. Regarding the rooms, the fact that there are two rooms (one a living area and one a bedroom) was nice. I was on the first floor. The room was dark as there really was no way for a lot of light to be filtered inside. I did park close to the room as the resort did not seem full. The room just seemed a little "tired". Old tvs that were pretty small. The fact that the bathroom was literally in the bedroom wasn't great either. While the resort's grounds seemed very well maintained, the convention space itself is extremely confusing to maneuver around. I heard that repeatedly from my fellow attendees. It's spread out and hard to figure out. I wish that the snack area that appears to have been in he conference center was still open as you can't find a soda machine anywhere nearby. The main lobby area did seem to have a nice store/deli type of area. It was always closed when I was in the area and I did hear a few people say it was very expensive, but at least they had it as an option. Overall, I wouldn't come back to stay at this resort for a vacation. It was okay for what I was there for, but again I wish the convention space was more organized. The water park did look cool, but it wasn't open in January. I think that there are many other great options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand has the best service I have ever had. Our room was very clean every day of our 4 day stay. I thought the value was excellent. There were plenty of options to eat and we tried them all, Each one was fantastic. My wife and I played 4 rounds of golf and the course could not have been in better shape. This is the place to go in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable room but a few hiccups along the way”
Reviews.Author: elaineboorstein
Reviews.Content: My husband was here on a business trip, but since my daughter's birthday was to occur during this time we decided to come along to spend some time as a family. The room was very comfortable. Luckily, we got a room on the fifth floor overlooking the (closed) water park, so it was quiet and provided a lovely view. My nine year old would have loved access to the water park, but I had read that it wouldn't be open so she was prepared for that. The pools were very nice and there were some very nice sun decks that we enjoyed. We went to Rustlers Roost for my daughter's birthday, and we all enjoyed our evening there. Very nice steak, pretty good sides, and a fun atmosphere. Our only real let down was signing up for horseback riding. This was my daughter's special birthday treat. We called in advance and requested transportation to the stables. The car never showed up and after about 45 minutes and a inquiring with the concierge several times, we gave up. Grant it, the stable service is not part of the Arizona Grand, but it was a big let down. The concierge was apologetic, and I do understand it was out of her control, but it was disappointing. If you have something that is to be the highlight of your trip, make sure not to save it until the last day.

Reviews.Title: “The facilities are very nice but the staff need to take a happy pill”
Reviews.Author: scrambler329
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we checked into a nice suite room. Nice room and facilities were top notch. The bellman and the concierge could have used some positive energy. In fact compared to other places in the Phoenix area I felt the staff here was less enthusiastic then most. The internet fee here was 15 bucks and was not included in the resort fee. The food at the lobby grill was average for a higher end hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Going back!”
Reviews.Author: Sd12_316
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a 3 day conference and we were very happy with the accommodations. We booked online and requested to be near our relatives that were also attending the conference. Not only did they have us next door to each other, we were conveniently situated close to the meeting place. It is a huge facility but properly maintained and beautiful. My husband and I are training for a marathon, and it was great that we were able to continue our training during our stay running the trails by the hotel as well as around the property. The gym or fitness center was also an added bonus. Unfortunately, we weren't able to experience the water park located on property grounds because we came off-season. Nevertheless, our kids enjoyed swimming in the pool and going to Arizona Mills, an outlet mall that's down the street from the hotel. In summary, the hotel is in a great location, the rooms were clean and spacious with plenty of drawers and storage space, friendly staff, and lots to do. We definitely are going back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Fiesta Bowl trip”
Reviews.Author: kylaandryan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with another couple for New Year's Eve and the Fiesta Bowl. We had a pretty good experience and I would recommend this place. I'd like to see what it's like in the summer. This is a very large resort with a great golf course (we didn't play) and lots of options for pools/hot tubs and the water park. We had one of the standard suites with 2 queen beds and pullout sofa bed. Location: Really easy to get to from the airport (less than 10 mins) and pretty quick drive to Mill Avenue in Tempe (15 min). The Mills outlet mall was just down the road. If you're in town for a Cardinals game or the Fiesta bowl it takes about 30 minutes to get to Glendale. We took a towncar from the hotel and it was $84. Scottsdale is about 20 minutes away. Service: Bell service was fantastic. The lobby was very crowded on NYE and we went down for a cab and it didn't take long at all. The resort has SUVs and cars on hand so when the cabs weren't coming fast enough they brought those out to transport guests to their New Year destination (we went to the block party in Tempe). Bell service also did a really great job getting us transportation to Glendale when we missed our bus. Good experience with wait staff as well. Main complaint was with the cleaning of the rooms. We were still in our room when the cleaning staff came one day (around noon) and we requested they come when we left in the next hour. They did not return until the next morning when we were back in the room so we didn't have a clean room for 2 days in a row. We ran out of towels and toilet paper and it was annoying but was a small issue. Food/drink: We ate breakfast a few of the days and liked the breakfast buffet. The made-to-order omelettes were really good but I did think the price was pretty high ($17/person). We hung out in the lobby bar a few times and ordered the pulled pork nachos and those were also really good! It was late at night so I wasn't expecting much and they were great. Grounds/pools: Really pretty golf course and a nice sitting area right outside the lobby overlooking the course. Good pools and hot tubs close to the rooms. We didn't try the water park but it looks really cool if you have kids. I wish I would've walked around the grounds a little earlier. The last night I walked around and realized there were some neat seating areas outside, between some of the buildings, that had chairs and firepits for talking and lounging. Looked like a fun place to hang out, have a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: truewallace
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Arizona Grand for work/play during the Fiesta Bowl. Not only was this resort very comfortable, but the staff was gracious and helpful at every turn. It sits, like most Phoenix resorts, on a lovely golf course and each suite location has at least two pools and hot tubs. There is a water park for the kids that is included in the resort fees. I also enjoyed the Spa facilities. The aestheticians and massage therapists were all very professional and highly skilled. The facilities were all very well maintained and beautiful. The rooms were a wee bit dated...but always very clean and tidy. Roomservice was exceptional. The location of this resort was also very convenient as it is fairly centrally located. I had a lot of business in Scottsdale and then of course the Fiesta Bowl was at the Cardinal Stadium in Glendale. This hotel was about 30 minutes from each area so very convenient for my business needs. The only thing I really was disappointed with was that the Wi-Fi in your room isn't included in the "resort fee". To me...that is something that should be included and not tacked on at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: osucowboy1980
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The resort is well maintained and is quite large (I wished I could have played the golf course but we traveled with friends who do not play golf). We stayed in the Sedona suites and it had several pools which were quite nice. The resort is just off of I-10 so it has easy access to all highways. The rooms are very clean and have nice beds to sleep on (very comfortable). As noted in other reviews the TV's are small . Overall, the place is very quite and restful. The rooms open up to a courtyard with pools and trees. We stayed for the bowl game and had the resort fee included with our room rate (alumni association deal). Would not think that the resort fee would be a good value in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun!”
Reviews.Author: hdhendrix
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort over Spring Break in 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Our kids had an absolute blast at the water park and loved watching the movie in the evening while floating in the pool. We found the overall environment of the resort to be very nice and the accommodations were excellent. The staff was very helpful and attentive to the questions that we had.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Merry61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort while attending the Fiesta Bowl, and we were very impressed. We would definitely go back sometime when the weather is warmer and we could take advantage of the water park. This was January, and they had fire pits set up outside, and they were too popular for us to ever get a seat, but it looked like grand fun. We enjoyed the bar and played pool...without quarters...so that was a fun family activity. We never ate there, but the staff was exceptional. The main reason we chose the resort is that the golf course was on site. Shopping and restaurants were within a mile or two.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: HWKbc
Reviews.Content: This is a very large resort that is sprawled out with different suites. We stayed in the Cambelback suites which is closer to the main lobby and water park. There is a resort fee that is tacked on and we were lucky enough that the water park was opened for the New Years weekend so at least felt we got something out of the resort fee. This resort offers golf, bike rentals, a jogging trail, golf and a spa. There are also a handful of pools to choose from if the water park is closed. The rooms and grounds were kept very clean and the staff is extremely friendly. I agree they could update the tv's but that is not really a complaint for me. The beds are extremely comfortable but do not consider the sofa bed a bed! Very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: djbls
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful! So much to offer and lots of outdoor seating areas. Lots to do! Beautiful views of the golf course and the city. Great hiking trail and beautiful spa.

Reviews.Title: “Must be better places in pheonix in the winter”
Reviews.Author: Ssk09
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a conference in December. I'm sure it would be a different place when the oasis is open and as other people mention the $30 charge for resort facilities is outrageous when the main facility is closed. They do offer a shuttle to the mall but in reality yo could walk it it's so close. The hiking trail is uninteresting. The rooms are fine but not fantastic, spacious rather than comfortable with an undersized bath for some reason. You can get people to drive you to restaurants around the resort in a buggy but really it's not ideal unless you are prepared to walk as nothing is close to hand. As a summer resort for families I'm sure it's great, but for a hotel while on business I would avoid

Reviews.Title: “lobby bar is the place to eat.”
Reviews.Author: tonilynne221
Reviews.Content: The lobby bar has fatastic food. Try the fish tacos. Yum. The bartender is so friendly. She made me feel welcomed. The bell service was very prompt. I was not impressed by the room service food, but the lobby restaurant had a great breakfast. My room was very clean. The one thing this resort needs is better outside lighting. The walkways were too dark.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Smilesalot
Reviews.Content: Exceptional staff at the Grand. Our room was very spacious and super comfortable bed! I was disappointed that they still charge a full 30 a day resort fee when the Water park isn't even open. There should have been a reduction on that. Yes they include a shuttle to the Arizona Mills Outlet Mall but it's a couple of minutes drive away and I had a rental car at that. The resort fee also includes the fitness center and classes but I didn't get to use it as I had a pinched nerve. I just feel that the resort fee should be optional. It is unfortunate that the hotel also charges extra for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Stay at the Arizon Grand”
Reviews.Author: Seanie_pc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Arizon Grand Resort for a week on business in March. This was an all round very good stay. I found the location to be excellent, convient to Sky Harbor Airport and to downtown Phoenix. Arizona mills shopping mall is also mere minutes away, great for picking up thoes last minute gifts. I found the room to be an excellent size and very comfortable and clean. Most of my time was spent on business but when I did enjoy the resturaunts and bar and I was very happy with both the food and servce. In fact for me overall it was the servce that did it for me. Nothing was too much for the staff and anything I needed was looked after. As it was March the water park was open but from what I did see it looks like it would be a great sport for familys. . The conference facilites was excellent, from room size to layouts and the quality of the food served. Not only would I recommend this as an excellent choice as a vacation spot for families I wouild also recommend as a great business choice for conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and overnight staycation”
Reviews.Author: Punkinfamily
Reviews.Content: We live about 40 miles from the resort but we stayed over night for a wedding. The service and staff were exceptional from arrival to departure. The wedding was amazing from the ceremony to the reception. Included in the wedding room rate were 4 water park passes which we used the day after the wedding. We had so much fun we ended up staying until closing. Overall I cannot wait to return to the resort for another family staycation.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: keri k
Reviews.Content: we only stay here when we visit arizona. It is always clean and the staff is excellent. In the summer the waterpark is the best. Dont go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend!”
Reviews.Author: student813
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a condo for the weekend and the room was wonderful. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were extremely clean. The ceilings were high and the rooms were spacious. Having the two separate rooms, bedroom and family room, was fantastic. Having a place to hangout was fun. We had a great balcony view filled with wonderful landscape. We spent the afternoon at the waterpark and had a great time on the slides, in the lazy river, and laying by the pool. The food served on the property is reasonable and delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort amenities in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Gwenbry
Reviews.Content: We came to visit our nephew a college student. The location is great about 15 minutes from airport and immediately off the baseline exit of hwy 10. We stayed in a king suite room with a pullout sleeper Room extremely clean quiet. The grounds landscaped beautifully with fountains. Pool and hot tub very nice. A nice gift shop , concierge services and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Not Horrible, But Not Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: LittleByrdieMom
Reviews.Content: I came to the resort for a business conference and was very unimpressed with the room. The tvs in the room were small and outdated. The remote didn't work and when I called to get it replaced, they were prompt to respond. However, the replacement remote only worked part of the time. The bathtub was clearly not cleaned well because there was hair on the walls of the shower and on the floor of the tub. It also appeared that the room hadn't been swept well because I found stuff on the floor while walking around the room. Gross! The room itself was tired and outdated. The refrigerator in the room couldn't keep our food cold enough and I was thoroughly annoyed that we had to empty it in order to use it. They would have charged to empty it for me. $35, I believe. There was no microwave and that is always an issue while traveling with children. I expect a suite to have the minimum essentials! Overall, the service staff were excellent and I had no complaints there. However, the amenities were an issue. I brought my family with me and the resort is clearly not meant for young kids. My child is 3 and we had issues keeping him entertained because the waterpark was closed during the week and there is nothing else to do for him on property. In Arizona, it's usually still 90-100 degrees in October. (I'm a native Arizonan.) There are other pools scattered about the property but some of the pools were locked before they were supposed to be closed. They also charge an outrageous resort fee whether you plan to use the amenities or not. The conference center itself was also tired in appearance and some of the breakout rooms were located in sections of the conference center that badly needed work. The snacks provided for the conference were often short by a lot and some of the meals did not have enough options for those with allergies. However, the chocolate flourless torte that was served Monday evening was the best I have had since going gluten-free. Even better than Disney! The food overall was very good. The wireless internet, that wasn't free, was down a lot. The instructions in the notebook were not exactly clear either as to how to logon the first time. Thankfully I was able to figure it out. There isn't a soda machine or a vending machine that we could find on the property, so plan to bring your own "supplies" if you do go to this resort. Because this was off-season, the little food stands were closed and the only way to get a drink was to go to one of their restaurants or order room service. I wasn't about to do that for just a soda or even a glass of water. Again, the staff was wonderful and I can't complain. It's more of a resort for adults than even teenagers and as someone who lives here, I can't even justify paying a reduced rate to stay there during the summer. Our timeshare up the street has better amenities and has cleaner rooms for considerably less money. As I said, it wasn't a horrible stay but it wasn't outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but great things to say about this resort!”
Reviews.Author: ilvmt
Reviews.Content: Great reviews for this hotel. When making our plans, the reservation staff was so helpful answering all my questions. Once we arrived, the gal at the front desk was very accommodating with our room. We had a rental car but the shuttle service they have is a great perk, didnt like the $15/day wifi fee so we didnt use that. We arrived on a Saturday around 2pm so the kids only had 2 hours to use the waterpark. We had plans on Sunday for a football game so we werent able to use it at all for that day. I do wish the park was open during the week so we could have enjoyed it more. We stayed in the Sedona and loved the 2 pools and they had long hours to enjoy. Overall, the hotel was super quiet and the beds were so comfortable. Not many people there it seemed, lots of other Steelers fans which was why we were there. There was a large group of 500 for a conference that arrived on Monday but the resort is so large it wasnt crowded at all. Our room was always clean when returning in the afternoon and we didnt care much about the small, older tv since we werent there to watch tv. I had a spa treatment with Melanie who was so wonderful. I do wish there was a colder fridge and a microwave in the room, but the staff did mention we could use the mini bar fridge to store some items. The resort was clean and well maintained, hoping we can return again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gr8greta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work retreat and was thoroughly impressed with the amenities, service, cleanliness, and overall environment.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: embargo
Reviews.Content: I typically start these reviews off with a brief description of my check-in experience however; my experience was so smooth not sure there is much that can be said, but maybe sense I cannot resist, the check-in experience was very quick, easy, and did I say smooth. Overall the resort is huge, so big, they shuttle you to your room on golf carts. If you are going to stay, you must stay in the Villas, they are bigger, newer, and central to all things, golf, oasis water park, and confernce center. I am giving the resort four stars only because the refrigerator in my room was very loud at night and it made it very difficult to get some sleep. I didn't take the family, but certainly would if I every return as it seem like a very family friendly resort. The internet access was adequate as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort that is a getaway feel that is around the corner”
Reviews.Author: jjaminaz
Reviews.Content: I love that my family can visit a beautiful resort at an amazing value that is located nearby. The staff was very professional, attentive especially the front desk staff. Very clean and very comfortable beds!!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the Arizona Grand as a FAMILY resort.”
Reviews.Author: Leah-Real
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand is a great family resort. We enjoy bringing our family for a staycation once a year (4 years in a row) to stay and play in the Oasis Water Park. They have one regular water slide and two drop off water slides, a lazy river, wave pool, kiddie pool and volley ball pool. Durning the summer the Oasis hours are 8am - 10pm and in the evenings they offer a swim in movie, a dj and dancing. In the "winter" months the hours are 11am - 4pm so be sure to inquire on the hours when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Not a true resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bhale11
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at AGR and there is nothing resort about thus place!! We are a group of 7 women who wanted to escape and lay by the pool, well what they don't tell you us that their main attraction (the oasis pool and waterpark) is only open on saturday!!! So here we are without a car and there is only a "family pool" open! So that means no service, no snack bar no drinks nothing!! To top it off the sign in front of the watermark say they were open from 11-4 today a gate was open and so we went in then a security guard came in and told us we were trespassing!!!!! Choose a different resort if you are looking to relax by the pool!!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE THE AZ GRAND!!!!”
Reviews.Author: prdmommyof2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and had a wonderful time both times!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Duke042
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand is no resort. Average rooms with poor amenities. A washroom so small you need to open the door to turn around. Dirty pool and dusty unkept common areas. The real problem is no one seems to care. The focus of the hotel seems to be the corporate client including weddings, meetings and time share. The hotel guest is treated as an inconvenience to the staff. There is a $30 daily resort fee which doesn't include internet. The water park was opened for only 5 hours per day on the weekend. Of course private parties could rent is all night, but not for guests. Breakfast at the hotel is around $12 for eggs and $4 for coffee. Really?? We almost hit or got hit by the golf carts that tear around the resort day and evening. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “This Time Kinda So-So”
Reviews.Author: Jeff B
Reviews.Content: Being from Tucson, we have stayed at the AGR numerous times. This last time however... They upgraded our room due to booking, which was nice. We stayed at The Villas, located near the waterpark. Upon going to our room we noticed a pile of cups, glasses, used limes, etc next to the ice machine. They remained there until our deparure two days later on a Sunday afternoon. The same with our towels we put outside our door for housekeeping. Can't say the same for the freezer in our little frig - obviously housekeeping is not in charge of defrosting it as it was literally unusable due to so much ice build-up. The stairwells don't get checked by maintenance either. Two or three step lights made it very hard to see at night, let alone an emergency. The lamp next to the bed didn't work - no biggie - cord was unplugged. These are all small things, but it does make one take notice how little daily attention the place gets. The lazy river was fine as usual. I have to agree with another reviewer, unless it was coincidence. Twice we almost hit service carts - one actually u-turned right in front of our car without looking. Guess our car runs too quiet. The one thing that continues to gripe and amaze me is how they have the audacity to charge you a resort fee on top of your room rate. No newspaper was ever delivered as stated, and worse, they insist on charging you $14.95 per day for - Wi-Fi use??? Oh please, it's 2011. I can go to a McDonalds and get a hot spot for free nowadays for criminey sakes. If it wouldn't be for the waterpark, I would not have given them our money for this long. Oh yeah, if you crave pizza we founf a place not far from the resort called Oregano's...but that's another review!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Resort in Arizona”
Reviews.Author: Julia T
Reviews.Content: 1. Dirty and out dated rooms. 2. Poor Service and resturants. 3. Shuttle drivers(scary/ very bad drivers. 4. Over charge Credit Cards.

Reviews.Title: “Not a "resort" by any means, except maybe price.”
Reviews.Author: Adrianas6
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the 4th of July weekend for a family member's big birthday bash. It was a fun weekend, but there were some highly dissapointing points. Honestly... it might have been a total bust as a location if it weren't for the water park. But even then, for the price, I'm not sure it was worth it. This trip began with said family member booking the rooms, which he understood as being 2 bedrooms (they were not, they were two beds in a room), which led to having to get an extra room. We all dealt fine, but you could see it was a bit of a dissapointment and embarrasment to them to have to find another room at the literal last minute to make everyone comfy. Well.. comfy if you have a bed, anyway. Some of the kids in different rooms used the sleeper sofa. After one night, a few of them begged for other family's couch cushions, so they could just sleep on the floor. Upon inspection of our sleeper after the complaint of the beds leaving spring marks, I was horrified to find that they were pretty much just thin mats. No wonder they were uncomfortable! So, if you're planning on using the sleeper sofas, bring an airmattress. The rooms, overall, are okay. Which is fine, if you're paying okay prices. But for 200+ a night, plus resort fees? Dirty carpets, a minifridge that does not get cold, old furnishings and tv? I've stayed at better Best Westerns for far, far less. It was very dissapointing, and we kept our socks on alot (see photos, if TripAdvisor allows them). At least the linens and bathroom were clean. Which was a suprise, because the maid service was, well, deplorable. Several of us had to call and wait several hours to get our rooms serviced (just trash) or towels, after returning and finding nothing had been touched all day! I mean, I know it's a busy weekend, but at least one room never got any service, let alone late service. NOT cool. About the only time they actually did come in force was very early on the day we were to check out. Made us feel real welcome. :( Also of note: bring a cooler with water and food. The one thing "resort" like at this place are the prices. Absurdly high prices for just about everything. Plan ahead. And watch your credit card. One family member's room was charged for someone else's (unrelated) rather large room service bill, along with another billing issue they had. As I said before.. probably the best thing about this place is the water park, which is pleasant and seemed pretty clean. Oh, and the amenities were Gilchrist and Soames (sp?), which were nice. But for the price, the service, and the rooms? You'd probably be much better off staying somewhere else, and visiting a water park elsewhere in PHX. Which is sad, because it has alot of potential to be great.

Reviews.Title: “To many little things went wrong”
Reviews.Author: RoborBobB
Reviews.Content: Disappointing-- too many little things went wrong for it to be a 4 star. We actually entertained ourselves on the way home by listing them. Most were small– nothing in the fridge was actually cold. The phone at the concierge’s desk mostly just rang. (I waited 10 minutes once, determined, but eventually gave up. Thank goodness for smart phones.) They we supposed to have tickets for an aquarium, they didn’t. The published and actual hours for the pool didn’t seem to match up very well. I had to walk back to the desk to get a new wrist band right after checking in because the clasp was depressed on the first one and they are designed to not be undone, no matter what. I think we had about a dozen things like this. The maid cart was next to our room when we came back from an excursion, so we went back out for a couple more hours. When we got back it was still there, and Yes, she did knock on our door as soon as we went in. Others were pretty big. The A/C quit in the early afternoon one day and they just couldn’t handle it. Instead of going to bed that night I ended up in the lobby at 11:00, still looking for help. I’m still not sure they fully grasp the idea that my AC wasn’t broken, their AC was. I was just a guest who wanted to go to sleep …

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family”
Reviews.Author: 89AV8R
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Phoenix on business a brought the family. We really enjoyed the water park. The rooms were nice and clean and reasonably priced. We didn't have a chance to use the athletic club on this visit, but I have been up there before and it was excellent. If you have the kiddos with you, request a room near the water park. Also, there are lots of good rates available in the summer since it is hot and off season in Phoenix. Food and drink is typically expensive in the water park and you can't bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing "grand" or "resort-y" about it!”
Reviews.Author: truthbetold_10
Reviews.Content: This place is tired! the rooms were like Embassy Suites - exactly - which is fine if you want to stay at Embassy Suites! I fail to see the "resort" in this place. Carpet is worn, tub is teeny-tiny and the view of the parking lot was uninspiring. And come on, it's 2011 - no flat screen TV? Instead there was this 22" portable dinosaur that I could hardly make out from my bed! The pool area looked really nice - the fountain was a nice touch - but i was only there one night on business and could not enjoy. The staff were friendly and tried to be helpful. After a long day, I was hoping to have a glass of wine in some outside Arizona venue, but the bar I was in could have been in Cleveland (no disrespect)! Oh yeah - and paying $15 for Wi-Fi is out of bounds! I think they may be spending too much time and energy on selling the time share villas. Maybe that's the "grand" part...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Joe J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days with our 2 young children and we loved every second. The rooms were great and the water park was also great. You get what you pay for in this place. We only ate breakfast on site and it was a little pricey but that is what you expect. We were not here to save money, we were here to have fun. The lazy river and water park was great but please know that your children MUST be 48 inches tall to ride the slides. Our little girl was very disappointred that she could not ride. My only gripe would be this, the TV's are from 1985. For such a pricey hotel I would hope to have an HDMI hook up for my computer but this and only this was my only gripe. This is a must stay place in Arizona due to the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Ms. Byrd”
Reviews.Author: Denise B
Reviews.Content: I completely enjoyed my stay at this resort. I will definitely stay there again. Their staff is friendly, kind and professional. I requested two bags of ice and the bellman left the grounds to get it for me. He definitely went above and beyond. I really enjoyed the dinner I had at Aunt Chiladas. I was amazed at the amount of food on my plate. To say the least, I could not eat it all.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service”
Reviews.Author: KamaainaFromKona
Reviews.Content: This resort is an amazing deal! Beautiful suites with incredibly low prices! Up there with the best of the best. I was extremely impressed with the level of service this hotel offers. From the front desk, to the drivers, to the restaurant servers, to the gift shop/deli. Sherry, in the deli, even went to the kitchen at 7:30 a.m. to get gelato for my daughter who had a fever & sore throat! (Gelato doesn't come out until around 11:00) I was very high maintenance on this trip for some reason, but it did not seem to phase any of the staff. Tip: there is a mall less than a mile away and the resort has a shuttle (on a schedule) to take you there and pick you up! Only drawback was there is no resort airport service, so it costs about $25 for a taxi each way. But, it is totally worth it! One more thing. I completely disagree with other reviews on the restaurant. I had the best fish tacos I've had in years and the bruschetta trio was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Older but well-maintained resort, spacious suites, ample conference facilities, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: TomSwain
Reviews.Content: Traveled to this resort for a business conference of roughly 120. We will come again. All food and all services were excellent. The rooms are suites - well-maintained, spacious, with work tables and couches for reading and work offsite. There is a great Mexican restaurant on the property called Aunt Chiladas. Do not miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: Deb-Sky92011
Reviews.Content: So conveniently located. Everything you could want is on-site or very close. I have been here twice in the last 6 months. Once with my SO for rest and relaxation. We played golf, ate at all three restaurants on-site, enjoyed the pool and were never bothered by the kids at the waterpark. Most recent trip was with my 16 year old son and we too played golf and enjoyed the pool. Rates are excellent for a full-service resort. Rooms are nicely updated and spacious. Customer service throughout the resort is outstanding. I will stay here everytime I visit this area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: TL4553
Reviews.Content: Here for a business conference. Grounds are beautiful -- we have taken long walks every morning and evening and enjoyed the beautiful scenery. Food has been excellent and staff are all very personable. Stayed in a two room suite. Everything is clean and well-maintained. There is a fountain right outside my unit and I love to fall asleep to the sound of the water. There are several restaurants on the grounds. There is also a waterpark but it is closed during the week in September but it looks like it would be nice when it is open -- lazy river, big slides. Several shopping areas nearby -- we visited Neiman Marcus and Saks outlets just a mile away. Very close to the airport. Ample parking near our room.

Reviews.Title: “A typical upscale resort. Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: AragornTheStrider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during early summer for 5 nights. This is a beautiful resort. The grounds are very well kept. Rooms are clean and spacious. Loved the typical desert architecture of the hotel rooms. There are some water rides as well which unfortunately we could not check out. There is a fabulous Mexican restaurant on the property grounds that is a must visit for real Mexican taste. Over all great place

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get Away”
Reviews.Author: 266schultz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all without leaving... We got a Villa which had a Full kitchen,living room and 2 bedrooms. Great for families. Ate breakfast in the AM had sandwiches at lunch and out to dinner in the PM or order a pizza for delivery.. Water slides and lazy river were great. All very kid/teenager friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area but avoid the pancakes!”
Reviews.Author: jdkd319
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with family and friends. Great deal for a suite although we were in a room/building adjacent to the freeway (noise was not bad) and walk to the pool area was long (it was 112 degrees outside). The pool area is the reason people stay here in the summer: 2 super tall water slides, lazy river, wave pool. Get there early in the day for prime lounging chairs (preferably in the shade) as later in the day it is packed and hard to find even chairs in the sun! Only negative: ordered room service and the pancakes could have been used as land mines or frisbee's, they were that rock hard!

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: littlerubiez
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this resort quite a lot through out the years. I am an AZ resident and my family uses it as our "Staycation" place. It was much better when it was owned by the Hilton. The waterpark is fun, but forget any type of service out by the pool or even walking up to the bar. It took forever. Check in was at 4, our room wasn't ready till nearly 6 and when we did get it there was a big spot on the floor of vomit or something. Granted, it wasn't the resort's fault what the last guest did, but to let a room go that way was a shock. We stayed there with four other couples. My friend was about a half hour late getting his room, and they gave him a $50 resort credit for the wait. We got nothing. Also the resort was under some sort of renovation with the front check in so we had to wait in a small makeshift area with limited air circulation prior to getting our room. When you are hot and have antsy kids, not an ideal situation. Usually I love this place but it used to come at about $100 a nite, and this time I paid nearly triple that. Next time I think I will go with the Westin Kierland for the price. The value isn't there for such a resort.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMomma
