A soda was almost $5......everything was outrageously overpriced. You are not allowed to take outside food and beverages in so you are at their mercy. If you don't mind filthy dirty floors, trash from prior visitors, rude employees, tampon boxes filled with who-knows-what, and paying $180 for one night of filth......this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous marketing, poorly run hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5cotrvlr
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed for three nights. Overall we had a good time. But if you want a well run, genuinely nice hotel, keep looking. The photos and ads make this place look like a beautiful resort. Remember beauty is whats inside! Upon arrival they treat you like royalty, but once in, you are another number among...thousands. "Pool side" = 5th floor with a slight view of pool. Be prepared to wear plastic band for your entire trip because that is your ticket into the Oasis. Even though you are a "guest" of the hotel, you may not bring any food or beverage into the Oasis. This wouldn't be a big deal if they had options other than cheap fried food, wilted fruit or overpriced beverages. And how about something other than soda pop for the kids? Their "fresh pastries" in the lobby marketplace are Starbucks pastries. Whats up with laying claim to something that doesn't belong to you?! And how about clearing out the empty tubes from the lazy river so it doesn't get jammed every 50 yards? The real impressive service came when we needed a taxi with a booster to get back to the airport. Even though we rode to the hotel in a taxi with a booster, they were "unable" to find one in all of Phoenix. BUT, they have a Suburban for twice the amount that is ready to go anytime... REALLY?! We are perfectly capable of calling taxi companies on our own. But the lady I spoke with prior to our trip said to just call them and they can help us out...Poorly done Arizona Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, beautiful, fun =D”
Reviews.Author: Ohi0J0
Reviews.Content: Location: In the City, about 20mins from everything we wanted to do. Not bad really, since Phoenix proper is soooo spread out. My husband and I stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort because his friend's wedding took place here. We wanted to be close by. We ended up with a Villa room facing the hole #1 of the golf course, the venue of the wedding! It was a beautiful view with babbling fountains we could hear from our room. Service: All of the staff that we encountered were kind and helpful, and speedy =D This we noticed and appreciated because our room key did not work when we first got to our room. We had maintenance there within 10 minutes. No other key problems. Housekeeping arrived like clockwork every morning. Also, Tim at the front desk in particular was so friendly and very helpful. Rooms: We stayed in a Villa, which was amazing. Full kitchen, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. Needless to say, all the wedding couples we hung out with wanted to be in our room! The decorating was nice, and everything was clean. We were there in what seemed like "off season". I don't believe we had next-door neighbors the whole time. So things were very quiet. Bathroom was spacious with shower, double sink, and bathtub. There was a walk-in closet and plenty of dresser space. Amenities: The resort water park was neat. We only used the lazy river. Very relaxing. Only down side was there were a lot of rules. You could only get into the lazy river and one staircase, and the lifeguards yelled at you if you entered and exited in improper fashion. haha, more funny than annoying really. A great family place, there were TONS of kids. They all seemed to like the water slides alot. Water temp was perfect, and pool food was great. Lounge chairs were a little old and kind of dirty. We just sat on our towels. Also, other (quieter) pools all around the hotel. Smaller but nice. Lots of shady spots available. Food: Expensive. Nothing fantastic. Did enjoy the Starbucks coffee at the Marketplace Cafe though =D Went to near by Rustler's Roost, fun atmosphere for sure. Very western rodeo steakhouse. Overall: A really great trip and wonderful hotel. Wonderful staff and service, but overpriced food. Just eat out!! Sadly we didn't get to visit the Spa or work out facilities which are supposed to be very nice. Unable to comment on those things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Destination”
Reviews.Author: KCK_CO
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort twice. Both trips were about the same experience. I went there with my wife and 7 year old child just to get some water time and relax. The main attraction was obviously the pool. They have the lazy river, wave pool, giant slides and more. We went over Memorial weekend and the place was packed. Even though it was crowded, the pool service was attentive. With all of the kids, at night it was difficult to relax as the resort was still very active. One thing to keep your eye on is pricing. The price and the deals for rooms fluctuated a lot and it didn’t seem consistent. All in all I would recommend the resort with the intent for a family destination and not an adult get away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kasi_Mark
Reviews.Content: I visited the Arizona Grand Resort in June 2011, with my 3 children ages 15, 12 and 9. This hotel had fantastic service and was very well organized. I was very happy with the size of the room (large bedroom and separated living room). The water park was just perfect. My children loved having the freedom to come and go from the room to the waterpark and the pools. The hotel was quite crowded on the weekend and much more enjoyable during the week and the food prices were astronomical at the hotel. I would caution against this hotel and waterpark if you have children under the age of 6. Be aware there are extra charges for internet and the resort fee, however the hotel waived the internet fee for me when I requested it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation Destination!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin069
Reviews.Content: We purchased a promotional rate for our reservation and enjoyed two days at this resort for a great price! Arizona Grand Resort has it's own waterpark on the property and it's a wonderful place to take the family for a little getaway. We spent most of our time at The Oasis, where the water attractions entertained the diverse age range of our group.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Teareasa
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time! The pool was awesome! The room was clean and spacious! Adrian and his crew helped us so much! Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed here for 9 years and after this...NEVER AGAIN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brody2011
Reviews.Content: Our family has loved going to Phoenix for 9 years. We have stayed at this resort every year! This is our last. NEVER STAY HERE unless you want to have horrible service, no chairs, to get hit in the face with footballs with parents saying that if there kids meant to kit you that they would have hit you harder. We work hard for vacations and want to enjoy it. We did not expect the Phoenician but we weren't expecting less that Motel 6! (Sorry for the insult Motel 6!) Next time we will stay there or at lest somewhere that advertises themselves as a 4 star resort....Have never been more disappointed and are trying to get a flight home early from a much disappointing vacation....

Reviews.Title: “A beehive of kids...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: Living Social made me an offer I couldn’t refuse…one night in a suite at the Arizona Grand Resort in Phoenix, four passes to their onsite water park, a $50 gift certificate to their onsite spa (ummm…massage!), and two free breakfasts at their onsite restaurant. It was only a tiny bend of the straight line between San Diego and Las Cruces and offered me relaxation and a break from driving…so I bought the deal for the budget pleasing price of $129. It was PACKED…a beehive of kids from 0 to 16…and parents who were thrilled to have them distracted long enough so they could sneak off to the onsite spa or the onsite golf course or lounge by one of the 100 onsite pools in peace. I saw many a man gazing lovingly at the Budweiser clutched lovingly in his hands. Both Sophie and I shuddered to imagine the water quality in the pools we dipped our sweaty bodies into. I had a nice massage...not the best I've ever had, not the worst I've ever had. Breakfast was kind of a nightmare...a 45 minute wait with the added torture of staring longingly at several empty tables. Service was always great... If you're not into being surrounded by kids, I'd bypass this place...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for the family.”
Reviews.Author: Seansma
Reviews.Content: We took our 12 year old son and his friend and had a fantastic time. The boys enjoyed themselves at the water park, pool and even dinner. We ate dinner and breakfast at the main restaurant and the food was great and very large portions. The atmosphere is beautiful. Its also very close to shopping. I wish we would've stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: msgrizwald
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews we chose the hotel for it's location and amenities. The Oasis Water Park for hotel guests was a pleasant surprise. We found ourselves winding our way down the lazy river the very first night we arrived. The lush mature landscaping was a welcome reprieve from the dusty dry desert and with several pools from which to choose, it was easy to relax in comfort after undergoing a 52 million reno, the rooms were well appointed and spacious. Overall, the hotel was a bit worn with stained walkways and uncollected cups and trays, but a fine family retreat.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJiggs
Reviews.Content: We arrived with 4 other families for our 2nd annual stay-cation and had another wonderful time. The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient, our rooms were clean, the food and beverage service at the waterpark was fast and the kids had a great time playing all day! The nightly entertainment was a bonus for both the kids and adults! We can't wait to come back again next June!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: nicaliw
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and really loved it. It was clean and the grounds were well kept. The room was great. Every single staff member we spoke to was polite and very eager to help make our stay great. Only 1 complaint;: our last night was a Friday night. on Saturday the number of people by the pool quadrupled from the previous 2 days. There were people laying out on he grass because there weren't enough loungers. We were checking out that day but were glad we avoided the weekend mostly. Definitely would recommned this for familes (they do have a kiddie pool with cabanas that are first come first served but we were able to get one even late in the morning). It also seems like a great place for couples, quite romantic hotel grounds with lots of beautiful courtyards with waterfalls and lush landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort - can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: javamocha
Reviews.Content: This was our second annual trip with a group of close to 20 people including half being young children 6 and under. The AZ Grand is a fantastic vacation retreat - the kids had a blast in the water park and the pool movies were an extra bonus. The overall location and all it has to offer for families makes it one of the best resorts around. We have already recommended it to several people for vacation. Thanks to great friends and a wonderful resort...we had a fantastic vacation. We look forward to returning next year for our group's third annual trip!

Reviews.Title: “Plan on returning VERY soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: gabbygang
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful, the water park is awesome...and not too crowded when you go during the week. Plenty for the kids to do. The service staff is wonderful. Everyone is very friendly and attentive. There are so many beautiful spots at this resort to discover. Makes for some great picture taking opportunities, too. There are good restaurants on site, and you are very close to many more restaurants and shopping. The beds are very comfortable and our rooms were clean and nice. You can ask to be moved to a room closer to the waterpark, but it is not a far walk to stay on the other end, and we preferred the quietness of being away from all the activity. There are also plenty of other pool areas to enjoy besides just the waterpark. We traveled with our three young kids, and they also cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “End of school bash”
Reviews.Author: CARRGIRL
Reviews.Content: The last day of the school year always has been a celebration for our children,and now, our grandchildren,so this year we picked them up for an overnight trip to the Az.Grand.With two kids ages 10 and 13 and my husband and i a bit older,we wanted to find something that would be fun for everyone.This certainly did the trick!.The kids loved the oasis waterpark,which had a polite,attentive and alert staff which allowed my husband and i the luxury of sitting back and relaxing a bit ourselves.Our dinner was at the kid friendly Rustlers Roost where they could dance and move around a bit while we lingered over our coffee.At the suite,the kids could watch a movie in one room while we watched another in the living room.The room was super clean and comfortable and room service the next am was reasonably priced and fast.The whole staff was efficient and friendly.We were especially pleased in the quality of service since we were there on a special pricing offer that wasn't much more than a single day at a local waterpark would have cost us.This was a great value for families and i highly recommend it as a fun "staycation".

Reviews.Title: “A BEAUTIFUL & WONDERFUL family vacation-We were treated like ROYALTY!”
Reviews.Author: pierrecosmetics
Reviews.Content: A Hotel and Resort that puts customer service first! Our family stayed in the Sedona Penthouse. From the front desk, housekeepers, groundskeepers, etc. EVERYONE was friendly and rolled out the carpet to our every need(s). The 7 acre Waterpark was fun from the adults to the children. My only complaint would be is that a person has to be 48" to go down the slide. There needs to be a slide for children under 48" because my 4 yr. old grandson was very upset he couldn't go down the slide. The resort restraunts had wonderful food that was delicious, the atmosphere was fun and friendly. We celebrated three family birthdays during the week we stayed!!!! The Arizona Grand Resort was Beautiful with tropical flowers and greenery everywhere. At night the Resort was spectacular with all the lights on the palm trees! I would highly recommend this resort for a family vacation, reunion or wedding ;-) P.S. Our family all agreed that the beds were the most comfortable hotel beds.....Just like home!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for in town staycation, but lots of add-on fees!”
Reviews.Author: azdodgerfan
Reviews.Content: We live in the Phoenix area and once or twice a year spend two or three nights in a local hotel. This time we went to the Arizona Grand for our daughter's birthday. She brought one of her friends with her. When we checked in ,everyone was very nice. Then the bellman took us to our room which turned out to be an upgrade to a large one-bedroom suite that overlooked the first tee (used to be the 18th green) of the golf course. It was huge and had a fireplace and two bathrooms. The Oasis Water Park at the Grand is what we go there for. They have a large pool, that is half wave pool and half regular pool. They have a long lazy river that moves fast enough to not be boring and three slides. Two of the slides are about four stories tall and go almost straight down. The other is a long twisty one. We didn't eat in the hotel as it is expensive and there are lots of good restaurants in the neraby areas. The only negatives were that the minibar fridge didn't work when we got there, the ac didn't work and there was a giant hairball under one of the chairs. The fridge and the ac were attended to very quickly. Also, even with a $30 resort fee, wifi is an extra $15 a day which we considered a rip-off. Overall we had a great time and would recommend the Arizona Grand when in Phoenix or for a local getaway! Just remember the $30 resort fee and the $15 wifi fee per day. Sort of like flying most of the american airlines and their baggage charges.

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit - Great Stay Like Always!”
Reviews.Author: Josh1221
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights this time and it was great! We asked for a room above the 2nd floor with a view of the water park and we got it! We ended up staying in S540 which had an okay view of the water park and was located close to it! ALL the staff at the Arizona Grand Resort were nice, even the housekeeping! They really do try and make you're stay grand. Tips: Whatever you do, never ever stay on a Saturday! The whole place gets VERY packed! Staying on a Friday or Sunday isn't that bad. If you are staying with a family, ask for a room with a view of the water park, if you are on a trip as a couple, ask for a room with a mountain view. Likes: The rooms are very nice, beds are awesome, and the whole hotel is great! I love it! We visit the grand resort every summer, and probably going back this summer! Dislikes: The TV's are completely outdated! Question: What room is on the 6th floor? Is it a villa?

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: margaretmarythomas
Reviews.Content: Quite nice.  The private water park is a blast for kids and keeps kids away from the other pools which is a blast for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Family Resort...next to the Freeway...Great when not crowded...”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: 4 families (8 adults and 8 children) spent 4 nights at this Resort. I will be basing my review on stay at JW Marriott Desert Ridge (JW), La Quinta Resort and Spa (LQ), and Beaches Turks and Caicos (Beaches). All in all, I am giving it a 3.5 out of 5 stars. Hotel: Like previous reviews mention, this hotel is located right next to the 10 freeway. This makes it convenient to access, but also poor in terms of scenery. The hotel itself is geared towards family and conferences. If you don't fit one of those, you really shouldn't stay here. The property is large and in relatively decent condition. We went right after the long weekend and it was perfect timing. The resort was full (mainly for a conference) but felt empty. This was perfect, so my review will reflect that. Check-in was a breeze, no lines, and everyone very friendly. Room: Due to our family situation, we looked for a resort that had suites. This one was perfect. If you have a large family (>3) you need to book one of their villa suites. We shared a 2 bedroom suite with a family of 3 (ours is 5) and it was perfect. The prev reviews that stated that furnishings were out of date must have stayed in a regular rooms. These suites had updated modern furnishings (ie: new fridge, nice countertops, flat screen tv, etc). The bath room in the master suite was huge. Shower can accommodate a small army of kids. There was a walkin closet (where the baby slept in the pack and play). We patio overlooked the 1st tee box. The room was on the 4th floor but the elevators were quick to come. The JW did not have a room accommodation like this one. So my vote for best room would have to go to the Grand. Pool/Waterpark- This was a big draw for us due to our kids. From the website, you couldn't really tell much of what to expect. There are 3 slides (all have to be 48" to ride) which none of our kids could ride. There was a nice lazy river, but had way too many empty tubes floating in it. I can't even begin to imagine the congestion if the park was at capacity. There was also a wave pool, sports pool, small kiddie pool, and jacuzzi, and that was it. There were plenty of lounge chairs and even cabanas (can not be reserved) available. Food service was decent and prices were avg. You can only bring in water. Cons- not enough things for kids <48" to participate in. The water rides and pools will be unbearably crowded if the hotel was at capacity. There were 25 life guards (I asked) but none seemed ready to blow his whistle at obnoxious teenagers who were running around. There is only an adult pool next to the villas and we did not go to any other pools. Compared to the JW, the pools were inferior (JW had a better kiddie area) but had better sitting area. Beaches Turks and Caicos still has the best water park Spa- According to my wife (spa expert), the facilities could not even come close to the nicer high-end resorts (including: JW, Montage, Ritz, La Quinta, etc). The massage itself was nice, but the waiting area, steam room, and shower, were not. This may be because the spa shares its facility with the community gym. The locker rooms were more "gym/workout" type facility. Golf- The layout was nice but the course was in avg condition. We teed off at 6:30am and was able to finish in a little over 4 hrs. The carts have GPS but no coolers. We played one day at Raven South Mountain (about 5 mins away) and paid the same amount but got a totally better experience. Golf at JW and La Quinta was better. Restaurants- This was also a little bit disappointing. We had dinner at the Lobby Grill which was avg. I heard that the rib-eye was bland. We also had dinner at Aunt Chilada which was a disappointment for a mexican restaurant. The pool side snack bar was decently priced ($7 for corn dogs, $5 for fries). Value- We paid approx $720 per night for the 2 bedroom villa. This included 2 x 50min massage/facial, 2 rounds of golf, and $100 food/bev credit per day. The resort fee was also included. Not sure if all of it was suppose to be included, but it was. This was a great value for us. One of the main reasons we chose this place. Conclusion- I loved the room set up and the convenience of playing golf and having a water park all in the same area. However, I would probably only return if I can get the same or better value than what I got. I don't like the surrounding sceneries and would prefer the JW over this. Danny

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: JKJK1234
Reviews.Content: If you want a waterpark and pretty grounds to stroll, this is a fantastic choice. If you want luxury, you may want to look elsewhere. Accommodations: We stayed in the Camelback building closest to the water park. The convenience was fantastic, but the clientele definitely "family". If you're traveling with kids, you want to pay for the rooms closest to the waterpark b/c it's worth it. Traveling for business or as a couple? Maybe opt for something in the main resort or near golf. Our building was noisy with all the kids, but we had our own child so we understood. The room layout was not ideal with a child sleeping in the room, as the sink was so close to the beds. You may consider putting kids in the living room area. Service: Service was lacking - we needed a fridge, and they wanted to charge $25 just to empty the mini-bar! I emptied it myself and put everything back at the end of our stay. They charge $15/day for internet access, which really bothered us given the already high $30 per day resort fee. Upon arrival, our room had no bar soap. We called housekeeping and had to leave a message. Eventually, someone arrived with bars of soap. Why they weren't in our room to begin with? A mystery to us! Cleanliness: Cleanliness was mediocre. Our bed & bathroom were clean, but our feet turned black after walking on the carpet. Our room felt a bit damp & had a slight mildew smell, probably from all the wet people coming in and out over the years. We set our A/C on 67 degrees to try to make it more comfortable (that worked). Someone tossed a pizza box with two slices in it by the ice machine on our floor, and it stayed there for at least TWO DAYS. Upon our departure, the pizza was still there - the birds were enjoying it. Surely they have a janitorial staff who should have picked up that trash?!? Parking: Self-parking near your room/building may be difficult to find, but luckily (unlike internet)valet parking IS included in the resort fee. But you should remember to have tips available when picking up your vehicle. The Pros: Don't get me wrong... there were PROS. The waterpark is a lot of fun! A great ammenity to have. We played all day on the slides, lazy river, and in the wave pool. We had a snack at the waterpark bar - expensive, but convenient. In the evenings on weekends, they have AZ Grand Dancers to pump up the crowd and provide a fun beach party atmosphere. AZ Grand also offers plenty of family programs including movie night (they were showing Tangled while we were there). The restaurant where we dined was very good. We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. So, if you know what to expect (family resort with fun water activities), you'll do fine here. If you want more luxury or peace & quiet, ask about the more upscale rooms for business travel. I suspect those are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - watch out for scorpians in your room”
Reviews.Author: Tekysales
Reviews.Content: Large complex with multiple buildings. Nice grounds and a lot of meeting space. I had a "villa". Room was average size but had a large bathroom. Very nice decor, bedding, etc. The events catering and bar staff was great. Has a resort fee which covers internet, gratuities, etc. Beware of sapce under your door leading to the outside. Mine had a small gap as did others in our group. A scorpian found it's way into my 2nd floor room. When I reported it to the front desk they didn't act like it was a big deal. Some inexpensive weather stripping under the doors would fix this. I stuffed a towel in front of the door. While a great hotel I'm not so sure I'd stay here again for having to deal with a scorpian getting into the room and a staff that wasn't too concerned about it - thus the "poor" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away for families”
Reviews.Author: kakeboo
Reviews.Content: we got this deal through Living social and it was so worth it for our family to have a little mini vacation. my sons are 5 and 3 and this was their first real vacation they can remember. we were a little concerned with reading some other review from people tho purchased the same deal but we were not disappointed. The rooms looked exactly like they did in the pictures. yes the TV we very out dated but really the kids did not care and were so wiped out by the end of the day they did not care what was on TV. They were very quick with checking us in and even though we got there are 1pm and check in was not until 4pm they gave us our wrist bands to the Water Park and let us change in the bathrooms in the hotel lobby instead of making us go to the water park to change. They said they would partially check us in at 1pm and gave us a number to call to check to see if our room was ready. we called at about 3:45pm and they were all ready for us. The resort is large and the signs are not very clear on where to go and where to park. We spent about a half hour trying to figure out were to park for our room and where our room was! Once in our room it was great. a little living room with a couch that folds out for a bed and little mini bar with nothing exciting in it. a separate bed room with the king bed bathroom and a nice size closet and a tiny balcony, which was great for putting the wet bathing suits on to dry! they only problem the couch pulls out into a bed, but the pull out is not comfortable and was missing springs at the foot of the bed so it caved in. luckily they are small and don't weight much but if an adult had to sleep on it, it would not be a good night sleep. We did not eat at the resort the 1st night but opted to Claim Jumper down the street. We also took this time to go to Fry's Grocery Store to get water and snacks and sodas. We were in the Sedona Suites and in the center was a pool, of course we understand that people and kids are on vacation and living it up but people were parting in the pool way late. our living room window was on the inside over looking the pool and we could hear them laughing and screaming and thank goodness our kids were so wiped out they were not disturbed and our room was on the outside of the building and with the door closed we could not hear all the screaming and laughing. The breakfast at the lobby Lounge we very nice and since the kids were so excited and woke up at 5:30am when we got down there for breakfast at about 7;30am they were not to busy yet. We got two breakfast buffet and 2 kids meals which cam to about $50. with the Living Social Deal you get a $26 credit for breakfast, so not truly 2 free breakfast. after the credit breakfast was about $24 not including the tip. People line up for the water park very early so we decided to stay at our pool at the Sedona Suites until later in the after noon. The water park is a lot of fun and very packed. the kiddie pool is great only 1'6" and has a splash pad area also. the Wave pool was a lot of fun and the lazy river the kids also enjoined. finding a spot to put your stuff down was hard. We did eat dinner at Rustlers Roost and choice to walk up the hill, yes it was a walk but we figured we would just burn of all the eating out we were doing. this place is so family friendly. a slide to get into the place was awesome and view was great and the food was amazing! With your check come cotton candy and kids eat free with a paid adult all summer long! on our last day our youngest son tripped and fell and got a huge bump on his head, our room phone did not work so we had to call the front desk with our cell phone, but when i explained our son fell and had a huge bummed they said they have EMTs on site and they can come have a look at him. they were very quick to come and where very nice about checking him out. luckily our son was fine just a bump. I was a little bummed that they do not offer free Wifi- it is $14 for 24 hours. Over all this was a GREAT vacation and would come back again and would recommend this resort to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Place rocks”
Reviews.Author: Jusejamez
Reviews.Content: Man it was awesome everyone was extremely helpful. It didn't matter if it was the lawn guy or the front desk. Everyone offered to take us directly to our suite!

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Grand Resort is So Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Isabellelivia
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last week of may at this resort and loved it. The resort is awesome. Big rooms with living room area, The staff were all so helpful and so friendly saying hello to everyone they meet. We loved the water park. We also enjoyed the Spa for a massage. We enjoyed eating breakfast outside each morning. We also had dinner there and the food is Great! (Sevice was a little slow and we could never find anyone to pay our bill. We kept joking about what was going on in the back room because you could never find a waitress to pay your bill. We joked maybe they had to run in the back and cook the food too) We ate at the "Rustlers Roost" steakhouse up the hill and steak was delicious! We enjoyed the Cotton Candy served for dessert! They have live music to dance. We enjoyed sitting by the outside firepit at the resort with our Starbucks coffee early mornings and late in the evenings in the outdoor living area looking up at the stars. The resort is very close to the Airport which is a big plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Resort without hurting my wallet”
Reviews.Author: ScenicSue
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is Grand! The hotel rooms were beautiful and spacious. Also clean, clean, clean. The landscape around the resort was breathtaking. Centrally located in the city: close to shopping and movie theaters. We did take a some time for the spa. What a treat! The friends we went there with, went back the following summer with their kids. A very family friendly place. Yet, we went needing quiet and relaxation and never heard any kids. Best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “"All suite" hotel could be better”
Reviews.Author: StalwartTraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice sized and have a door to the bedroom which would be great for privacy, if needed. They still have tube TVs ~25" in the living room and ~19" in the bedroom which make the rooms seem very dated. The overall style and furnishings were a bit dated in the rooms, but tolerable. The resort footprint is rather large which can make for a very taxing walk in the heat - especially when dressed in business attire for a conference (as was the case for me). The hotel must have been going through a very slow period because I saw staff patching sidewalks, brickwork, etc. which made it seem that there was a recent influx in cash (from our conference, perhaps?). It's good to see repairs in progress, but makes me wonder if this is not the usual state of affairs. I mean, how often can masonry break down in the hot dry climate of Phoenix? This was later confirmed when a waitress mentioned that she was working 18 hour days to take advantage of the work before it became dead again the following week. The resort has a lobby bar/restaurant, a Mexican restaurant, and a steakhouse on site - though the latter two are far enough away that calling them offsite would be just as appropriate. Without a car there isn't much in walking distance so I never left the property in 5 days (which is probably fine by the hotel). The Mexican restaurant's food wasn't bad, but I was surprised to not see a single Hispanic worker in sight. Some suggested this had to do with recent laws, but all of the cleaning staff were Hispanic. Their standard margarita's are nothing special and I'd recommend upgrading to one of the many other choices. The steakhouse was great and would be excellent for kids: there is a live longhorn steer outside, an optional slide to enter the dining room, live country music, balloon animals during dinner, and cotton candy with the check. I found out later that this was in fact a favorite place for some family friends that used to live in the area. And even though my colleagues and I had no children with us, the food was so excellent that we were not turned off by the family atmosphere. However, it's a bit loud and not recommended for a business dinner for sure. The lobby bar/restaurant has excellent food, though the late night bar service was a bit slow. Again, the staff were a bit overwhelmed by a full resort (long lines at the check-in/out counter as well). There is a golf course on site, which I didn't have a chance to utilize. Hole #1 which was visible from my room was half brown - honestly it doesn't seem right to have natural grass golf courses in the desert considering the water problems there. Lastly, there is an onsite water park (in addition to pools dotted around the resort). I was only able to make it for about a half hour before checkout on the last day, but it is highly recommended and I wish I had cut out of the conference to spend more time there. Though in hindsight I have the same concerns about water usage.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Nice Rooms, Great Staff, Quick access from I-10”
Reviews.Author: bendsley
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a conference/week long meeting. I've stayed here before and I was glad to hear that we would be staying at the same hotel once again. The staff is almost over-friendly and very helpful. The rooms are large, spacious and the service staff keeps them very clean. The settings for the meetings and the hotel catering was very nice as well. All of the food the hotel provided was quite a change from the normal fare you might find somewhere else. Eating at the hotel was like going to a high-end restaurant; filling and very enjoyable. I did not visit the water park or the golf course, but several colleagues did and only had good things to say about them. When I come to Arizona for personal travel with my family, we will most definitely be staying at this hotel. One caveat is that the internet access seems quite expensive (though my company paid for it) and at times, it was a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business conference venue - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sss45
Reviews.Content: Was unfamiliar with this property having previously attended events at many other local resorts in the Phoenix area. Some of the iffy reviews made me a bit apprehensive but my experience was a pleasant surprise. While the rooms are a bit dated in terms of appointments (such as the smaller TVs) they are large, comfortable, clean, and quiet with good quality linen and pillows. I had a nice garden view from my room in the Camelback Suites building, and enjoyed being able to open windows without much ground noise. The meeting rooms and meeting catering were above average even with several concurrent events. During our session we needed some A/V support which was immediately provided. Evening dinner service was well prepared and efficient. The onsite cafe and restaurant, while not inexpensive, were also tried and enjoyed. The resort seems to be well situated for business conferences where execs might want to bring their families. However, I can see why folks expecting an Orlando-type kid-friendly vacation might want to look at other options. If I had to book a meeting venue in the area, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: Ainjylface
Reviews.Content: W stayed here because a family weddign took place here. The service was spectacular, the water park was great fun for the kids, and all in all, it was a fantastic experience. I only had two complaints; the televisions inthe rooms need updating . . . I was pressed for something to do while my son was taking his nap . . . and the cribs/pack and plays are nothing I would have put my child in. My husband and I ended up bringing him into the bed with us (don't worry, he is old enough)

Reviews.Title: “very clean,family friendly, skip the water park if you have kids under 48in.”
Reviews.Author: quicktrip7
Reviews.Content: we had a great time as a family at AZ Grand. We were a little nervous about having our kids there who are only 4 and 2, but there were tons of young families the weekend we were there. so we fit right in, i don't know if you would like to eat breakfast amid all the babies and young kids if you didn't have any but we felt right at home. room was spacious, t.v. was pathetic.we spent the day at the waterpark at the kids pool because our kids aren't tall enough for the slides which looked pretty sweet. overall it was a lot of fun and we'd do it again without the water park pass since we could've used one of the other pools for free and do what we did ...sit there while our kids swim.

Reviews.Title: “Resort showing signs of age but great water park and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: QueenKat_9
Reviews.Content: The water park is the center piece of this resort and it is a fantastic facility, ideal for families of all ages. The hygeine and level of service is good, and the food and drink is reasonably priced too. We ate at Aunt Enchiladas and Rustlers Rooste, both of which served great food at very reasonable prices and we would highly recommend. The lobby grill which served breakfast isn't as good as the other restaurants and is way over priced. We booked through a Living Social deal which was great value at $169 per night incl breakfast and $50 spa credit.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure your child is much taller than 48"...”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLady77027
Reviews.Content: I bought a 2-day trip to the Arizona Grand Resort as a Living Social Escape. From their website I knew that children had to be at least 48" tall to ride the waterslides. I specifically measured my son, and he was 48.75" tall. I was not going to buy the Escape if my son could not ride the waterslides (he loves them). That was my whole reason for purchasing the getaway. When we got to the waterpark, he was much shorter than any of the signs. (I would say the signs are at 50".) Needless to say, he was very disappointed, and so were we. When we checked out, I mentioned this and was told that next time I should go to the lifeguard office inside the waterproof, and there they have "an accurate measure" that I could use - and they would initial his wristband. All signs in the park should be accurate! Of course, we were checking out and could not try it out, so he never did get to use the waterpark. I sent management an email the next day, but I have still not heard back. We were very disappointed as the waterslides were our main reason for visiting the resort, and disappointed that I haven't heard anything back from them. The waterpark was fine. It only has 3 waterslides (with a 48" minimum height), a lazy river, and a wave pool (not big waves). I think there was a baby pool too. It was crowded, but we were there Easter weekend. We ended up on very slanted grass. I ordered food at the main bar, and the food came very quickly both times. As for the resort itself, it's nice, but not 5 stars. The rooms were clean. The TVs are pretty old. Not that I care, but they are pretty grainy. I couldn't find a channel listing anywhere in the room. And in case you are looking for the remote control, it is the game controller that is hooked to the back of the TV (although I couldn't figure out how to do the volume on it.) You are supposed to get a newspaper every day as part of the daily resort fee, but we did not receive one at all. You were supposed to get coffee, and there were some packages in the room when we checked in, but no coffee maker, so we could not make any. Our Escape included breakfast in their restaurant. They have a very nice breakfast buffet that we were happy with. (For those with the Escape, they credit you $26 per day for 2 breakfasts. You can choose whatever food you'd like.) We visited Rustler's Rooste for dinner one night. I had made reservations through the resort before we arrived, and the confirmation email did say "because of the size of your party, you will be given priority seating, to be seated before any walk-in guests." And that is what happened. We didn't wait long though. That place was very crowded and we were there at 6:00! Live music and a beautiful sunset and view. The food was fine, but not extraordinary. The kids will love it. The live music, there's a big slide they can slide on in the restaurant, and a live long horn bull outside the restaurant. Plus, they get a fuzzy pink special dessert. Our room was in Mountainside and you did have a little walk to the waterpark, but that was fine - we didn't mind. We also had an older room, not the ones pictured on the website. But it was fine. I wouldn't recommend trying to walk to Rustler's Rooste. It's quite a hike. And if you decide to drive, you need to drive through the resort to get to it. Do not leave the resort to try and get to it.

Reviews.Title: “You don't have to leave the grounds!”
Reviews.Author: derby3680
Reviews.Content: We stayed (two families of four-8 total w/tweens & teens) from April 18th-22nd. First of all the weather was impeccable....89 and blue skys every day.....we were delighted with our choice of this hotel. We stayed in Sedona Rms 338 & 339 which (FYI) were connecting and perfect for our sleeping arrangements. We had two 12 year old boys and two teenage girls and four adults and we all found plenty to do here! We all loved the lazy river, water slides and on-site restaurants (Aunt Chilada's, Rustler Rooste and Lobby Bar & Grill) We utilized the shuttle to Arizona Mill's mall which was very convenient. The outdoor fire pit and "chimanea" pit seating were fabulous for adult night-life. We had $100 per night/per room resort credit which we had no problem spending on-site....we actually didn't go over our limit much at all! They had a "dive-in" movie one night for the kids at the pool..great family entertainment. The only "cons" to this resort that we could come up with were the waterpark hours (only 10am-6pm during our stay..a line formed at 9:30am each day with about 100 people standing around waiting for it to open).....and the "cooler" units they provide in the rooms do not refrigerate perishable items. We would definitely recommend this hotel/resort to other families as a vacation or "staycation" destination!

Reviews.Title: “Waterpark ok but rooms dirty”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel5525
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night to be close to the airport after a weeklong stay in other parts of Arizona. Kids loves the waterpark. Clean and plenty of seats and lifeguards. Room was a nice size but outdated and sheets and towels were dirty. We didn't like being in the room at all. Price included the 100 resort credit which was nice. Dinner at lobby grill was good. If you are paying a 30 resort fee wifi should be included!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ralphswife
Reviews.Content: We were two families together with three children, ages 9, 10 & 11. We were a little nervous based on some of the reviews we read regarding noise, cleanliness, etc. I have to say this was a fabulous vacation. We checked in around 11am and our rooms were ready. We stayed in the Camelback section overlooking the Oasis water park. We were in very close walking distance to the waterpark and lobby. The rooms were very clean, spacious and comfortable. The only issue I had was the bathroom sink is located outside of the shower/toilet area. If you are an early riser and want to brush your teeth you will disturb anyone still sleeping. Other than that minor issue, the room was beautiful. We had no issue with noise; in fact it was very quiet at night and in the morning. The rooms closest to the highway will be noisy, you're overlooking a highway! The waterpark opened at 10am each day and the line to get in was quite long, especially closer to the weekend. If you are particular about where you want to sit; plan on getting on line by 9:30am. We preferred the seats by the wave pool; you can be in the shade or the sun. Our kids had a great time at the waterpark. There are plenty of lifeguards at every attraction to ensure safety. Someone did write a review about children "running amok". It's a waterpark geared towards families; children will run amok! If you don't want to hear children laughing and having a good time; don't stay at a resort with a waterpark! Food service was outstanding. The back of the lounge chair had a "flag" that you raise when you want wait service for drinks or food. Very convenient and staff just appears when your flag is raised! The cost of food was very reasonable, some people thought it was expensive. The average cost for a meal was in the $7 - $10 range. I'm from the east coast; food here is expensive. I had no issue with food cost and everything was great. The fish tacos were the best! Breakfast and dinner in the lobby restaurant was very good. We had a prime rib buffet that included everything from drinks to appetizers and dessert for around $24 for adults. The dinner menu was nice and offered other dinner items that were very good also. The breakfast buffet was very good as well as a la carte menu items. The omelet station line was sometimes long but moved along quickly. The gym was huge and had plenty of cardio equipment and free weights. Our children loved the indoor basketball court. The spa was excellent and relaxing. A 50 minute massage was $95; very reasonable. They have beautiful trails to go for long walks along the mountains and golf course. We did see two coyotes on the golf course in the early morning and we ran in the other direction! The locals thought we were crazy; but better safe than sorry. There is a Starbucks off the lobby that offered great snacks and ice cream. The gift shop has nice knick knacks and souvenirs. Again, I thought very reasonably priced. In the evening they would show a childrens movie by the pool in the waterpark. Our kids didn't go but what a great offering. We did rent a car and drove to the Grand Canyon - a long day but worth the trip. We stopped at Red Rock state park along the way and drove through Sedona. Sedona was absolutely beautiful. It took about 3 1/2 hours to drive back to the resort from the Grand Canyon. Again, it was a long day but it was worth it. Overall, it was a wonderful vacation. We had an awesome time and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pretty Face With Some Minor Blemishes”
Reviews.Author: LMK5
Reviews.Content: This resort is conveniently located off the Baseline Road exit on I-10 in Phoenix, and provides a great option for families with kids. My party was 2 adults and 3 kids, ages 10-12, and we spent 2 nights here. How did I find this place? I googled "Best Pools in Arizona" and this place came up on a list with others. Because of the extent of the waterpark facilities, I thought it would wow the kids. They have always wanted to stay at a hotel with a great pool, and "wow" is what they got. The main attraction at this resort is the Oasis Waterpark and it doesn't disappoint. We checked in early on a Thursday and the kids had half a day to check out the pools and slides. They couldn't wait to get back to it the next day. My wife got to the waterpark at 9:15 AM the next morning, but she found out it didn't open until 10 AM. Lucky for her, because there was already a line assembled. By the time the gates opened, the place was flooded with guests determined to get their chairs in the shade. I must say that there was ample seating in the facility and a surprising amount of shade to be had. My kids proceeded to spend the next 6 hours going from pool to pool, floating down the lazy river, and going down the water slides. There are lots of life guards around. There were also a couple of places to get food and drinks and the lines were never too long. College-age kids go around taking orders at your chair if desired. We stayed in a premier suite, which guarantees a golf course view. I chose this location because I wanted to be a little distance from the waterpark and didn't want to be close to the freeway. From the looks of it, I think that if you're in one of the "M" buildings close to the freeway you could be in for some noise. We had none. The room was large and accommodated our party well. The minibar has room enough to place a couple of items of your own if needed. A coffee maker was also provided. There was also a nice balcony with 2 chairs and a small table overlooking the golf course. Because of the great location in Phoenix, we took a short drive to Scottsdale on the second night and had a great time strolling Old Town and checking out the Friday night scene. Downsides? Well, the TVs are smaller CRTs and the channels are not as plentiful as you'd expect. I think a resort that claims 4 stars should have flat screens in all rooms. Even Holiday Inn Express has these now. Also, I noticed that the closet mirror and the French door panes had finger prints and smudges on them. Our sofabed was missing the pillow and blankets, and my wife called the desk twice to bring the items up but no one came. On the third try, she had to call the manager, and he brought the items up in minutes. Lastly, we didn't hear any voices from the neighboring rooms, but we could clearly hear their plumbing! Despite the minor negatives, this resort is a powerful draw, especially if you get a good deal. We got a nice package that included a nightly resort credit. We used it at the Lobby Grill, Aunt Chilada's, and the Market Cafe. We were pleased with each of these. I can also say that, unlike other resorts, I never felt nickel-and-dimed here. For instance, you are only entitled to 4 waterpark passes per suite but they gave me the fifth without me even asking. I also found the staff to be friendly and helpful. For families like us, who always seem to have a hard time finding a resort with rooms large enough to accommodate us comfortably, the Arizona Grand is hard to beat. You can keep the kids (and parents) very busy here, have an enjoyable resort experience, and still be close to the amenities of a major city, all at a fairly digestible cost. I would urge you to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Fun family escape!”
Reviews.Author: bigbroncosfan
Reviews.Content: While my family and I had a great time I have to say I feel sorry for this resort. It was beat up during the recession and is just now trying to come back. They are trying hard but have a way to go. A couple things they could do are simple - fresh paint on the buildings, clean the carpets and stop gouging the guests. (I know it is a resort but it is in the middle of a city with loads of options!) The rooms, while nice, are stuck in the late 90s. Not that we were there to watch TV but the two TVs in the room were old. They were small tube style so much so that my 5 year old didn't even recognize they were TVs. (This was a good thing in the wrong way!) Once you get past the annoyances of the resort and settle in it is fun. We enjoyed the waterpark and it is safe and clean. Despite the lines that queue at 9:15am when it opens at 10am we were able to find seats with no problems. There are many different pools that keeping everyone entertained isn't a problem. We never tried the food at the pools but it seemed ample and expensive. Our package included spa services for the adults which my wife and I enjoyed. The massages were great. However the spa itself is uninspired. The carpets are scary with big stains on them. How they got their I am not certain. Yes, we had a great time but I wanted the property to be so much more than it was. I wanted it to match the pictures. We might consider returning but will keep an eye on Trip Advisor to see if they clean up the place. Otherwise we will try other places.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.....”
Reviews.Content: I'd been at this place for 24 hours --- I swear it felt like 24 days---- on a grandchild trip. After a full day at the water park which is stocked with dozens and dozens of kids, many of whom are allowed by their parents to run amok, a couple of hours of sleep thanks to the two a.m. wake up call from the noisy people in the parking lot---- most rooms back up to one--- and then the yelling that starts at the courtyard pool around eight am , I tried to talk my grandson into moving to a nice , quiet , upscale hotel . I even offered him money to leave. However, it turns out HE loved the place. That's when I realized it is what it is and I had to accept this. That said, the bottom line is if you are looking for a peaceful getaway in the sun, this is not your kind of place. I can't comment on the golf course or the villas they are attempting to sell at this place because I didn't experience either. I will say that even though I couldn't stand the resort --- once again the 10 year old loved it--- it is well run and the employees I dealt with were very well trained and polite. I also thought that the package price they have for the room was a good deal. Also, my wife had a massage and used the gym every day and liked both. Once again, just be warned that if your an adult without kids , well even if your an adult with kids, this is not going to be a very relaxing resort to visit . As I said, it is what it is......Management , if you read this please note that your adult pool is rarely just only adults. I realize it's hard to enforce that kind of rule, but there must be some way to create a haven for we who are seeking one.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: Vacay4ever1723
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Arizona Grand Resort over St. Patrick’s Day weekend. This resort was absolutely gorgeous! The resort, waterpark and grounds were amazingly clean & the staff were kind and helpful. When we checked in, our room wasn’t ready, so the front desk upgraded us to a villa. The Villa’s are very spacious, we had a king size bed with a sofa pullout, as well as a small kitchenette that was equipped with a microwave, coffee maker and fridge. The bed was more comfortable than our own at home; they provided plenty of blankets and extra pillows. We were able to spend a couple of days at the waterpark which was extremely fun. There were plenty of seating and lounge chairs to lay out and enjoy the sun. The servers were always around to get you whatever food or drink you wanted. My husband played golf on the grounds once during our stay. Our only complaint was that the lady that worked the golf scheduling was kind of rude and unaccommodating. We wanted to book the after 2/3pm special, but she kept telling us that we had to come back after 12pm to book it. We couldn’t figure out if this was their way of making more money & getting you to book a more expensive morning time or what. When he was finally able to get a tee time, it ended up being in the morning, we ended up going through the gentlemen that works there which happened to be much friendlier. Overall, we had a great time & the resort provided plenty of activities to keep us busy. Our best experience there was going on the family hike. It was about 5 miles, lasted a couple of hours & we had a blast. Best of all, it was free. The views were extremely beautiful! The resort offers many free activities, like hiking, yoga & other exercising classes.

Reviews.Title: “Great place-would come back”
Reviews.Author: kasfmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights the end of March and had a great time. There was a glitch with housekeeping one day-our room got skipped. The staff marked it down as having been cleaned but it wasn't. It took several calls to get clean towels and glasses for the next day. The night manager offered to have it cleaned for us but at that point it was 9:30 and we wanted to head for bed. We also had a tough time getting 4 coffee cups in our room. We left a note asking for 4 cups and instead got 4 bags of coffee. We ended up talking to one of the housekeeping staff who was still on the floor and got the extra cups. It would be nice if there was extra shampoo/conditioner left when there are 4 people in the room. Bedroom area in our Sedona suite was quiet. There was plenty of room for the four of us. The water park was a lot of fun-we headed down early afternoon after some people had already left. I was surprised to see a line at 9 at the door when Oasis doesn't open until ten. Had the breakfast buffet at the hotel three times. It was delicious. The coffee bar was very crowded in the morning so get there early if you don't want to wait in a huge line. The pools at Sedona Suites were great. We also enjoyed the rooftop patio area. It was fun to sit in the sun and enjoy the view. We had a great time and would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: jbrochester4444
Reviews.Content: The Arizonal Grand Resort is an exceptional resort. The staff are friendly and kind and deliver superior service. The pools and water park are fabulous - clean and fun. The rooms are perfect, the food is excellent and offer a great selection for all ages and tastes. I will definitely return and encourage others to stay at this resort

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities when you can get their attentions. Dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TSpangler123
Reviews.Content: My wife, 13 yr old son and 11 yr old girl stayed at the Grand for 1 week during a relocation trip. The resort has some nice features. The waterpark was fun. The restaurants were good and the employees were nice. They would transport you on golf carts if you asked. However, there were some glaring deficiencies also. We stayed in a "Mountainside" 2 queen suite. - Our room's carpet was severely stained. - The sheets and blanket in the sleeper sofa was stained. - The bathroom had small, curly hairs on the floor when we arrived. - We found a dirty diaper under one of the beds. - The Rt10 highway is directly next to the building which provided plenty of road noise. - They don't have the service capacity to handle the amount of guests at the resort. We gave up trying to get in touch with the Concierge and on most occasions had to wait on hold for an extended length to get an operator. - Getting a seat at the restaurants without several day advanced reservations is nearly impossible. - They sent me an email for feedback, but the link does not work. If this was a $69 Motel 6, the rooms were ok. But we expected alot more for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful water park, fun for all!”
Reviews.Author: lauraru
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 9 and a half year old, and my 12 year, spent two wonderful nights at the Arizona Grand. The service was the best we have ever seen. It started when we pulled up to the valet and they were able to store some almond milk for us in their fridge (my stepson is dairy free). Although our room was not ready, they checked us partway in, gave us the wristbands necessary to access the park, and then directed us to the spa and let us use the locker rooms to change into swim suits. The food at the park is a tad expensive, but the service is great. Both my stepson and I have [different] food allergies and they accomodated us as well or better than some restaurants I have been to. We got to our suite and it was just as advertised. Actually, the great service started months before when I called to make the reservation and the agent gave us a suite in the closest set of rooms to the water park, which also has two pools and a hot tub of its own. The outer room had it's own sink, so except for shower and toilet my stepdaughter essentially had her own room. Each room had its own TV, although we never turned them on. The next day was heaven. Our food issues were again handled elegantly by the waitstaff and floating around the lazy river was a highlight for all of us. We never got up the nerve to try the two big water slides, but all four of us found the lower twisty turny slide a great deal of fun. The water in the wave pool was like a bathtub and the inner tubes all over the place made for a lot of fun. When we locked ourselves out of our room, a bellman came in 3 minutes(!) to let us in. My husband enjoyed the fact that they let you use the driving range for free. We loved that, except for the price of the food, we never felt nickeled and dimed. There were no hidden charges at the water park, the inner tubes are there for anyone to use and there are plenty of them. The number of lifeguards around is astonishing. They are located about every 20 feet along the length of the lazy river and they switch stations every 30 minutes so they can stay attentive. They all seemed very nice as well. Gently correcting kids who were doing the wrong thing rather than yelling. We felt completely safe letting the 9 year old go around the lazy river by himself. We also loved that the Grand is only about 15 minutes from the airport, so you don't spend all day getting thereafter you land.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time (was had by all)”
Reviews.Author: jasmd530
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 spent a pleasant 6 days at the Arizona Grand while I participated in an annual golf outing in Phoenix . The AGR exceeded our expectations in many ways despite the overlap with the expected Spring Break traffic. As with any hotel, there are strengths and weaknesses however, there were several aspects that are undeniably EXCEPTIONAL for a resort of this size, quality, and price point. Located within a short drive to Sky Harbor airport, the resort is off the beaten path of the typical Scottsdale 'name' resorts. What you get for that is a lack of pretentiousness, more attention to the guest, and very good value for your dollar. A car is necessary to explore Phoenix and the vicinity. The hotel staff was all so very helpful, polite, and willing to go out their way to assist guests. Having stayed at the Arizona Biltmore, just 3 weeks earlier, I said that the level of attention between the two was equivalent but without the "white glove" service. In fact, I was pleasantly surprised at the prompt nightly turn-down service with towel exchange that was M.I.A. at the Biltmore where I paid twice the nightly rate (do you hear that Biltmore?) Also, reasonable room rates plus the Grand Experience which gives you $100 per room per night credit toward virtually any expense on property. How's that for a deal. The water park was a welcomed haven for the kids, with attentive lifeguards at the wave pool, lazy river, and 3 waterslides. Can't say that I didn't catch just a few adults indulging themselves at the water park. After several strenuous laps in the Lazy River, I was ready for poolside service from the friendly waitstaff. The traditional pools adjacent to the rooms were more than adequate, quieter, and offered a nice change of pace from the water park. Admission to the park is included in the price of the room and is not open to the public ...another plus. So if the food and drinks are a little pricier...it still doesn't come close to Disney prices. The 18 hole golf course was very playable and well maintained. The hole design was varied with sweeping changes in the mountainside terrain making it very scenic and challenging. Rates were very reasonable especially with the additional 20% discount offered to hotel guests. My 9 year old son loved it and begged for more playing time. The driving range was adequate and free to use with lots of kids taking advantage of the kid friendly range. And best yet, children 12 and under play golf for free! Yet another pleasant surprise! We signed up for a twilight round at 3:26pm and were given the green light to go off at 2:30pm for the same price. The rooms are typical suite design with a bedroom with king or 2 queen plus a living area with a pull out queen. This was a former Hilton property. A mini bar refrigerator and wet bar was useful. The rooms are nice and more than adequate, but who comes to Phoenix to stay indoors? The mattresses on the sofa beds could use an update. TV's are not flat screen but with 2 per suite, they do the job. Finally, as a self-proclaimed foodie I was pleasantly surprised by the menu items at the resort restaurants. During our trip they offered not only children's menu items but had priced fixed specials such as Prime Rib Night. Honestly, possibly the BEST, tastiest, and enjoyable prime rib I have ever eaten. Though the portions are not huge like one would find at an upscale steak house, they were more than enough for my hungry appetite (come on America do we really need to super-size?). Dinner included a buffet of iceberg lettuce wedge, creamed spinach, potatoes, vegggies and dessert all for $ 21.95 . Outdoor dining and coctails by 2 fire pits and with beautiful views of the golf course. Food service during the Spring break holiday was slow but the maitre d' informed all the guests up front that the kitchen was swamped and that they would not be seated until the kitchen caught up. Although the hunger was upset I appreciated the honest candor up front. Bravo again ! The spa and gym were very modern in a beautiful building and the parking was free all over the resort. This resort is a virtual 'diamond in the rough'. And believe me, I spent 5 days in the rough during my golf tournament... I know rough :-) ! Apparently with the new management making renovations like the new central lobby, restaurant, Starbuck's and golf shop I'm sure that as the economy improves, so will the updated amenities. If my three world travelers ages 9, 9 , and 7 give the AGR a big thumbs up for a return trip and momma reluctantly left the resort to go home with a big smile on her face, you know that they are doing alot of things right . We will certainly consider a return visit. Although a paradise for children, the Arizona Grand Resort has plenty for adults without children too! Jeff Denver, CO

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel with water park”
Reviews.Author: Scubashark0822
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a two year old. Huge pool and waterpark with dive in kids movies. Location far from stuff but why leave resort?

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Chill”
Reviews.Author: dschu22
Reviews.Content: Great family destination in AZ. The complete package for R&R in the desert. A very classy property, not as refined as a Four Seasons, but not snooty either. And a step up from a Hilton or Marriott resort. Families with kids of all ages were there, but it never felt crazy, and the water park has just enough to do (lazy river, slides) to keep two teenagers busy enough but also allow all of us to completely relax. There's plenty of space so you never really feel like there are people on top of you. Water park was extremely crowded and we had to get in line 45 min before it opened to get our favorite place, but it's Spring Break, and this is to be expected. Terrific health club, lots of machines. Great patio with fireplaces for drinks or snacks. It is resort pricing, so be ready to pay $4 for a muffin and $6 for ice cream. $16 for the breakfast buffet (and $15 for wireless). Kind of painful, but it's a drive to get anywhere and you're kind of stuck on the property. So grin and bear it. It's a great place to get away from the cold for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Grlz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overpriced. The restaurants were expensive (which we expected), the minibar was insane ($3 for a can of soda--again, expected), and the water park that is such a big selling point for them is an additional $30 per day. The waterpark wasn't even that great. We spent more time at the little pool outside the room than we did at the Oasis. It was very clean, and housekeeping was great. Also, you are very close to the airport and highway access. We had a patio on our ground floor room, but there was no furniture to sit out there so all we used it for was to dry our swimsuits. Also, they advertised having horse riding trails, but they had gotten rid of their riding stables so we had to find somewhere else to take the kids riding. Also, Wifi was an additional $15 per day. I was very disappointed with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is great except the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jkinsit
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 including two teenagers and a ten year old booked a week at the Arizona Grand. Overall everything is wonderful, food, service, the watermark- all excellent. We stayed in a deluxe two queen suite which also includes a pull out queen sofa bed. We've stayed in many hotels previously and had our teens sleep on the sofa beds but this one was particularly uncomfortable. So much so that we ended up taking turns on it just to make sure every one got a chance at a good night sleep. Basically I spent two nights sleeping on a couch during what was supposed to be a relaxing vacation. Twice I asked management for a solution but was told we would have to pay an additional $300 per night for an additional room. All I can say is that the "suites" do not comfortably accommodate 5 people as advertised. Not getting a good night sleep put a huge damper on the whole trip for all of is.

Reviews.Title: “Great water park, ok golf and way below average service”
Reviews.Author: bill_swackhamer
Reviews.Content: The resort is an ok destination for families, especially with younger children (ages 5-17) due to the water park. Service is poor, which is evidenced by the slow service, but also the number of employees in 'training", which shouldn't occur during the peak season. Appears to be the result of lots of turnover likey driven by lower than market wages (my opinion). The problems could be the result of the documented problems the ownership has with the resort's lender (not that unusual today). Golf course is just ok, lots of blind shots and very tight but a beautiful back nine (nice desert atmosphere) Rooms are suites but are smaller and the bathrooms are very small (sinks are actually in the bedrooms)

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but tricky with room charge!”
Reviews.Author: CandCandC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice but be careful what you pay for it. We booked with a group and attempted to get the group deal for $199 per night with $100 resort credit (to use for restaurant, golf, spa, etc), instead we could only get $379 (no resort credit) per night due to being "booked". When we complained they bumped it down to $179 per night, but didn't tell us there was also a $30 per night resort charge (for newspaper and parking, etc). When we got there and checked in, we were told the room we had is waaaaay far away off the beaten path, but we could pay another $40 per night to get a closer room to the Oasis pool, which we did to be closer to the group we were going with. I found out from one of our group that they were upgraded to a closer room, with view, for free! And from a different group member that they were not charged for their $30 per night resort credit! I hate to be fooled into thinking our room would be $179 plus tax per night (which is what we booked it for), when our bill came to $900 for three nights. That was with no food or other charges, just for the room. Other parts of the hotel were nicely kept up, but the Oasis water slides are over-rated, too big for small kids, and too extreme for many kids who do meet the height requirements. Pool food and drinks are over-priced, which is fine if you had the advertised resort credit, but a rip off if you don't. Our TV had no remote control. Would not stay here again due to these insincere and inconsistent business practices!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Resort With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TamraG
Reviews.Content: I travel with my family and extended family every March to the Phoenix area for Spring Training baseball. We have stayed at many resorts in the Phoenix/Scottsdale/Tempe area over the years and are delighted to finally have found a place that we want to come back to year after year. We love this resort for many reasons! All rooms are at least a 1 bedroom suite (great if you have kids with you!) with a small refrigerator (no charge to use) and a pull out sofa bed in the living area. There are also other larger rooms types available and they are happy to accommodate requests for connecting rooms. The grounds are beautiful and the resort has it's own WaterPark with a lazy river, waterslides, and giant wave pool that is popular with adults and children alike. Although it can get very busy, there are many, many lifeguards around to keep a close eye on things, and the wait stuff does a fantastic job of making sure your requests are met in a timely and friendly fashion. While we were there, kid friendly movies were shown in the evenings out by the pool for some handy free family entertainment. We've eaten at the main hotel restaurant several times and the food has been quite good. Prices are fairly typical for this caliber of a resort. Do yourself a favor on a hot day and stop in the marketplace for their homemade gelato...delicious! The resort also has a fitness center, golf course, and additional pools and hot tubs spread throughout the resort property in addition to the Water Park. Despite the upscale nature of the hotel, our family feels completely comfortable here. The staff is extremely gracious and will go out of their way to help you with any request. At some higher end resorts, I have run into attitudes from staff members, but never here! It is a very family friendly and delightfully accommodating place to stay. If you are going to be in the Phoenix area and need a place to stay (especially if you have kids), do yourself a favor and stay here! The location is great, you can get to most of the main attractions in under 20 minutes....or just stay at the resort and enjoy all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Best. Trip. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: srich6421
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Arizona Grand on Saturday, March 12 and left on Wednesday, March 16th with our 2 children who are 9 and 6 years old. We had a blast!! The people who worked the front desk were so sweet and explained everything to us and we were shuttled to our room in the Sedona building by a very nice man who gave us a tour of the property. Our children played at the water park all day, every day. Both of them were thankfully tall enough to ride the water slides that were so much fun. My husband and I enjoyed the lazy river and the wave pool. The service was excellent out by the wave pool. We just raised our flags and we had whatever we wanted! We did have a $100 credit to spend each day, but our's was gone right after lunch. (Don't judge---we were on vacation!!). I will say that the drinks were a little expensive at $9 a pop, but it didn't seem to matter to us. We ate at the Lobby Grill, Aunt Chileada's and Rustler's Rooste. All were great. The kids liked the slide at the Rustler's Rooste the most. Also, there were tons of hummingbirds everywhere so the kids thought that was great. We will definitley save up to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lbdesigns
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand was delightful though it was shortened by a family emergency. But in our brief stay, we quickly came to love the beautiful, well-maintained grounds, the plentiful accomodations and most impressive, the warm & friendly staff. In particular, Conierge Tim Watkins went above and beyond to help make our stay as pleasant as possible. His service alone was reason enough to bring us back another time in the future and to recommend this resort to others. Thank you Tim!!!

Reviews.Title: “Calling Themselves Grand Doesn't Make it So”
Reviews.Author: SpiralDive9
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel, especially if you're bringing kids, is the adjacent water park. Nothing like a couple of hours of water park fun before heading to a baseball game. It is clean and uncrowded, and the poolside service is excellent (if you don't mind the somewhat overpriced food and beverages). Kudos to the resort for keeping this amenity off limits to the general public. There is also excellent hiking and golf basically outside your door, so the location can't be beat. Unfortunately, the hotel itself is a disappointment and is generally headed downhill. This is our third time staying there and most definitely or last. My main complaint is that the otherwise outstanding courtyard areas (complete with nice pools, hot tubs, and ping pong tables) turn into a major party area after sunset. Fine if you're into that scene, but not a good environment for the kids. People are smoking and drinking everywhere, including in the hot tubs, beer bottles and other litter are strewn about, there is abundant profane language, and during our 6 night stay we saw no attempts by hotel staff to address these issues. The only good news is that the 10 PM quiet time seemed to be enforced. Basically we rarely saw staff making any attempt to keep the place clean like one would expect from a so-called "Grand Resort." Even the room service trays left outside the doors tended to remain there for 12 hours or more. I got the distinct impression that the economy has hit the place hard, and they have cut back on staff and it shows. If they were to make one of the sections of the resort off-limits to drinking and smoking so that it could be enjoyed by families we would consider returning, but not until then.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Beavscabin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine nights in March 2011 to get away from the Midwest winter. The staff was excellent at all times. The rooms were two room suites and were clean.
