Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand plays movies at night by the pool, AT MAXIMUM VOLUME!! When we called to ask them to turn the sound down, they acknowledged that we weren't the only ones inconvenienced but claimed they didn't know how to get in touch with the people at the pool. When we spoke with the manager Adrian, he did turn the volume down SLIGHTLY, and then would not accept our call to turn it down more. We were told that the volume was at the "acceptable decible level for noise"!! When the movie ended at 10:00 we finally had peace, but we were all tired and cranky the next day over the hassle. We received a small credit for the disruption, but it was clear that management did not care that some of their guests could not sleep through the Pirates of the Caribbean soundtrack playing in their room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JimCR
Reviews.Content: The entire stay was great. The rooms were outstanding. The food and staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice - water park lots of shade but too crowded”
Reviews.Author: LivinInAZ
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend there with some friends and all of us have kids. The waterpark filled up with so many people in the middle of the day (Saturday) that it became of concern for all of us. The wavepool has the whimpiest waves I have ever seen. On the upside, the room was good for a family of four. We had a queen suite with pull out sofa which we used (however, when we pulled it open the sheets were folded over like they were fresh BUT there was a gum wrapper folded into them...it was not ours. The two beds were in a seperate room with a door and 2nd tv. The patio door opened up to a small patio which we used to help dry our swimsuits. Generally the room was clean. The queen beds were very comfy. We did the breakfast brunch in the lobby area which was fantastic! Best cinnamon rolls I have ever had. I would not pay full price to stay there especially with the water park being so crowded. It was really a turn off towards the end of the day. One great thing about the water park is the large amount of lounge chairs and shade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Valley of the Sun”
Reviews.Author: FrankB23
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Arizona Grand (the first time being under Pointe South Mountain Resort). My kids can not stop talking about the great time they had and how nice everyone was at the resort. The rental I was driving had a flat tire. A gentleman on a golf cart showed up right away (without calling) and helped changed the tire, including taking it back to their shop and airing it up. While we were waiting on him to return, we had 3 additional employees stop and ask if we needed any assistance. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff working at the Oasis could not have been nicer. The pools were clean and well maintained. If the pricetag on the Villa Ownership was a bit lower, I would have bought while there... love it that much.

Reviews.Title: “Resort is Beautiful, but the Waterpark was not so fun.”
Reviews.Author: SWGoodSam
Reviews.Content: The resort entrance and grounds are lovely, a huge fountain greets you as you drive up. Rooms were standard Resort Suite, with a bedroom and livingroom featuring a small wet bar with mini-fridge, no microwave. We disliked the fact that we had to unpack the refrigerator (which was completely filled with Soda, Beer and Water) to put anything of our own in. Otherwise very nice property. The Water park was a rude awakening from the beginning. After checking in, we headed to the water park which was teeming with people on a late Sunday Aftenoon. No innertubes were available, and you can't ride the Lazy River without one. So we hiked over to the Wave Pool which was Wall to Wall People standing in slighly choppy water. Thinking the waves would soon begin we waited,... the water went completely still. We realized that the choppy waters are considered 'Waves' in this Water Park. This was a bad joke in comparison with other Wave Pools we have experienced. Knowing that the pool closed at 8, we decided to get out about 7:30pm and went in search of our lounger/personal belongings and towels. The loungers had already been stacked and TOWELS GONE, our bag & lounger sat alone in the grass. We left cold, wet and insulted! But wait, we returned the next day to find something called, 'Rotating attractions'. This means you get to ride in the Lazy River for 1 hour, then, when the announcement is made (doesn't matter how far you and your kids are from your belongings) the Life Guards rudely tell everyone 'Get OUT, Get out Now!' They then romp over to put in an hour guarding the Slides. We were exhausted by mid afternoon from the enforced hiking from one attraction to another. For Resort Lodging, this is a beautiful place. As a Water Park experience, I would warn Parents with small children and older folks not to bother.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: PEREA81
Reviews.Content: Really spacious resort and the water park is excellent great place to take children and there is a mall close by with a movie theater.

Reviews.Title: “Do not drink out of the coffee mugs or glasses... wash tem yourself.”
Reviews.Author: Dudly123
Reviews.Content: I watched the maid wash our glasses and mugs in the sink then dry them with the same cloth she used to wipe down the sinks and counters. She may have used the same cloth to wipe down the toilets but did not see that. I tried to tell the cleaning staff the potential of getting people sink from doing this but none spoke English. New glasses were brought to our room at my request. The staff person carried the four glasses and two mugs with his finger inside them. The cleaning staff and supervisors have no idea how germs are spread. We did not eat at any of the Arizona Grand Resort restaurants of coffee shops in fear that the sanitary conditions were the same there.

Reviews.Title: “DISCUSTING!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennuh
Reviews.Content: I absolutely cannot believe that I actually paid money to stay there! I am aresident of Mesa and saved up for my familys "staycation"..... I SHOULD HAVE STAYED HOME!!!! The water park was FILTHY!!!! Not to mention that I had to wait TWO HOURS IN LINE to check in and carry all my own bags to my room with my 8 month old infant. When I FINALLY made it to "My room" SOMEONE ELSE was staying there!!!!!! I ABSOULTELY WOULD NOT NOT RECCOMEND THIS "RESORT"/ HOTEL, especially if you are not fond of CONTRACTING YEAST INFECTIONS FROM THE WAVE POOL, which I was told by an employee that they NEVER have cleaned!!!!! GROSS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accomodations complete with a beautiful water park and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: kevin-sandi
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night as we were wrapping up a trip in Arizona. The main attraction for us was the Oasis water park, as we have three small children. The resort far exceeded our expectations. It was great to be able to print our boarding passes right in the lobby as we checked in. Since we had a late afternoon flight, we were able to extend our checkout until 3pm (for only an additionaly $25) so we could stay and enjoy the park. My children loved the wave pool, river, kiddy area, and water slides. We could have stayed far longer in the Oasis than the 3 hours we allowed. Our suite seemed huge - separate living room and bedroom areas, each with its own television. We ordered pizza for dinner from room service. It was great not having to drag our kids out. Their were always lots of staff members available to help with anything we needed. If we have the opportunity to visit Phoenix again, we will definately return here!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dated and Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: ScottandLaurie
Reviews.Content: Ew! What a terrible place! The best comparison to this place would be a random roadside Motel. Old rooms, tube tv's, tiny bathroom, postage stamp sized towels - the whole place just looked and felt dated and dirty. The food offerings were barely a step above fast foods. The crowd this place attracted looked more like a methamphetamine convention group - tatoos, grossly obese etc. - I could not wait to leave and get a clean shower. The room furniture was old and the place looked like they ran out of money for maintenance/updating. I would not put my toe in any pool/water park water - this place just gave me the chills and grossed me out in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “stay ok except challenged by security when attempting to check out”
Reviews.Author: rhhjch
Reviews.Content: Overall stay was pleasant through a busy weekend. Food is average, rooms are clean & waterpark nice. We left our valuables in the room safe the day of checkout with the intent of checking out of room via room TV prior to the 12:00PM checkout time. left 'do not disturb' sign on door. Arrived at room at 11:45 to find sign taken away. used my key to enter room to find maid finishing up. The maid gestured for me to leave; I tried to explain that i was checking out & getting my valuables, however, she did not understand english. She apparently left to get security & returned with 3 of them demanding my identification. I explained what I was trying to do, however, they still demanding ID. After showing the ID he stated they have a lot of security problems & he was protecting my valuables. Interestingly he had no paperwork to determine or verify my name, nor did he apologize after I suggested one was in order...just stating that they have a lot of security problems. I sought out the general manager who was not on site, but, did speak to the acting manager who apologized. not sure what their big security problems are, but, unfortunately its not a very nice way to treat a paying guest with his family. i've stayed in hotels around the world & have not been treated as though I was a criminal. The acting manager didn't offer any free meals or drinks considering the situation. The staff needs to speak the language of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Time~!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANNTAX
Reviews.Content: The one thing that struck me about our stay, was how friendly and helpful all of the employees were. They always asked did you enjoy this or that etc. The resort is very clean, food was good and plentiful. I loved the stay, and would highly recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: lovetraveling10
Reviews.Content: We love this resort. We stayed 3 nights in V425 in the Villas and our room was just great. The bed was absolutely wonderful, large bathroom, flat screen tv, in room coffee, great view of the water park, very quiet, and very, very clean. We did'nt use the water park but we walked through it. What a great place for kids and families we just did'nt have time. The entire resort is just beautiful and immaculate. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. It's a large resort so they have golf carts to take you to your room or anywhere you want to go at the resort. There is a shuttle that will take you to the Arizona Mills Outlet Mall just a few minutes away and they were always on time taking and picking up. We ate at the lobby bar and it was good the Pina Coladas where great! One evening we ate at the Rustler's Rooste and it was just OK. Don't get the ribs. Someone told us the ribs weren't very good but my daughter got them anyway and she didn't care for them at all. Prime Rib and Pork Chops were good. We went to Kona Grill in Chandler they have great food and a wonderful atmosphere. Love the Arizona Grand Resort!

Reviews.Title: “jewel in the desert”
Reviews.Author: Gail05
Reviews.Content: Arizona Grand did a whole new renovation to its property...its in phoenix but NO CACTUSES! This resort is self containing and no need to leave property. Variety of restaurants on site, all the fun the kids could even want, the resort has a water park that is hands down the best at any hotel/resort. Need to improve guest rooms tho with a ceiling fan in the bedroom, over the bed...and flat screen tv's in all rooms would put the final touch on a great destination resort! will stay again and recommend to all my friends and family..Great rates for corporate clients also....New villas are there as well and for sale with great options for reimbursement on your unit if the hotel needs your villa when you are not using it! New ideas, New rooms, New hot spot in the desert...AZ Grand Resort

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixFernandom
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand Resort represents quality. We received warm and pleasant reception from the staffs and the room and other facilites are outstanding. This place is perfect for family activities as well as for business travelers who wish to conduct meetings and conventions and unwind after a hard day's work..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: carlabella16
Reviews.Content: I recently attend a conference at the Arizona Grand Resort and had a great time. The conference facilities were wonderful and very spacious. My husband came with me and he enjoyed the golf course while I was in seminars all day. The course was challenging but beautiful. He said he really enjoyed it. We had some very tasty dinners on the resort and really liked Rustler's Roost! We tried fried rattlesnake and it was great! The pool was just okay but the water park in general was pretty nice. I was grateful to have that to cool off in the heat! The room was really nice and comfortable. I liked having a separate room to do work while my husband relaxed. The staff were really nice and answered all of our questions. We had a nice 4 days here!

Reviews.Title: “It was Awesome! The rooms and water park were great.”
Reviews.Author: Janeen111
Reviews.Content: The staff was so friendly from the minute we got there. Everything was clean, well stocked and it made the whole trip enjoyable. We were with family and friends, a big once-a-year getaway we all do in state and we would definitely go back to the Arizona Grand Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Arizona Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: familytripdad
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here on a family trip. Grounds beautiful and service second-to-none. Water park great and not too crowded even on a Saturday. Rooms nice and clean although a microwave would have been nice and who doesn't have flat screen TV's these days? Food and drink at the water park and Marketplace Cafe reasonably priced for a resort and of excellent quality. Would definitely stay again - great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get away, without leaving home..”
Reviews.Author: bluemandm
Reviews.Content: Always a Wonderful Stay. You can find something for all ages. From Little ones to Adluts.. Even some peace and relaxing comfort. Its a must visit....

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, but nice!”
Reviews.Author: fab4Ma
Reviews.Content: We just got back, water park was great, but don't bring any snacks, they will take it from your, they will let you have waters. You are not allowed to bring in outside alcohol to your room. They have a sign that says it is unlawful. $32 for a bottle of white zin from them! kinda crazy. Just throw your empties in an outside trach the next morning! The suites were nice and clean the king size bed was comfortable. Its not a good area where the hotel is located, there is a grocery store and many food chains, but not really a tourist area. A little disappointing for the money we spent. Next time we will be staying in Sedona. Very nice there.

Reviews.Title: “Families with small children in mid-summer: You will have fun”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegianOnVacation
Reviews.Content: This review is written for families with small children. I have two wonderful daughters, 6 and 4. We traveled to the Arizona Grand in mid-July. After many hours of scouring the internet for a nice hotel, this seemed to be the place to go. Let me give you some practical, honest input on this resort: 1. The heat. I am from San Diego. I hadn't read too many reviews that detailed whether small kids could take Phoenix's stifling heat. Rest assured, your kids will be fine. My kids, surprisingly, almost made no fuss about the heat. In a way, it was kind of fun trying to avoid the heat. The cool thing (no pun intended) about Phoenix is that it's always warm. We made sure to swim in the early morning or early evening, around 6, to avoid the suns direct rays (and to avoid getting sunburned). It you go out to the pool at 9 a.m, it's already 95 degrees. However, the sun isn't high in the sky, so you don't get scorched by its direct rays. By the same token, we hit up the water park late in the day, when the suns direct rays weren't real bad. All pools and the waterpark had bathwater, warm water (ahhh!!!). 2. How was the water park? It looks fabulous on the internet, but kids under 7 will be too scared to ride the slides. There are only three slides, with two of them being 7-story dropouts (fun for adults!). This was disappointing, as I was hoping for more slides for the kids. There is one tame slide that kids might be able to go down, but they don't let kids slide down with their parents. That's too bad. My daughters would have gone if they could have slid with me, but they were too scared to go alone. I get tired of hotels and water parks assuming that a catastrophe will occur if an adult slides down with their children. It won't. If the resort reads this, I highly recommend that you change this policy. Otherwise, your small children will not be able to use any slides. My daughters would have likely spent hours going down this one slide with their mom and dad if this rule wasn't in place. To be honest, I thought that they would at least have one or two slides for smaller kids. Nope. Kind of hard to believe. Aside from the slide, they have a wave pool. This was cool. Both of my daughters enjoyed it. The wave pool was about half the size of any wave pool that you'd find at a Knotts Soak City or any other wave park. It was fun. They also have a lazy river. It's your typical lazy river. There is also a separate pool for general frolicking or volley ball playing. It was about 5 feet deep. Nothing great, nothing bad. The water was pleasantly warm. They have a VERY nice toddler pool. My kids aren't toddlers, but, if you have a child that is just walking, or maybe up to 2 years old, the toddler pool is fantastic! It is about the size of a large, backyard pool. Not huge, but a fairly decent size, and get this: The deepest part is 1 1/2 feet deep! Totally safe! On top of that, they let parents put the poolside chairs into this toddler pool, so they can actually sit in the pool while their toddler plays. If you have toddlers, this pool, alone, would probably make the trip worth it. You don't ever find 1 1/2 pools at hotels. All-in-all, I would give the waterpark a 6 1/2 on scale of 10, but don't be dismayed. The pools within the hotel make the visit worth it, even if the waterpark is only pretty good. If they would let the parents slide with the kids, it would bump it up to 7 1/2. They actually need to put a few slides in for kids. I wish they had a few slides similar to what the Great Wolf Lodges have for kids (If you haven't been to a Great Wolf Lodge, then you have TOTALLY missed out on the best place to take kids 10-and-under). 3. Redemption for the waterpark. The waterpark TOTALLY redeems itself on weekend nights. Starting at 6, they have a DJ and dancing. Some people have complained (What???). The music made for a VERY festive atmosphere. My wife and daughter got out to dance, while me and my other daughter lounged in the wave pool. It got better at 8 p.m., when a giant screen came down and they played a Disney movie. IT WAS FANTASTIC! Everybody sat on rafts in the big pool and watched. It was wonderful. It was the perfect night. 4. The interior pools saved the day! We spent more time swimming in the pool in our hotel courtyard area, than in the water park. It was a very large pool and the water temperature was bathwater warm (ahhhhh!). We usually waited until after 7 p.m. to swim. At this time of day, the sun was behind the building, so you weren't in direct sun light. My daughters would usually swim for about 2 hours. The deepest part was only 5 feet, and this was in the very middle of the pool. Yes, they do allow floaties. 5. The rooms were very nice and very large. I was actually impressed with them. I have stayed at a lot of hotels. It was nice. The beds were very comfortable! The air conditioner was in fine form. We usually kept our room in the high 60s! 6. Other. The hotel is about 1/2 a mile from the Arizona Mills mall. We spent several afternoons at the mall, to avoid the mid-day heat. We had a lot of fun. The food court was large and pretty cool, and had a large merry-go-round. Also, there's a movie theater next to the food court. Also, they have the Sea Life Aquarium at the mall. The Sea Life Aquarium isn't an all-day activity (more like 1 1/2 hours). It's NOT Sea World, or anything close to it, but it's not bad. It's a little pricey ($17 adults, $9 for kids), but it's not a bad place to go. As for the mall, they have tons of actual outlet stores where you can actually get real bargains. Something unheard of in San Diego. Very nicely decorated mall. It sounds kind of pathetic to suggest that hanging out at a mall is part of a vacation itinerary, but, when you are trying to avoid the heat, it's oddly kind of fun! 7. Other ideas. I would recommend the Museum of Natural History for one afternoon. I am not much of a museum guy, but this one was fantastic! My daughters LOVED it. It completely outclassed any museum in San Diego. 8. Bummers. There weren't too many negatives about the hotel, but there were a few. First, there is no free internet service (it's $14.95 a day). But that's not bad, as it keeps you off the internet. Also, they don't have any luggage carts! What? I was too cheap to pay the clerk to take my luggage to the room. When I got to my hotel courtyard, I found out that there are no luggage carts. The hotel needs to supply luggage carts. Next, there are no microwave ovens in the room, but we called the desk and they brought us one! All-in-all, this was a very nice place to stay. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as always!”
Reviews.Author: kik23
Reviews.Content: This is our third year going to this resort. As always a great trip. We go once a year. The kids love the water park, my wife loves the spa, and I love the fitness center. It is the best of any hotel we've ever been too. The price is good for a suite. There is a $30.00 per day resort fee, that includes the water park, spa, and fitness center. The only negative thing is that they used to have the wireless internet included in the resort fee. This year they changed it. You now have to pay an extra $14.00 and change per day to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: deerae69
Reviews.Content: I can't rave enough about this resort. What a fun and relaxing get-away. Grounds are GORGEOUS and well maintained. Pools are sparkling clean. Rooms are super clean and roomy. Staff was friendly and attentive. My only negative remark would be the over priced food by the pool. Prices were absurd and food taste/qaulity did not match the price, but our fun out-weighed that negative. Can't wait to schedule our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME surprise trip for husband's 60th birthday”
Reviews.Author: spurgeonlover
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful resort.....husband & I were truly surprised (we hope to stay again SOON!!). We would be giving this a 10 STAR if possible.........except for one big problem. We were aware of the $30/per night fee for "extras" (we stayed 5 nights).....and paid it willingly. We did not use any of the workout facilities. We received 4 waterpark "bracelets" and planned to take our Phoenix son/wife to the Oasis waterpark on Monday night, June 7 (it was 113 degrees then!!). Well, we arrived to the waterpark at 4:30 P.M. only to discover that it was reserved that evening for a private party. What a disappointment to be sure as we were really looking forward to the AWESOME park! We were going to mention this problem to the front staff when we checked out except there were too many checking in/out. ................................ The room was very lovely, the grounds are immaculate, we walked all around there every morning and evening. Husband said it was the most beautiful place we ever stayed at, YES, he sure was surprised and happy. We ate 3 times at the Lobby Grill, once at Rustler's Rooste, great food (best prime rib EVER). Also a lovely gift shop and gorgeous lobby. It is right next door to the South Mountain Park and we hiked back there several times. We hated to leave and head back to Michigan. Yes, we are saving our $$ to go again.

Reviews.Title: “GOUGED, OVERPRICED, OLD / OUTDATED , BAD SERVICE, 20 YEAR OLD T.V'S‎”
Reviews.Author: jscony
Reviews.Content: The only thing that was above average abour our stay was the arrival. Friendly reception from canopy man/ info man, valet, front desk, and an awesome golf cart man / bellman that led us to our room and took our luggage up a flight of stairs.I regret forgetting his name so we could give him his due credit. Room was not as nice as I would expect for the price, and like I mentioned before, there was no elevator. T.V's were 20+ years old and I'm not exaggerating at all. I looked at the back of them for the manufacture date because I couldn't believe how old and terrible they looked. The bedroom T.V. was blurry and unwatchable.We wanted to order a movie for the bedroom T.V. but could not because the picture was terrible. We called the front desk and they said they would send someone out to look at / fix the T.V. 45 minutes later nobody had showed up, I called again and they said they would radio someone and get them there fast. 15 minutes later no one had showed up so I called the front desk again and told them to forget about it now because we were exhausted and ready for bed by then. It was definitely nothing but lip service. I don't think the T.V. was fixable, it just needed to be replaced with a model that isn't 20 years old. The $30 per night motels have nicer T.V's than this RESORT!! They charge you $15 per day for internet access so we didn't use it, a $30 resort fee which I assume is for the water park. Water Park was massively crowded with limited pool loungers. The water park grounds are not nearly as spacious as they look in the pictures, there are a lot of things left out in the pictures so it looks more open and inviting. Good luck finding a place to sit and relax if you are not there first thing in the morning when they open. There was a 15 minute line in the morning to get into the water park because they are so busy rifling through everyones bags to make sure nobodys bringing ANY outside food or beverage. We are obviously not the only people unaware of this. Every time I came in or left the park they were scolding and confiscating items from some other unfortunate/clueless person about the same thing.They absolutely gouge you in every way possible. They don't tell you when you book the room that you can't bring in any snacks, water, or other outside food and beverage to the water park. It makes for very expensive days with the kids.There were lines for the slides and even lines to get a tube to get on the lazy river, it was rediculous. Upon checkout we were not asked how our stay was, were not offered an apology, and were not offered any concessions/credits for the trouble we experienced. We have stayed at a few Scottsdale Resorts in the summer like Westin Kierland / JW Marriot that are much nicer and a much better overall value, places that genuinely seemed concerned about your happiness. My family won't ever return to this place. We will spend our dollar elsewhere and would suggest the same to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great family fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: kayak69
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand Resort is an excellent getaway for any family or single couples. The water park has to be the best. Kid friendly and plenty of staff to assist your needs. The rooms are nice, however I would recommend staying in a Villa if you have more than 2 kids. Only downside would be the $15.00 daily rate for internet access. I can't think of a single hotel/motel that charges for internet access these days.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolutly Fantastic Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: jsegan
Reviews.Content: We recently had the great pleasure of staying at this resort along with another family for our summer vacation. This was the first out-of-state family vacation for both of our families and it was FAN"TASTIC. My11y.o. daughters' initial reaction when pulling up to the resort was "I didn't know it was going to be so fancy". For 5 days, we were treated as if we were the only guests there. The entire staff was both professional and polite, the rooms were beautiful with the beds being extremely comfortable, and the grounds, including the pools were well-kept, clean, and simply BEAUTIFUL!. We are alreadly looking forward to planning another family vacation there! Thank You Arizona Grand!!

Reviews.Title: “Is It the Arizona Grand Resort, or the America Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: pocketfullofsonshine
Reviews.Content: We returned last night from a one week stay at the Arizona Grand Resort. My daughters' entire volleyball club (20 teams, coaches, families) stayed there while playing at the Volleyball Festival in PHX. I would be challenged to find a nicer resort in America with the number of activities and amenities and exceptional service for the price. There is a waterpark, 6 pools, a fitness center, spa and more. The resort is 15 minutes from the convention center, where we played every day, yet you felt like you are worlds away from the city. I never heard a single complaint from any person in our group. It is fwy close. It is one block from an outlet mall/IMAX theatres. Near many eateries. I especially appreciated the fact that every member of the staff showed their sincere gratitude for our business. I had superb service. Rooms were exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “The Arizona Grand Resort was the perfect place to stay when combining buisness and family travel.”
Reviews.Author: rsmith4175
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were fortunate to have chosen the Arizona Grand as our resort during a recent business/leisure trip. During my meetings, our family was able to enjoy the lovely water park and other facilities. There are a several resturants on the property and many in the surrounding community. The staff was friendly and helpful. If I have the opportunity to visit the Phoenix area again, I would not hesitate to stay at the Arizona Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Rob909
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort as the last stop on our loop through Arizona. We stayed 2 nights and the whole idea of staying here was to simply relax and end the vacation at a place where the kids could just play at the water park all day. We stayed 2 nights in a Mountainside Suite, and the property itself was fantastic. The walk to Oasis is not long at all, so don’t feel like you need to pay extra to stay in a Sedona or Camelback Suite because they are closer. It’s really not an issue. The rooms were very nice and well kept. The grounds were kept tidy. And Oasis was very fun for the kids. They didn’t get out of the water for 2 days. But I do think the lazy river could be kept a bit more clean of floating debris. Our overall stay was very enjoyable, but there a couple things I need to mention. First, who still charges $14.95 a day for wireless internet service? Are you kidding me! I had just come from 2 less expensive hotels in Arizona where it was free and worked well. I don’t understand the logic of a 4 star resort having the rates they do and then still trying to squeeze out extra from their guests for internet service. Needless to say I didn’t pay for it. Secondly, I was a bit unhappy with some off-duty lifeguards at Oasis who I overheard mentioning amongst themselves “we have to check the water levels” and “it works every time” cutting to the front of the line of children, making their announcement, and then going down the slide head first in front of all of them, which is against the rules. As you can guess every child that witnessed this wanted to go down head first when their turn came, but were told they couldn’t. My take on this is rules are rules for EVERYONE, and at no time should off-duty lifeguards be cutting in front of paying guests. Other than the things mentioned above, the resort is a great place to stay. I would consider staying there again if the rates were in line with what I now know to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk issues”
Reviews.Author: Bigcityeater
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix just for 1 day and the Grand Resort was close to the business meeting I had to get to early in the morning. My room was as far away from the lobby as you could possibly get. A golf cart took me to the room when i checked in and i was informed when i checked out make sure i call the front desk to ask for a golf cart to pick me up and take me back to the lobby. The next morning I called the front desk and asked for a ride back to the lobby. After waiting 20 minutes i called again and a rude employee told me that they were too busy to send one but would do so now. After 15 more minutes it was obvious that it was never going to happen. I ended up walking to the (empty) lobby where outside the golf carts were lined up. The hotel itself was fine but for a business traveler who got in around 9 at night and left at 7:30 in the morning to pay a $30 resort fee on top of the hotel rate is not worthwhile. I would stay there again for pleasure but take my advice and skip it for the business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: ShoreTraveler104
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Camelback Suites with two boys ages 8 and 5. The room was clean and spacious. The kids had a great time in the water park, especially the wave pool. The service around the pool area was fast and friendly. The water park was a bit busier on the weekend than weekdays, but we were able to find a chair (with two kids you really aren't sitting anyway). Food and drink prices are average for a resort. Staff throughout the entire hotel were friendly and courteous. A very nice trip overall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort for families!”
Reviews.Author: greerfamily4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AZ Grand Resort this past weekend with a group of 5 families, all with children under the age of 5. We had such a wonderful weekend! We stayed in a Camelback King Suite and it was a terric suite, perfect for our family of 4. We were able to have all 5 families in rooms right next to each other, and the suites had balconies in a beautiful setting, so we were able to sit outside all togerher and enjoy the evening after we put our kids to bed. The Oasis Water Park is absolutely fantastic -- something for all ages!! My 4 year old and 1 year old both had so much fun... the wave pool, lazy river and the children's pool with splash area are all great for them and the slides were so much fun for us. They loved the music and dancers that the resort had out by the water park too. We also really enjoyed the wonderful breakfast buffet they had on Father's Day, terrific food and great for the kids too. The staff was incredibly accomadating of our 1 yr old making a bit of a mess! We would not hesitate to return to this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Fabulous Trip Within 30 Minutes Of Home Ever”
Reviews.Author: 1077children1077
Reviews.Content: How do you sum up the time of your life in a sentence? My name is Christi, and I have 5 children. When I come home and say, "Guess where we are going this weekend?" It is quite something to hear all of the children yell, "The Arizona Grand!" Their ages are 16, 14, 11, 10, and 3. I share this with you because you can see that there is something for every single age. My teenage boys play golf with my husband, then come meet myself and the girls at the Oasis waterpark for even more fun! After eating, we can wrap up our night by watching a movie in a tube floating on the water, it is amazing! The Spa is equally as fun. I love how relaxed I feel when I leave there. We live 30 minutes away from the Resort, so we get the amazing opportunity to stay there every few weeks or so. It is so affordable, and the customer service is the best I have ever received. They remember us all the time, and even those who don't, act like they do. We love the feeling of being spoiled while we are on a mini vacation. We feel like we have spent thousands of dollars and have only spent a couple hundred if you can believe it! We love it there, and we have fould a family vacation spot that comes first on our list! That is how highly we reguard this Resort! Do yourself a favor and pamper yourself. Even when it is just myself and my husband, we don't even have to leave the goergeous suites just for a weekend of relaxing. We can even go to the water park without kids and enjoy the beautiful scenery and the wonderful waiters and waitresses poolside. The Arizona Grand wrote the book on how to give the best customer service with a smile. We love it and will continue to be regular loyal customers. Thank You to the Staff, our family has fould a place to get away, often, because of the price and the service. Thank You, Thank You, Thank You :)

Reviews.Title: “A Fathers Day Weekend We Will Never Forget! TOP NOTCH ALL THE WAY”
Reviews.Author: fourwithamap
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get a group of 5 families and 9 kids all under the age of 5 together for a sendoff of one of our friends as they will be moving out of state so it crossed our mind, why not do a staycation at the Arizona Grand Resort and Spa. All of us have never stayed there before and had no idea what to expect but were amazed that they were able to get us 5 rooms all adjoining just steps away from the main reason why we choose to visit, the Oasis Waterpark. From there the expierence kept getting better and better! When we first checked in the front desk was super fast and extreamly courteous` for all our needs and requests. The rooms were ready before they were supposed to be and the bellhop even drove us to our rooms in a golf cart. My room was impeccable like they had just cleaned it right before I walked in, very impresssive not to mention a huge back patio that we enjoyed countless hours of laughs on. I was impressed by the number of pools that were within 100 feet from my room there was one on the 2nd (ground floor ) and one on the 1st floor ( sunken basement style ) not to mention the arcade! The Oasis water park is bar none the best resort water park we have ever visited; there was so much to do for all our kids that it made it a relaxing time for us adults as it kept them entertained. From the dedicated kiddie’s pool with large splash pad to the bigger pool with volleyball, basketball and swimming to really cool wave pool, to the waterslides and the Lazy river there was never a dull moment. You should check it out over the summer when they have their entertainment with Grand Jam Dancers, fun and games, contests, Dj and a dive in movie. The best part was to see the little kids get up on stage and dace for about 3 hours with everyone. The Water Park was very well run, very clean, great food & buffet, friendly service, and entertainment. The only issue is that we are going to be short a family next month as we already are staring to make this a monthly summer gathering for all the kids since we had such an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel where young and old have fun.”
Reviews.Author: sodonnell55
Reviews.Content: We spent Father's Day at the Arizona Grand Resort with our children and their families. Most of our time was spent at the Hotels water park , where they had events going all day, they had picture coloring , hula hoop contest , a lazy river to float on, and a lunch buffet when you were ready to eat. We had just as much fun as our grandkids. The rooms were very nice, and the beds were the best we have slept on in a long time. We would deffinitely recommend this hotel to anyone that will be traveling to the Phoenix area, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this place”
Reviews.Author: VegasGuy2010
Reviews.Content: It seems great on the face of it - nice pool, slides for the kids/water park. However, we had some issues here. They put us on the 5th floor, Camelback bldg - nice location. But the only elevator within 100 yards of the place was broken ALL WEEKEND. I have a bad foot and was forced to lug 6 bags up (and down) 5 flight of stairs - I'm sure the other guests all felt the same way I did. Called the front desk to find out when the elevator was going to be fixed, got nothing but lip service and a shallow "I'm sorry for your troubles." Are you kidding me? ANY other hotel would have had a guy there in the middle of the night fixing the elevator. Not the Arizona Grand. Next, the hair dryer in the room started smoking and sparking and almost blew up right in my wife's hand. Nice. We ordered room service, the empty tray remained outside our door for over 24 hours. Our balcony had a pigeon that had set up it's nest directly on the ledge on our balcony - with its corresponding bird droppings which had never been cleaned up for months. Finally, at 5:30 AM our first morning there, the fire alarm (a very LOUD shreak) went off for over 45 seconds, of course waking everyone. Never did find out what that was all about. Finally, in a world with data everything, they charge $14.95 a night for WIFI? HA! HA! This place is really the stone ages, almost all 4 star hotels give WIFI now complimentary. We will NEVER stay here again. No way, no how. Take my advice traveler's, stay away from the Arizona Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Hotellybelly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here early may 2007 with my mother and a few friends. we had a 1 bedroom suite that only cost us about $100 We walked in and had to wait a few minutes to get our room key but that was no problem, finding the room was a little tricky though but they gave us directions when we asked. our room ended up being right above the pool area which was beautiful and quiet and it had a staircase right outside to get there. the best part of this hotel was the waterpark! you get in free with your stay which me and my friend really liked, only downside was they had a no shoes policy and the ground was too hot to walk on so we had to run back to the room for water shoes. we actually saw more adults and older teens at the pool then we did children. the hotel has a couple of resteraunts which were very nice but kind of pricey. the hotel also has some cheap shops inside which came in handy after a bee sting incident, they gave us some free benedryl and an ice pack and called the room to make sure i was okay later on. the room was incredibly comfortable it had a living room with sleeper sofa and a seperate bedroom with 2 queen beds and a bathroom and tv, the living room also had a tv plus a great kitchenette with stove microwave coffee pot and mini fridge. we stayed there for 3 nights and would love to stay again some time. only downsides were that if its raining the balcony can be incredibly slippery and you will want to dry it off before you step outside, you will slip if you dont, and the room we got was facing an ugly busy street and the rooms werent all too sound proof. some features of the hotel are hiking horseback riding golf waterpark conference center they do weddings.

Reviews.Title: “The only bad thing was that we had to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle1971
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend at this incredible resort to celebrate my daughter's 9th birthday. We purchased a Suite that overlooked the Oasis water park at the back of the property. From the time we arrived we were treated like we owned the entire place by the staff who constantly went out of their way to take care of us. I spent my time relaxing at the water park while my daughter and her friends danced on stage with a professional cheerleading squad. We also enjoyed the Lazy River and two of the tallest/fastest water slides I have ever seen in my life. They even hosted a movie at 8pm outside on a big projector screen by the tidal pool. It was very family friendly for young kids or teenagers. Even though it is very hot in Phoenix this time of year you can get some great summer rates and still enjoy the outdoors in the water. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Omg this resort is very racist!!”
Reviews.Author: freebird18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very racist and it really shows when it comes to service! We were always having to look for our server and she was very rude never smiled for that matter really never said anything. Took my kids to the bufffet and they were in a hurry to get us out of there very rude!! You would think for the money we spent here they could at least try being more polite!! Will not be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “This Is the best place I ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: cindyoz
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay at very clean. The water park is awsome the kids loved it there and so did the adults. They food was great to. Rooms VEry clean Very nice. I have been back 2 times and never been dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay-cation for holiday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Palina
Reviews.Content: We have some beautiful resorts in the Phoenix area that offer great rates in the hot summer months. For Memorial weekend I choose the Arizona Grand. We wanted a "stay-cation" where we could enjoy a weekend together with 4 adults and 2 children. We had a wonderful time as a family but I can't give the hotel all the credit. The rooms were ok. Two room suites. TVs were old/small and there weren't a lot of frills. For us it was still ok. Small pools by each of the buildings was nice. The water park was a shock because of the crowds. Standing room only on Sunday. Felt like everything was dirty and crowded and not very relaxing. The next day was better. We got down to the water park at 9:00 am and there was a long line waiting to open at 9:30. However, we did get a nice spot and it made a big difference. Employee told me they have an average of 6000 people on a summer holiday. The food in the water park was WAY over priced and you can't bring anything in. Drinks almost $10- a corn dog was $6. I generally don't complain about the cost of hotel food but since it was a Stay-cation it bothered me more. The hotel has a well known restaurant at the top of the hill (hotel is at the bottom) called Rustler's Roost. I don't think I have ever had a good meal here but the atmosphere is amazing. Especially for you out of towners...you can see all of the valley and it is a spectacular view. The grandkids danced to the live band and went down the big slide. Kids ate free and our bill was cheaper than the pool grill. The cotton candy bouquet after dinner was all of our favorites. Entrees were just so-so. This is defintely an experience and not just a meal. Food was MUCH better at the mexican restaurant in front of the hotel "Aunt Chiladas". Pricey but good and we enjoyed one last family meal before everyone went in their separate directions. We enjoyed the weekend - biggest complaint was the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service - Try Hilton Squaw Peak”
Reviews.Author: KCK_CO
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this resort to meet with friends and relax with the family. As part of the stay, I purchased an extra Oasis Access band for $30. The charge for the ban is per day for the length of your stay UNLESS you return the ban to the front desk. After a day at the pool, I returned the ban to make sure I would not be charged for the extra days and I was assured the charge would only be for the day of use. To make sure, I went by the next morning and I again was told everything was fine. On the day of checkout, the lines were long and I had to leave to catch a flight. I called to have my invoice sent to me and noticed that I was charged an extra day for the band. I called the front desk and was attacked by the customer service representative that I did not follow the rules. I've stayed at several Phoenix resort properties and it's sad to say that this is not one of them. If you have young children and need to relax and not be bothered with the hassle of being charged for everything under the sun and then questioned on your invoice, I would go to Hilton Squaw Peak. Check it out before you book your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great but high price”
Reviews.Author: jaylawrence
Reviews.Content: Great for the family. We had a suite with an attached room for our son. Truly enjoyed and a great place for our family to enjoy. The swimming pool water park was great and relaxing with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I Have Been To!”
Reviews.Author: Josh1221
Reviews.Content: I have been to the hotel twice and both times I have had a great experience! The rooms are VERY nice and the oais (pool) is also nice to kick back and hang out! I HIGHLY recommend staying when you get a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Our family was blown away by this amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: minickfamily
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW! We booked a suite at this resort to celebrate my son and father's birthday. We were interested in this resort because we heard they had a great water park and in this desert heat, that's exactly what we were looking for. We arrived at the resort 3 hours before check-in, so that we could play in the Oasis Water Park all day. When we got there, our room was already ready! The staff was so friendly and so helpful, we were already beyond impressed within 5 minutes of arrival. Then, we were taken to our suite and we were even more blown away! We did not expect to be staying in such a beautiful, spacious room! The bedroom was HUGE with a comfy king bed and an entrance to the balcony that overlooked a rolling green golf course and a gorgeous waterfall! The bathroom was gigantic, with a large garden tub and a seperate all-glass shower that was the size of a large elevator! Very romantic :) This suite had a full size kitchen (full size fridge, oven/stove, microwave, etc..) and the dining and living area was very spacious as well. The couch folded out to a queen size bed, where the kids ended up sleeping. Flat screen TVs, beautiful decor and very very CLEAN. The Oasis Water Park was a BLAST! The kids ran around all day, playing in the wave pool, flying down the huge waterslides and floating down the lazy river. My husband and I enjoyed laying out in the sun with yummy frozen drinks and even floated around the lazy river ourselves. We ordered food while we were out there (nachos, wings, chicken sandwich) and it was top notch. I can't say enough great things about this resort. I am DEFINATELY going to plan another weekend getaway here! We even played at the water park all day on Sunday after check-out. This resort is only 30 mins away from our home and it felt like we were on a distant vacation. We didn't feel like we were anywhere near home!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds...overpriced rooms”
Reviews.Author: balloonrally
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Arizona Grand Resort to relax after our trip to the Grand Canyon and Sedona area. It was a very large, impressive resort wth gorgeous landscaping. But, the room was definately not $300/night quality. Carpet was stained, doors squeaked, bathroom too small to turn around in, living area small overall for a suite. Pool amenities including waterpark were nice, Food prices were too expensive, extra fees for resort were waived due to our late arrival one night (but had to request this) and extra internet charge - really? Ridiculous. Shuttle service to the Rustler's Rooste restaurant was a nice feature. Not sure we would stay again at these prices. I think they could improve some things for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Really. $15 a day for Internet on top of a $30 resort fee and $250 room.”
Reviews.Author: Really2010
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe it when I tried to get online and found out they charge 15 a day. It's just tacky. If the resort needs to increase revenue raise the room rate, the resort fee, restaurant prices or charge extra for the water park. It's just insulting to charge money for something that costs almost nothing to provide and is typically free. Bad move Az Grand...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Upscale Renovated Resort in a Convienent Location”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsintom
Reviews.Content: Our family which includes three teenagers travelled to the Arizona Grand Resort for our Easter Break from high school. The primary reason for our trip to Arizona was the warm weather and sightseeing-not necessarily to use the facilities at the resort including the large water park. I chose it for the location of the resort; reasonable room rates and the reviews on TripAdvisor/Frommer's. We have previously travelled as a family to Iberostar and Beaches Resorts and to Atlantis among others. My wife and I have travelled to Sandals Resorts, Dreams Resorts, Sunscapes Resorts, etc. and I have reviewed most of these locations. This appears to be an older resort that has been extensively renovated. It is relatively large and does require some walking to the pools and restaurants. The buildings and grounds are well maintained and attractive. We rented a one bedroom suite that had a view of the mountains; golf course and ponds. The room had two queen beds in one room; a living room area with a pull out couch; one bathroom and a balcony for our family of five. The room was nicely appointed and had ample storage for our family. The balcony was a nice place to have a cup of coffee and read the paper in the morning. The carpeting and furnishing were upscale and appeared to be newer. The beds and bedding were very comfortable and the A/C was easy to use and effective. We were very pleased with the room and amenities considering the reasonable price we paid even when the $30/day resort fee was included. We had very few meals on site at the resort except one breakfast; morning coffee and two late night meals in the bar. We did not eat any of the many buffet meals that were offered. The service that we received in the bar and for breakfast was very good. It appears that most of the wait staff are college kids who were very friendly. The food and beverages were pricey but you are at a resort and the rooms were reasonably priced. The large gift shop area had a Starbucks that served coffee and snacks. However, the line was a little long in the morning. The water park would have great apeal for families with kids from age 5 to 15. We are a little past the top end of that range so we used the area mostly for laying in the sun. It was very crowded as it was Easter week during our visit. The water park is completely fenced in. Wrist bands are used for entry. The gates are opened to this area at either 9 AM or 10 AM based upon the day of the week. If you arrived around opening time you could go in; grab some towels and save chairs for your family. The fence around the water park and defined opening time may seem annoying to some one who hasn't travelled much but it is actually a good system. At least 9-10 AM is a reasonable time. At some resorts we have been at, you had to go out at 6 AM to reserve chairs or you were out of luck The water park was well laid out; had lots of chairs and pretty good food service. The water park included three slides; a lazy river and a few other pools. There was also some organized activities going on. You could actually have food and beverages served at your chair which is highly unusual for this type of set up. Again, the food and beverages in this area are pricey but were pretty good and the young college kids were the servers. We did not utilize the golf course or exercise areas during our trip. The resort is located about 10 minutes from the airport which was handy. Another, positive is that their is a large park with mountains adjacent to the property called South Mountain Park. The mountains are nice to look at and we did a little hiking in this area. However, the resort is located in a very urban area with busy roads; fast food joints and shopping areas...some which were not all that upscale. We stopped at a couple of these fast food places on our way out to an activity and they were a little scuzzy. Although you are in an urban area, you will not hear any road noises in the actual resort due to it's large size. There are lots of cool things to do with teenagers in the area (within an hour or two away) and include- 1) Horse Back Riding-Ponderosa Stables-we took the night time ride and dinner combo. This is very nearby the resort. Slow ride for beginners but a nice view of Phoenix after eating at a family type steakhouse. 2) Rafting down a river. Not exactly whitewater rafting but it was only 45 minutes away. Nice guides and nice scenery. Desert Voyages Guided Rafting. 3) ATVing in a national park. This was alot of fun. Again a very nice guide and beautiful scenery. Teenage boys will love this activity. Stellar Adventures. 4) Sedona. This area of red rocks is about two to two and a half hours north. Beautiful scenery especially if you take the drive (about 15 miles) north of Sedona up Oak Creek which has an elevation of 7,000 feet. We took the Pink Jeep Tour and did some hiking in the area. The town of Sedona is not very appealing. It is basically a collection of Tee Shirt shops. This area probably has some of the nicest scenery that I have ever seen and shouldn't be missed. 5) We also took a drive up to the Superstition Mountains and Apache Canyon Drive. This was a beautiful drive. I would highly recommend this resort and the excursions that we took. The rooms in the hotel are very comfortable; room price was reasonable; the staff was above average. Food prices were a little high (10-20%) but you aren't eating at McDonald's or Pizza Hut here. Also, the $30 resort fee is mandatory but not that big a deal when you consider the reasonable room rates. Have a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - But staff could be more knowledgeable”
Reviews.Author: esinil
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful just as described on Web site. Everything was maintained well and room was very comfortable. We stayed an entire week and hated to leave. However, Cleaning staff came at various times each day..once it was at 4:00. Water Park was packed daily due to Spring Break - Lazy River ride was full of leaves and did not seem very clean on several of the days. Returned to room one afternoon and was "locked out" due to an error made by the front desk on my charge card for the daily resort fee. Staff seemed very "put out" to give us a ride back to our room once we spent 1/2 hr. waiting in line to clear up their mistake. Called the front desk one day to see where the Villa's Buffet resturaunt was located...walked all the way over to the resturaunt to find it closed. Walked back and called the front desk again ..only to be told it was only open for Spring Break which ended the day before. Pool hrs. also got shortened once Spring break ended...I didn't think that was fair to all families that stayed beyond Sunday and could have enjoyed the piece and quiet of the uncramped waterpark in the evening. Extra fee for Internet was another inconvience...Most Hotels offer it free..as well as the ECO Laundry Mat located on Rural Rd./Scottsdale Rd. You would think that the $30.00 daily fee would also cover the Internet. I would probably consider staying at the Hotel again..just not during Spring Break

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, No Real Complaints”
Reviews.Author: emosnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife, our 15 yr old son and 10 yr old daughter. Everyone pretty much liked the place. On the plus side - the food was very good and there are enough choices that you could eat exclusively at the hotel if necessary. The water park is great and was one of the main reasons we stayed here since I need to make sure my kids can be entertained. The Service is very professional at all times and very good, from the bellman to the waitresses at the pool or the restaurants. The rooms are decent, the beds are new. The resort is close to the highway so getting in/out is easy. There is a nature preserve next to the hotel which has nice hiking. This was a real bonus cause it made it easy for my family and I to take our first ever hike together. On the negative side - these are not really suites. There's only one bathroom, and it is accessed via the master bedroom. Also, the sofa bed was very uncomfortable for sleeping, so my kids had to split the week and if you need three beds, then you need to have two queens in the master, so there goes the parent's privacy. There's no kitchennete. The resort is in a pretty seedy neighborhood. Skip Rustler's Roost. It's a tourist trap. Also, we went Spring Break and there was a line forming an hour before the water park opened at 10AM so people could get chairs. There were not enough chairs, and a lot of people were layingon towels in the grass. THis is probably not a problem except two weeks out of the year, but you should know this. And oh yeah, taxes, tip, and delivery charges on room service add up to about 30%-40% on already high room service prices. All in all, I would/could recommend this hotel for the value, the food, the water park, the gym/spa, the nature preserve next door, and the service, but it is not a super premium resort and they are not true suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort to visit with your Family”
Reviews.Author: Sagnam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final 3 nights of our Spring Break in Phoenix. We really enjoyed the Resort. We have two sons, 13 and 11, that had a great time in the Oasis Water Park. The faicilities were very nice and the room was slightly larger than what we had at the Hilton Pointe Squaw Peak earlier in the week. We did have an issue witht the mini-fridge not being clean. Also, our room was typically not cleaned until very late in the afternoon each day which was sometimes an inconvenience. I did play golf at the Resort Course and was disappointed in it. There were no balls on the Tees at the Range. We had to go pick up balls ourselves to hit. Even when they sent someone over to pick up balls, he just continued to run up and down the range without immediately getting us some balls to use while he finished. The Course is short and had very slow, shaggy greens. Many of the holes on the front nine wind through a housing development. The back nine is a bit better with holes out in the desert. I played Whirlwind, about a day later for the same price, and it was much more scenic and enjoyable. We did enjoy some late nights in the Courtyard, next to the fireplaces, under 50ft Palm Trees. That was a very cool area to finish out the day. The location is very convenient for getting downtown, to the airport, ASU, and to Old Town Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable relaxing stay in well maintained and serviced accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: FKW
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our week at the resort using the water park, restaurant facilites and well maintained grounds. First time ever on a vacation we have pretty much stayed "put" and just took advantage of facilities offered. Waterpark very clean, picturesque, and well staffed by cheerful, helpful young adults. Food offered both at the water park and in the hotel lobby was fairly priced for a resort. Everyone we encountered at the resort was more than helpful with questions and very pleasant. Grounds are well maintained and provide good walking areas. Room was adequate and nice with the living room seating. Would definitely recommend the resort and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: WiscGirl123
Reviews.Content: We just got back a few days ago from a 5 day stay at the Arizona Grand (over Spring Break). My kids and I had a wonderful time here. They both enjoyed the Oasis Water Park, but as another reviewer mentioned, we needed to get there early to get chairs. On our first day, we weren't able to get to the water park until about 11:45, and we were barely able to find room enough to put our towels on a grassy area. Again it was spring break, so I imagine it would not be like this year round. The staff was very friendly and helpful! At one point I had read that there was a basketball court there, but when I asked one of the bellmen, he said it wasn't there any longer. When I asked for the location of a nearby park with hoops, he drove us to the main lobby in his golf cart, looked up the nearest location, and printed directions! That was very helpful, as we went to that park at least 3 or 4 evenings to play basketball. A couple of things that I found annoying were: 1) Although we were charged a $30 per day resort fee for amenities, this did not include wireless internet access. That was an additional $15 per day, but this was waived for me when I complained about it. 2) Housekeeping did not come at a consistent time each day. We drove to Sedona (a 2.5 hour drive) stayed there for a couple of hours, drove back, went to the pool, and still no housekeeping. They came anywhere from 11am through about 4:30pm. Although, the Oasis water park did not open until 10 am, the smaller pools near the rooms are open at 6 am, in case you have any early risers that want to get an earlier start. Also, the South Mountains trails that were right behind the resort, were wonderful as well! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: kidcass
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic resort for families. Oasis water park is a trip of a lifetime for the kids and adults. The pictures don't do it justice. Lazy river and tide pool were great fun for kids and adults. Poolside food and drinks were great. We will definitely be back. Rooms nice and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, beautiful grounds.”
Reviews.Author: LisaKWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed over spring break. Instead of looking like a regular hotel it looks more like condos. Our room was right outside a courtyard with a smaller pool and hot tub. In the evening we would go in there. The water park was fun for both of our kids aged 11 and 15. It does fill up early so it can be difficult to find chairs together if you are not there early. (it was spring break though). The property is very large and the views from the hiking trails are gorgeous. The golf course is beautiful. Meals can be pricey at any resort so we bought a cheap cooler and ate breakfast and lunch in the room. The grounds are beautiful and very clean. We would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PharmaTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a large business meeting and it was disappointing to say the least. The pictures on the website look much nicer than the actual resort. My room was old, dirty, and overlooked the parking lot. Also, it seemed as if only half of the rooms in my building were being used. Some had plywood over the windows as if there had been a fire, or maybe construction going on. This definately didn't add to the ambiance. All of our meals were served outside in tents, in the freezing cold. Not only that, but the food was barely edible anyway. Like I said...disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “Fun for kids; relaxing for adults”
Reviews.Author: dupco
Reviews.Content: The waterpark was really the draw for us and our younger children. We were very pleasantly surprised by the resort overall. The rooms were very spacious and the pools are all reallly nice. We had a great meal at the lobby buffet which was unexpected and the price for kids was unbelieveable ($4.50 for 12 and under!).

Reviews.Title: “Very busy hotel, dont plan on sitting on a chair by the pool.”
Reviews.Author: 2wholovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We took our two boys ages 8 and 10 to this resort for a family vacation. The rooms are ok, but the views of the parking lot and no balcony's with chairs make you want to spend very little time in or around your room. The resort was not a terrible experience by any means but there were just several things that we'd change. One of the main issues is that the Oasis Water Park is open to the public. Imagine spring break time, a resort full to capacity and then everyone and their neighbor coming for the day to the pool. The water park opens at 10:00 am, people start lining up outside the gate at 9:00. The line goes for a mile. If you are not in line you will not find one chair in the entire water park to sit in. It was so frustrating for us, and very sad to see the families wandering around and around and having to either leave or sit on the cement ground for the day because they couldn't find a chair. For the money you pay to stay at this resort you should at least expect a chair to sit on. This is also true for the pools that are seperate from the water park. There was never enough chairs for even half the people. As far as cleanliness, I never saw anyone ever clean any of the pool areas. The water park was never hosed down and the chairs and tables were filthy. the side pools by the rooms were always filthy with leftover cups and food on the ground. I wouldn't be suprised if people got sick. The restaurants were clean though. As for positives, the food was good, there were plenty of things for kids to do, and the resort was not too loud at night and disruptive. The king bed was very comfortable and the pillows. The lobby and the golf course are really pretty. I wouldn't go back, but that's mainly because of the water park issues and the cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Aptly named”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: I traveled here recently for a meeting of about 50 people. I was a bit leery upon checking in to see so many families. I was afraid that the stay would end up being noisy and crowded. I was flat wrong. The conference center is lovely and set apart from the hotel. It is a short walk depending upon which building you are staying in (the property is enormous but does not feel that way). There are numerous staff that will drive you over in a golf cart if you prefer. There is an impressive looking water park and an attractive golf course on the property. I did not have a chance to sample either. The food was excellent both at the conference center and at Rustler's Roost. The room was clean and spacious. The property was surprisingly quiet and I slept very well. I would wholeheartedly recommend this property for business or leisure travel. Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Shocked that this is a 4 diamond resort!”
Reviews.Author: vmichel54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating 31 years of marriage and were disappointed in our accommodations from the minute we stepped in the room. Although I let the woman at the front desk know it was our anniversary, we were given a smoke-smelling, divey room with a view of a building. We asked to change rooms due to the smoke smell and the manager on duty was extremely rude. He said he was very proud of his hotel and indicated that he didn't appreciate our criticism of the first room. He did begrudgingly offer to upgrade us, though, and moved us to another room, one that was EXACTLY the same as the first. We travel for pleasure a great deal and I assure you this is NOT a 4 diamond resort. Most of the rooms have 2 foot deep balconies with no space for furniture. The views from the outside half of the rooms are of the parking lot. The views from the inside are ok, but not great. The rooms are ordinary at best and, although purportedly remodeled, there wasn't any difference between our first room in the "old" building and our second room in the "new" building. If you have children, they will enjoy the pools, even the "adult" pool because no one monitors whether or not there are children in the adult pool. If you are looking for a quiet week in a luxury hotel, choose something else. If you are looking for a hotel where your children can feel comfortable to run as they please, this may be a great place. The king size bed was good so at least we were able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: dkcw72
Reviews.Content: We just finished another stay at the Arizona Grand Resort. The Villa Suites are perfect for a couple or even with a teenager. Full kitchen and living room. KItchen has granite countertops and stainless steel appliances. Large bathroom with double sinks. Has both a huge shower and bathtub. Wonderful views of the golf course and small waterfall from the covered balcony. The resort was fully booked so everything was busy, but organized. The wait staff performance ranged from 3 star to 5 star, depending. However, the management is always nearby for special requests which were accommodated nicely. One of the highlights in using this hotel is the reservations staff, in particular the Nathan the Director of the department. You know how some hotels have the go to guy that makes things happen? This is the guy. This is the second time that he has gone beyond the call with special requests on a reservation and he always comes through. If your stay is in south Phoenix, this is the place. Easy access to the I-10 but also has a nice back entrance on 48th for a no hassle drive during rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainautourdumonde
Reviews.Content: The (new) lobby is a great addition.It opens on a nice terrasse and a gorgeous view on the golf. It is welcoming. The check-in was slow due to a lack of personnel at the desk and not very friendly. The room was very well decorated and really nice with a bed room and a little living room where the working desk is. Internet access is included in the outrageous resort fee. More on this later. The bed was very confortable. Great rooms. There are numerous pools on the complex to choose from. All are nice and include a hot tub. The food at the resort was overpriced and not that good. The choice of restaurant is very limited. There is on the property, but requiring a little walk, a Mexican restaurant (Aunt Chilida). That was nice, but it is only your average Mexican restaurant. The terrasse has firepits. So it is a nice place to hang around with a coffee or a glass of wine. Except for the rooms, the resort looks tired and in need of refurbishments. It offers very little activities. The staff was at most ok, but certainly not what is expected in such a resort. The concept of resort fee seemed like a good idea to good a few basic things like the tips to everyone. In this case, it is $42 per day. That's is way too much. Sure it covers parking (I didn't have a car), internet access (good), access to the water park (ok), tips for the room maid, but no other tips. You have to tip bell boys and other employees in surplus of your $42. So a good stay, but certainly not a great one. There are better options in the area for the same price. To recap: + Very nice and confortable rooms + Nice terrasse and water park - Resort needs more animation (more "buzz") - Resort looks tired and staff could be more helpful/friendly - Food is really not that great.

Reviews.Title: “Food was awful and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kjdavitt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our recent spring break with our two boys, ages 6 and 8. Of course , the big draw is the water park but my boys did the slide and lazy river a few times and then preferred the smaller , quieter pools. Keep in mind, the water park is very spread out..if you have small kids , you will be constantly running around from slides to river to wave pool and back. But the biggest disappointment was the food. Honestly , everything we had was terrible and the prices were crazy high. I think the majority of food served here is prepared via microwave. If the prices were more reasonable, I think I would've accepted the mediocre quality, but the prices are about the same as resorts such as JW Marriott which are in a different league altogether. The lobby grill was also a disappointment...for instance, I had a grilled chicken ceasar salad that was nothing more than bagged, prewashed romaine with a small portion of rotisserie chciken on top. The service was very slow and for several nights, they were out of the draft beer my husband wanted. Next time, we will stay in Scottsdale at a true luxury resort.

Reviews.Title: “AGAIN, we just want to go back again and again to the Arizona Grand”
Reviews.Author: magnumNWIllinois
Reviews.Content: We wouldn't have changed a thing looking back at our stay at the AZ Grand Resort. The service in all areas, our accomodations at the Camelback, the food experienced throughout several dining areas and times of day were ALL wonderful . . . everything throughout the resort that time allowed us to enjoy was consistent with excellence.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect 80th birthday party”
Reviews.Author: PucciMesa
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? I turn 80 this year. My family lives here in Michigan, and Chicago. We rented 11 rooms including 3 villas. We had 30 people including my 15 grandchildren ranging in age from 8 to mid 20s. There was something for everyone but importantly there was much for all of us together. The rooms were first class. The suites held the crew for late night games and reminiscing. the kids loved the movies at the pool. And everyone enjoyed the water park. While I did not golf I enjoy the incredible breakfast (or I should say break FEAST) in the Lobby Grill. The golf course stretched out in front of us was beautiful We took advantage of the shuttle services often. Getting around the resort and especially getting to and from Rustlers Roost. We had a private space on the patio where the excellent staff served us too much outstanding food. WOW! The view the food – magnificent!!! Every encounter with the staff was professional, friendly and most helpful. The resort was impeccable very clean the staff was excellent and accommodations surpassed our expectations. I would highly recommend this resort to friends or any one looking to be pampered in style. I am looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Grand Resort is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: happytravelerPhoenix
Reviews.Content: The staff, accommodations, and amenities at the Arizona Grand are the best Phoenix has to offer. I spent the weekend there for a family reunion and had a wonderful experience; will definitely return for future ‘staycations’ and family gatherings! Every Arizona Grand staff member we encountered provided incredible customer satisfaction. The bellhops, shuttle drivers, front desk staff, cleaning staff, staff in the restaurants, room service, oasis water park staff, and even management consistently provided a warm welcome atmosphere that was professional and guest-oriented. You can tell that every staff member knows how to treat customers well! Even Rustler's Rooste staff (although not part of the Resort) also provided the same level of customer satisfaction. The accommodations are fantastic - comfortable beds and pillows, spacious suites, hot showers! The pools are exceptional; most are heated, all offer plenty of towels and chairs (the resort was at capacity this weekend as well).
