The Oasis Water Park is awesome and every one of my family members (ages 9-80) enjoyed the park and its amenities – slides, lazy river, wave pool, etc. The best advertising is word of mouth and testimonies from actual customers. I have already shared my experience with my friends; this medium allows me to share it with many others. Way to go Arizona Grand staff - you rock!! Next time you are in Phoenix or even if you live in Phoenix, the Arizona Grand is an awesome place to stay, relax, and have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Place to Stay with Large Family”
Reviews.Author: Jonages
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Resort and had a really fabulous time. The staff was exremely friendly and accomodating. We had a beautiful room with a view overlooking the pools. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Would definitely recommend for anyone wanting a relaxing and enjoyable time to spend with family, as a couple or with a large group. We had 30 in our group and some had the Villa where we gathered together for dinners or just partying. Highly recommend this gorgeous vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vgfhgfhghghghg
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, plenty to do for kids and adults.Comfortable rooms, great service and golf. Wonderful water park

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, not "Grand"”
Reviews.Author: DannoFive0
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a very nice stay there. We had a suite with two queens and plenty of room. All of the food we had there, and we ate the Lobby Grill, Breakfast and Lunch Buffets and at Russelers Roost was all very good to excellent. Russelers Roost is a great venue for kids. Positives: -Package deal with $100 per night room credit that could be used for golf, spa and meals -Excellent water park, not the biggest, but the highlight of the resort and finding a good seat was never a problem, even during spring break. -Location, centerally located in Phoenix, close to AZ Mills Mall, the airport and downtown Negatives: -Service quality was mixed at best. No one ever answered the guest service line in less than 2 minutes. Lines for check in and out were pretty long. Wait at Lobby Grill was always long despite only half of the tables being occupied (tells me they don't have enough staff) -The golf course. The first nine was palatable, the back nine a joke. Most players don't even need to bother with woods on the back, it's so short. Seems like they didn't have enough room for a regular 18, so they crammed the holes in. Even at the $49 twilight rate, it isn't worth playing again. I wanted to say it might be good for kids and the elderly, but I don't see how they would enjoy it much, given how impossibly tight some holes are. -Parking. The suites have very limited parking, if you don't have a spot by after dinner, you are stuck valet parking at the lobby and walking to your suite. Overall, I'd stay there again for the price (with credit) we paid. Plenty of other golf courses close by.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time, and would love to come back.”
Reviews.Author: MountainMom81301
Reviews.Content: We were told about this resort by friends who went there last year during their children's spring break from school. So we joined them this year and it is the best place to go with kids who love the water. We were up graded to a larger room at the same price, due to overbooking by the resort. Which was a beautiful room, it was very comfortable and spacious. The beds were very nice and the pull out was fine for the kids. We asked housekeeping for extra towels and blankets and received them right away. The Oasis was the best. The servers were friendly and prompt with our orders. The pools were clean and super fun for all ages. They don't like you bringing in food or drinks, kinda a bummer, if you want your kids to eat healthier. The adult drinks were very yummy, but expensive. The Lobby Grill was a great place to get breakfast, pretty fast and tasty. Children's menu was basic enough, and kept the price down. Monica was a wonderful server. We got room service the first night, pizza brought to our room. It was spendy for pizza, but still warm. We went to the Rustler's Rouste another night, it was crazy! It was very busy, but a large enough restaurant, to deal with a large crowd. We had a great server, Kevin, and the atmosphere was very kitchy, and cute. My steak was OK- a little under med-rare for my taste and not seasoned that well, it needed salt at the very least. The corn was mushy but it was so busy that I didn't want to complain. The rest was good. We had a great time watching all the action, from the slide to the dancing, to all the people having birthdays. It was very loud and I would not reccomend this place for people hard of hearing or small kids who dont like loud places. But all in all, we are coming back to The Grand again for spring break. Be ready to spend some extra money for things, and tipping, but I think it was all well worth it. My kids didn't want to leave and neither did my husband nor I. I will be telling my friends how much fun we had!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sue27Litteton
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! At first I was worried because the resort is right off of the highway, but we never had a problem with highway noise or view. Last year we stayed at the Westin Kierland in Scottsdale and although that place is nice, the Grand was just a better experience for us. Just behind the resort is a park where you can hike, "trail jog," or mountain bike. The kids even found a beehive in one of the caves on the hike, much to their excitement. We paid $20 extra per night for an upgrade and stayed in the mountainside rooms, which I recommend. We did have to walk a short ways to get to the pool, but we didn't mind, as it seemed that our room was much quieter and more secluded. We had a great view of the golf course. With a family of five, having the extra living room area, with hideaway bed is a definate bonus. The kids loved the water park and we are somewhat of waterpark conoisseurs (sp?). It was better than we have experienced yet. There was a huge water slide, lazy river, and wave pool. There were lots of lifeguards on staff. The food at the pool is overpriced, so plan accordingly. The resort restaurant has great food. The best part are the fireplaces on the patio that overlooks the golf course. The staff were attentive and friendly. Definately a thumbs up. We will be back!! (having to pay for internet was the only downer!). We had a wonderful italian meal at Classic Italian Pizza on Baseline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence with value”
Reviews.Author: ABQGuy
Reviews.Content: I have never been disappointed with any stay at this resort. The new check-in center and cafe's are excellent and the food is great at a fair cost. I have never had a bad nights sleep, the resort has spent the money for excellent mattress and bedding. Close to the airport and easy access to the interstate systems.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Eversyde
Reviews.Content: We received wonderful service while staying at the Arizona Grand Resort. The staff was friendly and very willing to help out. Our 7 year old daughter said she felt like a princess while we were there and said it best..."i don't think we've ever stayed in a hotel this amazing ever!!!" we have done a lot of travelling in the Phoenix area and this rated among the top.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd041
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star resort. Not even close. It's squeezed between an Interstate highway and a busy business thoroughfare. Room/suite was good, however housekeeping forgot to make up the room one day. Golf practice range is a joke with plastic balls due to lack of room. Golf course is marginal. Gift shop-deli-pro shop-condo sales all squeezed into one room. Main restaurant has very limited menu and quality is just OK. Service was good however. Savvy vacationers will go north---to Scottsdale or Carefree resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Unwanted Party”
Reviews.Author: lotsotripsneedsleep
Reviews.Content: After two days of meetings, I was looking forward to an early bedtime and rest before my early morning flight. The hotel thwarted what I think is a reasonable expectation by scheduling live rock and roll music outside my window. What made it worse was that there were only a handful of people listening to the music. It took three calls, two to the manager, before they even agreed to try to quiet or end the music. An hour and a half later it finally quieted down. One hotel employee even said she would not be offended by loud music outside her room (this was at 9:00 pm, and ended at 10:30).

Reviews.Title: “This resort has the friendliest and most helpful staff I have ever encountered worldwide.”
Reviews.Author: edns
Reviews.Content: For a leisure trip, since relaxation was well deserved and needed, this resort certainly filled the bill! The wonderfully comfortable beds, the super soft high thread count sheets, and the well appointed surroundings encouraged sleep, relaxation, and just plain enjoyment. You must try their two egg breakfast accompanied by three different delicious home made jams and your very own small loaf of toasted bread! Along with excellent service what more could one ask for? The fit for a king treatment topped the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: mprh
Reviews.Content: My Mom, 2 sisters-in-law and I just returned from a fantastic four day weekend at the Arizona Grand. The hotel was great but the service was exceptional. The lobby and verandah are beautiful and we enjoyed many hours sitting by the firepits reading and watching golfers tee off on the #1 hole. The food in the lobby grille is exceptional. The bruschetta was amazing as well as the pizza. The spa was very nice - although the "holding" room was a little small. They did offer great hot tea, water and fresh fruit. All of the spa treatments we had were wonderful. My sister-in-law who is a group fitness director and is certified in free style spinning and RPM classes took the indoor cycling class on Saturday morning. She was a little concerned about the negativity of the instructor - fyi. The gym was nice and had plenty of machines. We ate and Aunt Chiladas and then had dessert at the Rooste which has fantastic views. I would highly recommend this property for anyone - especially a family looking for a great vacation spot at a great value. I am booked to return in May with my husband and two daughters to enjoy the water park! One last fyi - the pull out beds in the rooms are VERY uncomfortable and are not suited for adults. Maybe ok for kids if you stack blankets over the mattress. Other than that, the hotel and facilities are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Pointeperson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Grande for business but brought my spouse and another couple to make a mini vacation + business trip. The new lobby was fantastic. My husband enjoyed reading his book by the fire pit. Stephanie Pick at Aunt Chiladas was great! The food was wonderful. We were greeted at the front desk by Tyler and then Darrell Collins came out and asked about our stay then asked if we wanted to check out the new villas. Since we had stayed at the hotel before we wanted to see what they looked like. They were nice and view of the golf course pleasant. Fitness Center not as nice as in the past. Hotel rooms very nice. Like the decor. Had the Sunday brunch, the display was really well done. The best part of the hotel is the incredible service by Richard Behr, Paul Grey and Darrell Collins. They run a great property. I will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, but many hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandMolly
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over New Year's 2010 and stayed there for two days, mainly for my wife and me to have some quiet time together. We looked at a number of hotels within a pricerange of $300/night, but since we did not have many expecations other than getting a nice quiet room, we thought that the Arizona Grand offered a reasonably priced alternative. Unfortunately, the only welcoming thing about the hotel is the lobby. There is a nice seating area outside with gas-lit firepits which seemed very warm and welcoming. Also, the villas which are visible from the lobby area seemed very open and had a nice view away from all the concrete that surrounds the hotel, so we had great expecations. To our surprise, the first room we were offered within the Sedona complex was facing a parking lot and the noise from the hotel traffic was audible from the bedroom. All rooms were described as quiet by the reception staff, but the room that was offered to us certainly wasn't. We called the hotel front desk again, described what we wanted, and were moved to a different room in the same complex which still faced a lot of concrete walls, but at least was quiet. Both rooms in the Sedona complex had low ceilings, and it was difficult to get there. There are no elevators, so the only access is through stairs. The courtyard view is not really a view; all rooms essentially face the many stairs and walkways and people who are walking by essentially can look into the living room. For that reason, the blinds need to be closed when you want privacy, which also means that you need artificial lighting all day. However, the bedrooms were nicely done and the bathrooms were very clean. The biggest issue we have with the hotel which we complained about was in the end price. We have stayed and are able to afford higher prices, but then our expecations are much greater. In this case, the hotel was offered to us on the phone for $130 plus a $100 credit to be spend at the local restaurants. My wife called twice to make sure that we really understood what was offered to us. We thought this to be an adequate price for a hotel of that quality and location. However, in the end we were presented with a hotel bill of $610 for two nights. It turned out that the rooms were actually $199 plus tax plus $30/day resort access fee, which came out to close to $250. Even worse, when we ordered room service for breakfast, it was expensive to begin with, but when a 23% service charge is added automatically plus a $3 delivery charge, a generous breakfast for two people ends up costing $60. I don't think I ever paid as much for a roomservice breakfast, not even in the nicest downtown hotels in San Francisco or Boston. Since we originally thought the $130/night was very reasonable, I did not have a problem paying overpriced hotel restaurant food. A $14 Tuna tartare would - if generously portioned - not be a reason for a complaint at all, but when it essentially is a tiny amount in a plate that is only crushed ice, it gets a little ridiculous. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel, mainly from a perspective of price/value and the outragously high hidden charges. At a lower pricepoint, I think this place could be a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at The Arizona Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Kara77
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at The Arizona Grand at the beginning of December and all I can say is "wow what a fabulous resort"! My mom, my 2 young children and I arrived late and were exhausted! We were greeted warmly by the front desk staff and then personally escorted to our room. We were happily surprised to find a huge basket of games for the kids to play (Candyland, Uno, Shutes and Ladders, and more). I have stayed at a lot of hotels with the kids and this was the first time we have encountered this-what a wonderful idea! We had a great time playing games before bed. The beds were SO comfortable and the room was in fantastic condition, clean, great towls, linens, amenities. Unfortunately we had to leave early for the airport but I was releived to learn that Sky Harbor Airport is very close by- was like a 10 minute drive and didn't even have to get on the freeway! Although we weren't able to enjoy the pool and restaurants this time, we stayed here back in the summer and had a blast! The water park area is amazing!!! Great for all ages, clean, attentive staff, great food. We also ate at Rustlers Roost which you should definitely make time to try, very fun experience and yummy food. My favorite is Aunt Chilada's which has terrific Mexican Food. I would highly recommend this resort anytime of the year- fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation”
Reviews.Author: summers09
Reviews.Content: We decided for our anniversary to do a stay-cation versus going out of town since we have a 3 month old. We were upgraded to the villas and they are fabulous!! So roomy and it had a great view of the golf course!! We didn't really do much other than stay in our room since it was one night but it was a blast. We have stayed a couple of times now and each visit is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: chandler1
Reviews.Content: I recently had a girl's weekend at the Arizona Grand Resort, we stayed in one of the Villa's and it was wonderful. We loved the villa and the views were outstanding, the grounds are magnificent!! We have stayed several times at the Grand but the Villa was the best ever! The staff was friendly and professional, they all seem to really enjoy their jobs and are very helpful. We are already planning our next trip. I would recommend the Grand to all my friends..

Reviews.Title: “Resort Report”
Reviews.Author: dwrrn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Grand Resort. Overall, it was a very nice place. Staff were very friendly without being overbearing. The resort itself was rather spread out so location is important. If you are attending a conference make sure you are located near the conference center. If you are here for the waterpark, stay near the water park. The rooms were nice, but I wouldn't call them 5 star. other posters are correct in describing them as Embassy Suite-like. They are functional but not plush. Bathrooms are very small, and having the sink outside the bathroom itself, placed it right in the middle of your bedroom, which entailed waking up anyone if you had to wash your hands at night. The water park is closed too early in the season. Despite being in the 90's, the park was closed. Although there were quite a few pools scattered about the property itself, the water being tolerable (as they were somewhat heated) and had jacuzzis attached to each pool. The lobby itself is very impressive, opening up right on the golf course, and at nice, with fires lit at each table, offered a nice ambience. The bartenders were great too. Prices were a tad high for food /drink. Food was nothing special, but we only ate once here. Plenty to do in the Phoenix area for kids. My biggest gripe (like many others posting here) is the resort fee. $30 plus tax is alot to charge. I laugh as you could tell the poor front desk clerks must get abused daily w/ questions. They give the scripted response" we offer many amenities that are included in the fee" Let's see: Water Park--closed Kid's Club: closed World Class Gym: Could not enter as they did not allow kids (Kid's club closed) Free Paper: USA TODAY wow big deal- plus no paper on Sat+Sun Free Internet: Cheap hotels down the street offer free internet plus a free breakfast. I'm sure when the waterpark is open that the fee is worth it, however, during the offseason, management should have a little common sense and reduce the fee. So overall, not a bad place, but go only if you are able to use the vast amount of activities offered at the resort. A word of caution to those unfamiliar with the area. If renting an auto, make sure you are very careful in inspecting your car and filling out the inspection form prior to taking the car. The Phoenix area is notorious for very narrow parking spots (the resort has very tight spaces) and most cars have a few side dings/scratches. Also check the windshield for any chips as it is very common to sustain windshield damage driving in the southwest. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time at AZ Grand”
Reviews.Author: wozhegg
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 4 nights here. It was excellent weather. Loved the resort. It was quite large. They had golf carts that could drive you anywhere. The room was nice with comfy beds. Wished it had a microwave though. Liked the fact there was pool and hot tub for each cluster of rooms. My mom and I had massages and facials at the spa. They were great and relaxing. The athletic club looked nice and lots of classes, but did not have time to make it there. Also really nice trails around property. Lobby bar and grill had great food. A little expensive, but resort food. I would bring with pop and snacks next time. The water park opened only the day we left, but looked like a lot of fun. Will have to bring the kids back.

Reviews.Title: “Run down, tired resort.”
Reviews.Author: planelite1
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the state this location has been allowed to fall into. I have stayed here twice before in the past 5 years and aloways considered this a top rate location. It has been 3 years since I have been and we found this place in a worn out state. The elavators are in such poor condition with grafitti and panels knocked out. Half of the hall lights not operational, and poorly cleaned rooms . My colleagues in other sections of the resort reported the same conditions. I will pay a little more and stay at The Buttes the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Niagra123
Reviews.Content: The Golf Course and Waterpark were closed, I knew this in advance so we didn't pay any Resort Fees. The service from Check in to Check out was perfect with one exception. Very small issue but worth mentioning. We called the Front Desk for a taxi to go Downtown and we were not told that their service was a Limo or Towncar that it was a $45 charge for a $25 ride. If we had taken a metered cab, it would have been $25. Other than that the rooms were well appointed, quiet and clean. The restaurant was good for breakfast, but we didn't eat any other meals there. You could walk to the Arizona Mills Mall easily. Once you get used to the area, the Resort is easily accessible. We enjoyed our stay here and I would gladly pay the resort fee if I was with my family and using the facilities. Keep up the great work guys.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool makes this place”
Reviews.Author: Lisciarelli
Reviews.Content: Awesome water park for all ages, especially kids. Baby pool, wave pool, lazy river, slides and more. Just sit and people watch or join the fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not so great customer service”
Reviews.Author: cameron510
Reviews.Content: Renovated and spacious rooms with seperate sitting area. Nice pool area along with a lazy river, golf, and spa, however, lazy river and golf were shut down. We met employees that were accomodating and several others that could care less about meeting our needs. That part was a downer! We had a great time but will consider looking around at other hotels/resorts next time we fly to AZ.

Reviews.Title: “A little overpriced but fun”
Reviews.Author: bonnmom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little overpriced and almost every meal was expensive but this was one of the greatest waterparks in a hotel ever

Reviews.Title: “Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: wldhrt
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. The new Villas are beautiful and comfortable! Can't wait until our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling pools, extra-attentive service, count the fee in”
Reviews.Author: catdancer818
Reviews.Content: Fifteen minutes from PHX airport: a large, beautiful property - six pools; golf course and driving range; superior conference/event facilities; all rooms are suites with pull out, kitchen fridge, sink and table, negligible balcony. **The big attraction is the Oasis Waterpark - tall slides, wave pool, tubing river to float on - we stayed open to close during a weekday visit. Did not find inflexibility or too many rules. Oasis is open seasonally. **The big drawback is the RESORT FEE. After shopping the BEST RATE on the net and a reservationist who gladly honored it, we learned there is an non-optional, additional $30/day charge which is vaguely described on the resort's website. Called the resort to find this covers: 4 admissions to waterpark, admission to Athletic club and driving range, "free" internet in room, local ph calls, USA Today newspaper, coffee-maker, and "free" parking. Be sure to calculate this into your budget and search the best room rate. **Service is very good - the Best Rate reservationist; our greeter, Derrick, who handled bags and gave us a tour of the entire property; the desk manager who assisted with airline boarding passes; and a valet armed with a 2-sided list of local restaurants. Wished only that a used room service tray would have been cleared from the hallway during our stay. **If you're coming to relax poolside and in the sun, this is the place, incl adult pools, hot-tubs, lap pool. Weather is bright most of the year - and the pools are perfectly cleaned, temperate, and chemically balanced. No chlorine odor or feel. The gentleman who tends the pools, even went into the pools to assure the water quality. The pool facilities are OUTSTANDING.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, would recommend it to my best friends!”
Reviews.Author: Arizonamaus
Reviews.Content: Really great place to stay, an oasis in the middle of the desert!!! What a pitty, we had only one night here, could not use the Waterworld and all the other opportunities, offered by this nice hotel. Our room was more than clean, stuff was very polite, great ambiente.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous during the quiet periods.”
Reviews.Author: RLSSussex
Reviews.Content: The first thing that strikes you is the size. There are hundreds of rooms. They are well appointed and quite spacious. The fridge is stocked with the usual over-priced drinks but you can remove them and stock it with your own. The shower was clean and powerful and the beds were comfortable. However the carpet was more like a well used 3 star hotel which spoilt it. I didn't want to make a fuss and didn't complain as some staff were very friendly, others seemed at best indifferent. The pool area is clean and large but we were there on a Monday, the kids had returned to school so it was exceptionally quiet which made it very easy to go straight on one of the 3 slides. These are not suitable for young children and although there is a lazy river and a pool with waves there is no play area with fountains etc. Two very steep slides are more of a short thrill, frightened our daughter (10 yrs and she didn't do them again) one that cork screws is a slower but fun she did that quite a few times. It is a good place to go for a day or two but I imagine if the hundreds of deck-chairs all lined up next to each other were busy it would be awful!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome..we will be going back”
Reviews.Author: LuvPghPa
Reviews.Content: Clean, affordable, the on site golfing and waterpark was fantastic. Professional staff, nice restaraunts etc.

Reviews.Title: “I second the "you'll love it if you love RULES"”
Reviews.Author: travelbug5580
Reviews.Content: We had similiar troubles at the pool. I don't know about anyone else, but at 53 and solid non rule breaking citizen, I got real tired of getting the 20 year old college student's condiscending attitude and rule barking. I think the hotel really needs to work on "customer vision" - especially at the so called "Oasis" park. I got so fed up with getting barked at that I finally left the so called "Oasis" for the room for peace and quiet. The food at the pool was a little over priced for what you got and you could not get anything really low calorie. The drinks at the bar were really watered down (and I am no boozer) at 8 bucks a piece. The bar in the hotel wasn't all that much better - the bartender actually used a shot glass to pour. It would have been nice to have a great drink at the end of the evening - especially after getting scolded left and right. Needless to say, my husband is going to really have to convince me to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: DebbieEasley
Reviews.Content: I am a native to Phoenix and have stayed in many of the resorts in my area but I have never experienced anything like the Arizona Grand resort. Not only did the staff make me feel like a movie star from the moment I pulled up, but every step of the way they went above and beyond the call of duty. I don't think I have ever experienced a business where every encounter with every part of the staff was outstanding. As far as the rooms, not only immaculate, like walking into a model home, but also with that comfortable feeling where you didn't mind kicking off your shoes and sitting on the balcony. I can't imagine ever booking anywhere else in the Valley if you want a vacation or a staycation......

Reviews.Title: “My 8 year old daughter and myself had the best end of summer trip ever.”
Reviews.Author: chipfaced
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun that we were sleeping by 9:00 at the latest every evening. Then we were up early each morning waiting for the Oasis to open. My wife was very jealous that she couldn't make the trip. Our photos and how our daughter won't stop talking about it has "mom" very upset that she couldn't get off work. Next time. Thank you AGR.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekdays...Avoid the Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: EHS_7
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay, super fun water park, nice staff, convenient location, clean rooms and grounds. Beautiful suites, villas are amazing, huge, full kitchens and worth the extra $. We arrived on Saturday night to a mob scene, partying local yokels and thier screaming children everywhere. Night capped off with pulled fire alarms. We were sure we had made a horrible mistake coming to this resort. The management assured us that we would have a completely different experience once Sunday afternoon hit and they were not lying. The remainder of our stay was wonderful. Come here on weekdays, but steer clear of the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you love rules and being told what to do, don't go!”
Reviews.Author: Amonics
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by telling you I am a world traveler. Two months haven't gone by for years where I haven't gone somewhere for a weekend or more. I have written a few good reviews over the years, but I have NEVER written a scathing review as I am usually pretty tolerant of rules, but the rules here are inconsistent and silly. Let me also say I work in Law Enforcement, so I am not normally a rule breaker kind of person, and rules don't normally bother me, but if you can't be consistent then don't have them. Words can't describe how unpleasant this 3 day vacation was. Let's start with check-in. I was greeted at the desk by Anthony. Since it was 3 PM I was able to check in, but I was told instead of the room I booked which was to have two double beds and a pull out couch, they had a room with a king and a pull out couch. This didn't really work for me since I had my 3 teenagers, but I thought no big deal we will just get a rollaway. I was told by Anthony the resort doesn't have rollaways. I told him that wouldn't work because none of us wanted to go on vacation and sleep on the floor. Instead of apologizing he condescendingly said, "Well, that's what you booked." I corrected him because my original booking I had requested a king as one of the teenagers wasn't going. However, two weeks prior I called the resort itself and changed it. Nonetheless I was informed I was stuck. Even though it would be expensive I requested to pay for an additional room, so there wouldn't be an argument over who was a floor sleeper, but they were sold out. Anthony told me I could get an additional room the following day. Finally, the one positive I have is the golf cart operators were wonderful and we tipped them handsomely as anyone who gives good customer service should get. Once I was through with the check-in process he handed me a small map. I asked him where my room was located and rather than point it out on the map he told me to go out front and ask the bellmen. I informed him my family wasn't out front, so I wasn't going that way and would he please tell me where the M building is. He once again replied that the bellmen were more familiar with the resort and they could help me. (It was 114 degrees and I wasn't going that way, so I wasn't too keen on this idea. Personally, I believe it is a ploy to get you to go outside where they would give you directions and then you have to tip them for it). I asked Anthony point blank, "Do you personally know where the M building is?" He once again directed me out front. Not wanting this young man to get my blood pressure up any higher I walked out front to ask the proverbial question of the bellman. However, I looked to the right as I exited the lobby door and WOW, there was the ever so hard to find M building. When we arrived at the door to our room, I noticed ants all over the outside of the doorway. This will come in to play later. We immediately went to the waterpark and had a good time. The lifeguards constantly told people to not enter the lazy river unless they were on the steps and not to jump in the tubes. This will also come into play later. My son and I went to the gym. It was a large facility for a hotel. The treadmills were a bit antiquated, but adequate nonthess and there was lots of other equipment to choose from. We ate dinner the first night at the Rustlers Roost on the property. Quite possibly one of the worst meals I have eaten in years. Virtually everthing on the menu is $20.00. Pretty standard for a steak, but my Fiance ordered a top sirloin that I kid you not we could barely cut in to. When he took a bite (he is a meat lover from the south) it was so chewy he couldn't even swallow. In 7 years I have never seen him turn away a steak. IN any case I have no problem paying $20 for a meal, but when you add 3 teenagers into the mix and the food is horrible, you don't generally feel good about spending over $100.00 for a horrible meal. Nobody at the table finished their meal, it was that bad. On the second day about midway through the day I went to go down one of the waterslides for about the tenth time when the girl working it said I had to take my necklace off. Considering I went down the slides the entire first day and numerous hours this day, this was a surprise to me. Not feeling comfortable holding a chain in my hand with a diamond on it while going down a gushing waterslide I told her now that I knew the rule I would not come up again with my necklace on gain, but I didn't want to lose it by taking it off. I was told I couldn't go down unless I took it off. So, I took it off. Funny thing is after telling me no jewelry on the slide, she let me go down with my rings on, my earrings and my watch on. Go figure. At the end of the day at the waterpark two of the lifeguards who had been around the lazy river all day were given a break. What is the first thing they did? You guessed it they JUMPED into the lazy river through the tubes AND they entered into the river in an area not designated for entry. They then rode down the river next to me splashing each other and flirting. Both of these individuals I had heard numerous times throughout the day yelling at various people they could only enter the pool from the stairs. I noticed there were no kids meals on the pool menu (not that my kids would eat them, but I don't think I have ever seen a resort not have kids meals). When I inquired, I was told they only offer kids meals on the weekends. So, if you have young kids watch out you will be paying full price for a meal your kid will never finish. We ordered room service and tipped the delivery person handsomely, only to discover they brought the wrong pizza and pasta. We were so hungry and it had taken 1 1/2 hours to deliver that I felt we couldn't turn it back. Besides, he had zipped out of the room before we could even check the meal. On day two after being in the river all day, we went to go check into the extra room. I made sure to steer clear of Anthony. Being in my bathing suit and cover-up I didn't have my wallet with me. I was told I couldn't check in without a credit card. Normally, this would make all the sense in the world, except they already had my credit card on file. Once again not good enough, that would be breaking the rules. My man gave them his crecit card. We travlel a lot and share expenses, but it had already been discussed previously that I would pay for this trip. Not wanting him to foot the bill I asked the clerk if I could pay for both rooms in the end on mine and he assured me that would be find. Okay this is long an drawn out, but the last item is that my kids woke up in the middle of the night to find the floor, nightstand and bedroom they were in COVERED in ANTS! This was the original room we checked into that had ants around the door they never did anything about. Additionally, this wasn't the room we had the room service delivered to, so it wasn't a matter of the ants trying to come in for food left around. When I went to check out I was lucky enough that there were only two clerks and one of them was Anthony. I told Anthony about the horrendous ant problem and he said, "Thank you for informing us." Not, would you like to speak to a manager, would you like a free drink coupon, here is 50 cents for your trouble. He didn't say a word, just kept his fake smile on and continued the check out process. Not wanting to lose my composure I let the horrendous ant issue go. I told him although we had originally put a different credit card on the second room, I wanted to pay with min. I then handed said credit card to him. It shouldn't have shocked me, but the second room was charged to my fiance. Oh, one other thing. On the second day my teenage son and I went to the gym in the morning. Keith or Kevin (can't remember his exact name) greeted my son and asked him how old he is. My son is a few months shy of 16 which is the gym age, so he was informed he couldn't go in. I told the clerk that he had already used the gym. I also said I completely understand why they have an age rule as they don't want a bunch of teenagers running around or using the equipment incorrectly or possibly breaking it, but my son is in football and he is required to lift every day. I also informed him I would stand next to him and watch him forgoing my workout if I had to and that he was a mature young man. Nope, Kevin or Keith siad no way. I know this may shock people by now, but knowing how inconsistent the rules are enforced at the resort, my son went later that day and wasn't asked his age. He was able to go twice more without the RULE being enforced. I plan on sending this review to the General Manager of the hotel I will supplement the review with what response if any I get from him/her.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: enjoylifenow47
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, we had children with us from age 5 to 15, eveybody had a great time even the parents! Forget paying $35 at waterparks for the day, take your family here and enjoy 2 days and stay at a wonderful hotel for a great price. The oaisis waterpark at the hotel has something for everyone, great slides, wave pool and a relaxing fun lazy river. This was not our first time at this hotel and it certainly won't be our last!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun for a three or four day stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dugster29
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Summer rates were awesome. We enjoyed the water park; the fitness center was outstanding; the golf was great and the spa treatments were very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD TIMES”
Reviews.Author: truehiker
Reviews.Content: We had another wonderful time at this resort. The staff is wonderful from the time you check in to the time you depart. The Oasis Water Park is a blast - GOOD TIMES for all ages. The Oasis food is great too. We dine at Aunt Chiladas and Rustlers Roost; they are both great places with great service and great food. You will love your stay here and want to come back to the comfortable beds, spacious rooms and friendly staff. As a family we choose this place even with all the other Resorts in our area - WE LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Teresa Smith

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, lovely pool”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethStreetMoM
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights end of July. After some initial problem with check-in when we were told the room we booked was not available (I paid extra $$ or an upgrade at the point of reservation) the clerk finally found us the room type we booked. We had requested (and paid for ) a room nearer our conference ballrooms as this hotel is very spread out and you could walk a very long time in the 110 heat or have to call a golf cart. In a nutshell we really enjoyed our stay and would return! The room was what I like: quiet, good natural light if the curtains are open, and pitch dark at night when the curtains are drawn. The beds were very comfortable, and the sheets and pillow cases were soft. There was a television in the sitting area and in the bedroom, even if they were a bit on the small size. The room was decorated in cheerful colors. We were in the Camelback section. The big plus is the fabulous lazy river pool where we circulated for well over an hour. There were more than enough bartenders at the bar by the pool, instead of the long wait at some hotels. All staff were accomodating. The lobby restaurant had terrific fresh food, especially the Ahi Tuna salad which I ate for a couple of meals and the club sandwich that my teenage daughter ate at two meals. The gals in the gift shop are gracious and since we have been to this hotel 4 times over several years I can say I think they are the same ladies who have always been there. There is a "can do" attitude among the staff, very appreciated. The only complaint is when I called to the desk ahead of checking out to tell them I would like to get a taxi to go to the airport and inquired if I needed to book in advance I was told just to come down to the lobby, that there are always taxis around. When we checked out and I asked for a taxi a limo was told to pull up and the bellman put our luggage in. When I asked if this was the taxi I was told it was the limo and it would take 20 minutes to get a taxi. If they had just told me my choices when I called the front desk I would have felt better about paying the extra $10 for the limo, or called a taxi 20 min in advance (which is why I called the front desk in the first place). I don't like being tricked. I even wonder if it would have taken 20 minutes to get the taxi as the airport is only 7 miles our about 10 minutes away. That left a sour note to the end of an otherwise nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “horrible guest service. eviction for nothing”
Reviews.Author: hateazgrand
Reviews.Content: we went to the resort for a friends birthday. we went with a group of 12 in four different rooms. hotel check in is at 4 and we didnt get our rooms till nearly 6pm. ten minutes after we got our rooms 8 police officers showed up telling us to vacate the premises. they could not tell us what the problem was other than we had to leave the premises. management would not speak to us. they told us no alcoholic beverages were not allowed on the premises unless purchased through the resort. no security warning was ever issued. hotel management would not issue a refund leaving us to dispute claims with credit card companies because we were not given goods or services we thought we were paying for. we were treated unfairly. we were embarressed over the situation and we dont feel anyone should have to go through the heartache we went through. stay at the orange tree. they have an awesome guest service department

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel - But with a couple of reservations”
Reviews.Author: Airedale2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arizona Grand on Jul 16 - 19. I paid for the extra upgrade and we stayed in a room close to the waterpark. Definitely worth the extra $$! We arrived early, and were accommodated with an early check-in. Room was clean and cool. We valeted our car, and were taken by golf cart to our room. The golf carts were great. Anytime we wanted to go someplace in the hotel, we just called and asked to be picked up. We really liked the waterpark on the grounds. My favorite part was floating around in the lazy river. The girls liked the slides, but also liked hanging around in the pools at our building. On Friday and Saturday, the water park was very crowded, and it was hard to get a lounge chair or any shade. The rules prohibit any outside food or drink from coming in, but we found a way around that. We took cups from the bar, mixed our own drinks in our room, and walked right in with them. Sometimes they change cups, so you have to watch for that. My only complaint is that on the weekends, the river becomes really dirty from people tromping in and out with leaves and dirt on their feet. Overall, it was a good experience. However, the girls, at 17, are a bit old for the waterpark. Next time we will just stay in a nice resort with a regular pool. The $30 per day resort fee on top of the room drove the price up pretty high. We ate dinner at Rustler's Rooste, one of the restaurants on the property. I ate there several years ago, and I must say that the quality has declined. It was overpriced for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: AZHawks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, has delicious food, a friendly and helpful staff, and the grounds are amazing!! There are many things to do for all ages. My 2 year old loved the Children's Pool which was safe and perfect for small children. My 12 year old loved the slides and wave pool. I loved the adult beverages, the service, and the large amount of lifeguards that constantly supervised the pool areas. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family. It's truly an oasis away from everything. We felt like we were in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort Ever, call before you arrive and speak with Ryan”
Reviews.Author: msprouse
Reviews.Content: This place was a class act & fun at the same time. WOW!!!!!! My kids are still talking about it and so are their parents. My daughter wanted to go to the Oasis water park for her birthday. It is located on the resort proporty(private,safe,clean and wonderful... I spoke with Ryan (front desk manager prior to our arrival) He treated us like movie stars!!! No joke, these people really do care. He put my little girl &her friend in their own villa(granite countertops, the works...What a blessing.Our villa was over 900sq.ft. all s.s. appliences the works..We will never forget this vacation. From one consumer to another, this was a great place to stay, and the $ was out of this world...

Reviews.Title: “Great new villas and great service at Arizona Grand”
Reviews.Author: boojamom
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in a new, one-bedroom villa overlooking the water park. Service was great at the waterpark and with the hotel staff. We were able to arrive at the waterpark early and stayed after the checkout. We were pleased and impressed with the number of lifeguards on duty.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing summer getaway/staycation”
Reviews.Author: Hmoreno78
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I had a fantastic time at Arizona Grand Resort. One of my friends and I live in Phoenix, but we had another friend fly in from NY (where it is much, much cooler). Being out at the pool and the amazing water park, you totally forget just how hot it is. I felt like a teenager again going down the 12-story slides! All the staff we came into contact with were really nice. And, the rooms are awesome. Every room is a suite, so you really can't go wrong. They are so roomy, and there was a nice sitting area away from the bedroom where we could sit, talk, play games, etc. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific place to enjoy a family "stay-cation!"”
Reviews.Author: shanzala
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed the Arizona Grand Resort immensely! The Villa Suite was beautiful; very spacious and functional design - and the bathroom! We could have thrown a party in there! Beautiful! We happily spent a good amount of time lounging in our room. Dinner in the Lobby Grill: Excellent food and service…we were treated like royalty. We were thrilled to find racquetball courts in the fitness center! And what a full and comprehensive exercise facility - there seems to be nothing they don't have. The spa was also lovely, though it's missing a sauna. We spent the rest of the weekend in the water park. My 4-year-old had a ball! The wave pool was his favorite, while I enjoyed floating on the Lazy River with my 7-month-old in my lap. What a gorgeous facility! Plenty of baby and kid-friendly space.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for the hidden automatic $30.00 resort fee! ! !”
Reviews.Author: jimib
Reviews.Content: I recently booked some clients in July 09. I picked them up at the airport and took them to the Grand Resort. When I checked them in I was hit with a $30.00 per person! per Day! fee that they refused to take off. This was not on the reservation and I had to fork up the money at check out. I picked this hotel because of the location to my business. we had no intenion of going on the waterslide. they told me that this fee is for passes to the waterslide. I advised them that we would not be using it and they rudely refused to take it off the bill. Watch out if you book this resort on Hotels.com or similar services, this fee does not show up on the booking price!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time”
Reviews.Author: 4Vacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arizona Grand last month for two nights and enjoyes ourselves- The rooms were spacious, the various restaurents were good and the resort like water park was fun- our teenagers actually enjoyed themselves A definate plus for us-

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back”
Reviews.Author: Inaznow
Reviews.Content: My son got a sunburn (after 4 hours) and the staff freaked out and called the cops on me. I was threatened with eviction, harassed, told i would be charge with child neglect. I used to recommend this place, but now never again. The restaurants are too expensive. There are better places to go than this. Thanks Arizona Not so Grand my vacation was destroyed, because of the staff's unprofessional handling of the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great girls get-away”
Reviews.Author: cashaw
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 day weekend! We checked in on the 28th of May for a Girls Weekend Get-Away. The staff was outstanding and the room was gorgeous. I usually have a hard time sleeping in hotel beds but this one was out of this world. It was so comfortable. The Oasis Waterpark was very relaxing and very easily accesable from our room. Thank you for your excellent service and ourstanding accomidations. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Spend With The Family”
Reviews.Author: eps880
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and Oasis Water park was great!!!!!! Rooms were cozy and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and spend family time”
Reviews.Author: uncgrad86
Reviews.Content: My husband and 10 y/o son stayed here for 4 days. The hotel section is divided into three areas and each area has an adult pool and a family pool. The rooms are large and clean. The big draw here is the water park. Three slides, lazy river, wave pool, 25 person hot tub, sports pool and a kiddie area. On Fridays and Saturdays, there is a buffet ( one trip through) and a Disney Classic movie. It was a great way to end our 10 day tour of Arizona. I thought the location was fine. To the west of the resort is not the best area but not too bad. Just two exits away is a great area with restaraunts and a movie theater. Just under the freeway is Arizona Mills. The resort backs up to South Hills Park which is the largest city owned park in the US. Hiking, bike riding, horse back riding can all be done inthe park.

Reviews.Title: “"I'll Be Back"”
Reviews.Author: Hubbanator
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two girls, 13 & 10) spend at least one weekednd a year at a local resort here in the Phoenix metro area. As natives, we have stayed at most of 4 & 5 star resorts at least once and each has their specialities. But when it comes to summertime poolside fun, there's only one the kids ask for by name - its the Arizona Grand. And lucky for us, our house is only five minutes drive from this 4 star resort. If your kids really love water, then there is only one resort for you too - the Arizona Grand - Trust me!

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFULLY BEAUTIFUL RESORT WITH EXCEPTIONAL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: melanneortiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort on Friday July 3rd, 2009 to July 4th, 2009. Everything & Everyone that we encountered on our stay was absolutely OUTSTANDING in making sure that all our needs were not only met but exceeded. The Oasis waterpark was absolutley wonderful & our kids thouroughly enjoyed it!!! The live band that was playing outside was great too!! My boys were moving their heads to the music & I saw several guests singing along. This resort offers something for everyone in the way of family. It was truly awesome!! The suite was beautiful & much to my eight year old's delight, there was a Nintendo Game Cube system so he really did feel like he was at home!! The beds were the most comfortable we had ever slept in, just like sleeping on a cloud!! Everything from check-in to check-out was just exceptional, we would not change a thing!! There is one staff member that I have to mention by name, ADRIAN OLIVARES. When checking out I commented that we really enjoyed our stay & that we wished that the rooms weren't all booked so we could stay another night. The staff member that was helping me, Adrian Olivares, then went to speak to his manager & they were able to get us another night!! That was so wonderful of him to even ask for that to be done for us!! The fact that the manager was able to accomodate the request was just awesome!! Adrian definitely deserves praise for his exceptional customer service skills. His bright smile & warm demeanor was so great to see. It was greatly appreciated & we will DEFINITELY be returning for subsequent visits!!! KEEP UP THE EXCEPTIONAL WORK ARIZONA GRAND - WE APPRECIATED ALL YOU DID TO MAKE OUR STAY SO WONDERFUL!!! Thanks again for making our 4th of July weekend a very memorable & fun experience for our family!!! THE ENRIQUEZ FAMILY, Javier, Melanie, Eli & Noah

Reviews.Title: “No hassel getaway”
Reviews.Author: jartraveller
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place where we could relax and spend time together with family. It was sort of a 50th anniversary celibration. Eleven in all, three teens. The waterpark at the Grand kept everyone entertained. When we were done with that for the day the adults met at the adult pool for a drink. Rooms were large and comfortable. The only issue, and not much of one, were the 19" tvs. We had a great time! Food at the park wasn't that great but the other places on sight were good.

Reviews.Title: “"We didn't want to leave"”
Reviews.Author: Moochie1Az
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were immediately greeted by a bevy of smiling, genuinely happy employees. The room was clean, neat and the mattresses were superb!! My Grandson didn't ever want to leave the water park (neither did I) We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “A fun and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: KJDJBR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the villas overlooking the golf course. The golf course was beautiful and challenging. The lobby grill was excellent. Everyone who took care of us was wonderful. Tip: Unless you are totally enamored with children, enjoy the beautiful water park during the week!

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: ggourrier
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit here. We absolutely loved it. The newly refurbished rooms were well done and ideal for a family. The kids took over the living room area while me and hubby had the bedroom. The water park was absolutely the best!!! I am an overprotective mom but had no problems giving our two 8 year old boys a little freedom inside the water park. The grounds were very clean and the water park area was immaculate. Although I recall the water being a bit warmer last year, it was nonetheless a blast to play in. This is our number one favorite family getaway. It is worth the 5 hour drive for a fun getaway that can be quite affordable if you plan accordingly. We will definitely be back again before the summer is over!!!:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: ORTravel7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 3 nights last week and had a great time. We arrived early (before 11 am) and was able to check in right away. They also upgraded us to a 5th floor water park view at no extra charge. We also got a late check out on our last day here. The water park wasn't crowded so we were able to have fun in the lazy river and just hang out. We also went to the adults only pool a few times and it was very quiet and relaxing. Our first morning there, we thought we would go hiking and started up the trail. Within 2 seconds, we saw a snake on the path so that was the end of our hiking. We used the fitness facility every morning after that and it was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate at the restaurants "Rustler's Roost" and "Aunt Chiladas" and enjoyed both. We were able to get a ride up to "Rustler's Roost" because it's quite a walk uphill. Our room was clean, comfortable, and updated. The only negative side was that it didn't have a small fridge for keeping drinks in your room. We bought a small cooler at the local store and used that. It did have a mini bar, but we didn't want to open it due to the cost involved. All in all, a very relaxing and enjoyable trip. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not that grand”
Reviews.Author: greenwood305
Reviews.Content: This resort needs to decide on an identity. The place is showing its age. The first room we were put in was like a cave -- no view out either window and very dark. We were moved to a nicer room with an open view, but that took two hours. By the time this was settled it was 5 pm. We had to pay an automatic extra facility fee that allowed us use of the facilities. We went to the water park and learned it was closing at 5. Same thing next day. However, we lost one evening of usage of the pool and lazy river, but still was stiffed for the $20.00. This hotel is geared to conventions and convention attendees, not families. They seem to expect guests that do not use the facilities. Your money is better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Retreat for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: KathinPA
Reviews.Content: I was at the resort for a conference and stayed an extra day, inviting family members and friends to join me for dinners or the water park when I had free time. I worked out early every morning at the Fitness Center (they have good classes available -- although not convenient times for conference goers) and swam in the lap pool (or in the "private" pool closer to my suite) every evening. I had a lovely suite with a balcony overlooking the golf course in the Mountain view side of the complex. Had dinner twice in the Lobby Grill -- both times excellent food (my mother raved about her fish dish). Only negatives are the daily "add on" prices for the "resort" useage -- that can really add up! Be sure you know what you are paying for so you that you aren't surprised (including annoying little automatic gratuities). I definitely appreciated that they didn't add on a wireless charge for my computer use in the room! The resort is very well laid out -- but depending on your room, there may be a lot of stairs and walking involved, especially if you are going from your room to the conference center area. Make sure you make advance arrangements if you don't like stairs (and you generally cannot park near your suite). The staff will take you around in a golf cart -- but that takes time to arrange and the bell staff may be busy. Some have commented negatively about the location in South Phoenix. Phoenix is a major metropolitan city with all the problems of one -- and the location of this resort is NOT Scottsdale. However, I still think this is one of the nicest resorts I've every stayed at, while still being convenient to the airport and downtown Phoenix, and a good jumping off point if you want to spend a day in Tucson or Tombstone. Do take advantage of the desert hiking and bike riding in the area -- unique attributes to the southwest! Kids will love the waterpark -- in fact my sister and I did too even though we are "mature" adults!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place - love the waterpark and pools!”
Reviews.Author: EllenD85
Reviews.Content: We had a great family vacation in Phoenix and loved the Arizona Grand Resort. The rooms are beautiful and all the staff are so friendly. The pools were great and the waterpark was so fun. We loved it! The staff members are very helpful and really go out of their way to make people comfortable. The proximity to places to go in the Phoenix area was great too. There is a big mall just minutes away and many places nearby. The kids loved it and my daughter said "I feel like we are rich" because we were so pampered and the resort is so beautiful. We will definitely go back and we recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't they know we're in the middle of a recession?”
Reviews.Author: tempemom
Reviews.Content: The room remodel was fine, but they forgot to update the TVs. And they were charging around $200 per night in a room going for next to nothing in Vegas. AZ Grand is in a crappy area in South Phoenix right next to a freeway. Then they ask for more money when you want to use their water park. And don't bring anything but water into the Oasis. Heaven forbid you would want to save a bit after overpaying for the room and any food you purchase. We paid that $200 ish and had no microwave, no fridge, no DVD player or radio. Oh, and feed the kids at the breakfast buffet ($5.95 ea.) but don't touch it. For $12.95 they give you choices- eggs, fruit , waffles, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, juice and coffee. Sounds fine, but it was awful. Powdered, cold eggs, dry, cakey waffles and after that, the fruit & bacon aren't worth the $13. What bothers me is that they were sold out. I like to think that there are enough people doing as well as to pay for everything separately, but I'd like to think that our current economy calls for a consciousness these people at AZ Grand simply don't have.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyment and pure comfort for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: StacieV4
Reviews.Content: Family with two kids ages 8 and 9. This is the place we chose to hang our hat for the weekend, not only to see Brian Regan at Dodge Theater, but to also celebrate our children's school year efforts a week early. We were able to get a fantastic rate which included many perks for food, golf, spa, and the water park. The room was very nice and very comfortable, with a full kitchen, eating area, sleeper sofa, two flat screen tv's (not that we watched very much). The water park was the best for all of us - we all got a chance to hang out and enjoy one other at each water park activity and share in the excitement of it all. The staff at the hotel was top notch at every location we visited on the property, I really appreciated the gentleman who, after check-in, drove/led us to find a parking spot and then to our room location. The ambiance was fabulous. Although we live in Tucson, this will definitely be our Phoenix hotel from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “It is unusual to see such a beautiful resort that is so affordable for family's. family oriented.”
Reviews.Author: careening
Reviews.Content: We were completely surprised on how classy this resort is. It was fun, clean and easy to get around. Everyone who worked there, whether the front desk, housecleaning, the water park, restaurants, concierge, or even the guy who provided us with transportation was pleasant and entertaining. We will definitely consider the Arizona Grand Resort for our next vacation. It is a great place for a family to go. We loved the hiking. It was a great family workout.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation spot - but beware the 48 inches!”
Reviews.Author: berks17
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews that I read were a big reason we went here. I echo all the positives, but will add MAKE SURE your kid is OVER 48 inches tall. They have their height boards by the slides for measuring the kids as well as "the omnipotent oar" in the manager's office, but they are all marked at about 49 inches tall! My daughter was measured at the doctor's office last month and again by me when we got back and she was 48 on the button with both, but a few times she wasn't allowed on the slides. It was OK though - more than half the time she got on just by trying again with another lifeguard (shift changes are every 15-30 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly fun!!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceNJ
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Arizona Grand and I had to write to share our wonderful experience. I have a 3 year old and an 11 year old, so to find a place that entertains them both is rare....but the Arizona Grand did it! The Oasis water park was WONDERFUL!! It was completely gated with plenty of lifeguards, so I felt 100% comfortable letting my 11 year old go off on his own with the friends he met while I splashed with my 3 year old in the wave pool. The people at the Grand were incredibly friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Sedona section, and besides the water park being a very short walk, there were two other pools, one out the front door and one we could see from our balcony!! There were always plenty of clean towels and the place was spotless. Only a few cons, which I just thought I'd mention, so my post is not dismissed as being completely biased. The food on the resort is EXPENSIVE!! Over $40 for lunch!! There was once or twice when the room was still not cleaned by 2:30, and for anyone with a tired 3 year old badly in need of a nap, that could be an issue. Also, we had a slight mix up on check in. We arrived late at night and were given a room with one king bed...there were 4 of us!! I called the front desk and we were immediately moved to a room with two double beds. They were VERY accomodating, but after hours of travle with a tired toddler, it would have been nice to have been given the correct room from the start. The resort is literally ON the main road, but once you drive onto the property...you would never know! Other than these MONOR problems, our stay was incredible. We will be back next year!! I LOVED Aunt Chiladas food...the Mexican reataurant on the resort. Some othere have posted that they didn't loke it...but I thought it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful, relaxing and enjoyable for all”
Reviews.Author: yearlytravelingmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort at the end of March 2009. My husband, daughter (26), son (21) and myself totally enjoyed our stay. The water park was wonderful. The lazy river was exactly what we needed. There were plenty of chairs, rafts and space even though it was spring vacation and the resort was obviously filled. The restaurants were all wonderful. We ate at the Rooster, Sports Bar and the Mexican Restaurant. Service and food was fantastic at all 3. The shuttle service to the restaurants and around the resort was a great addition, especially on the night it turned cool while we were at dinner and we did not want to walk from the restaurant back to our room. The room was perfect and clean with the right number of towels without us having to request. This is something you do not find most places today. Parking was never a problem, and we were able to park near our room. The pools were clean. We really enjoyed the adult only pool and hot tub in the evening. It gave us a place to go as a family and not disturb the other families with young children using the regular pools. My daughter used the exercise room and took classes every morning. My husband and daughter also enjoyed the walking trail. The location was great and centrally located to the spring training ball parks we went to. Our only regret was that we did not stay longer. Next visit will have to be at least 1 week as there is so much to offer, we know we would not get bored. We are looking forward to seeing the Arizona Grand Resort after they open their new lobby. This will just be another great addition to this location. I would recommend this for families with young children, couples who want a peaceful place away, young adults looking for a nice, safe place for spring break and for families with grown children who would like to spend some quality time together. The resort is so large and has many pools as well as the water park and many restaurants to choose from. The fitness center offers classes throughout the day and the resort even offers a 2 hour guided bike ride. Thank you for a great spring break

Reviews.Title: “Great way to finish a trip to Arizona!”
Reviews.Author: diannaken
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort at the end of our family vacation to Arizona. After a week of running around to Arizona's touristy areas we wanted our girls to have a chance to just have fun. This resort was certainly the place to do it! First, I have to say the overall ambience of the resort was fabulous. We were excited when we pulled up to the resort. The rooms were very roomy - especially for a family of 5. There was a living area with a pull out bed and the bedroom had 2 very comfortable queen beds. Plenty of drawer/closet space. The bathroom was a bit small, but the countertop/sink area was outside of the bathroom, so you really did not need much space. The water park was fabulous. Everywhere around that area was clean and there were certainly plenty of lifeguards on location. There were 3 waterslides, a lazy river, a wave pool as well as a 25 person hot tub and another pool area with volleyball/basketball, plus a baby pool. Our waitress by the pool area was super friendly and the food was good. My only complaint was with the people who cleaned our room. It was not done well and the shampoo/conditioner was not replaced, but that is probably more a problem with an individual, rather than the resort. It was a little pricey to stay here by the time you added the resort fee and taxes, but it was certainly worth it for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at it's best”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasSundevil
Reviews.Content: Top notch service at every corner. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Location was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was fabulous, our family loved it.”
Reviews.Content: Our family, children ages 14 & 11, had a wonderful week at the resort. Everything about our stay was top notch. We definitely hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Sun always shines in Arizona”
Reviews.Author: heres2ubuddy
Reviews.Content: We arrived the afternoon "Island Nights" ended... too bad it seemed like the kind of activity the hotel should have regularly. A magic show was the highlight of the evening that night, my 12 year old son loved it. We hiked the South Mountain Preserve the very next day with a resort guide, just delightful, THANKS again Elizabeth! The Oasis water park was awesome! We soaked, we floated, we relaxed our winter weary bones. Poolside service was great. The Phoenix Fringe Festival gave us theater entertainment options every night. As Arnold Schwarzenegger says "I'll BE Back!" Beware of the Budget rental car branch at the Sky Harbor Airport though this was a very poor example of good customer service. STAY AWAY from BUDGET at the AIRPORT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, though service can be lacking...”
Reviews.Author: Croback
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Arizona Grand for four days in March 2009. Though the hotel and water park are enjoyable, the service seems to be lacking in a couple of aspects. Foremost, waiter service at the water park was poor if available at all. Even when I went to the service window my one item order took over 20 minutes. It seemed due more to short staffing than effort on the part of the wait staff. In our hotel room, though the room was cleaned satisfactorily, it always appeared that any room service dishes left outside the door were not picked up for almost a day. Great place for the kids and always a relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fun activities, but you're gonna pay for it...”
Reviews.Author: ClarenceCalhoun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sedona building one night to start a week-long Arizona vacation through Phoenix, Sedona and the Grand Canyon. The rooms (all are suites) are VERY nice. The pool / water park area was fun. We didn't try the hotel restaurants because we were anxious to try another place in town. This is a fantastic place to stay if it fits your price range, and you really like the water park / golf / spa type resort. For us, more than one night wouldn't have been worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the kids, relaxation for the parents!”
Reviews.Author: l0vedthesun
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Arizona Grand was a perfect family vacation. While the adults in our party enjoyed the classes at the health club, hikes in the desert, golfing and the bar at the pool (!) the kids were immersed in the waterpark and the other activities on the property! Great value - a family-friendly facility - and perfect sunshine!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: teamom01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Arizona Grand Resort. My husband and I were there over spring break with our 15 yr old son. Rooms were very nice--all suites which felt very homey. Very clean facility, nice water park, nice golf course, every interaction with staff was great. The fitness center looked fantastic although we did not use it. We got a much better rate for golf on azcentral.com--$49 per person. Very kid friendly--nice for families, although the "adult pool" was never monitored and there were tons of kids there, but it was spring break. My only reason for not giving 5 stars would be that the hot water seemed to take forever to make it to our room (sonoma 311). About 10 minutes into a lukewarm shower the water did finally get hot. Other than that it was a great stay. I would definitely go back. I wouldn't recommend Rustler's Roost--it was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip to AZ”
Reviews.Author: mpkoby
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from AZ where we stayed at the AZ Grand. My parents meet us there and stayed a few rooms down. Overall I thought the resort was very nice and we all enjoyed ourselves. I probably don't have much new to add but will provide my two cents. The resort is big and spread out but I didn't consider it a big deal. The weather is great and I personally enjoyed walking around and what's wrong with a little exercise. The resort is right in the middle of town but I never noticed it while in the resort and when we ventered out is was nice to be close to things. The resturant situation on the resort is very limited. We had a car so we didn't eat at the resort for any meals. If you didn't have a car and had to eat here every meal I could see that being an issue. The waterpark was great. We would spend most of the day there then go back to the quite pool by our room. This is definetly a great place for kids. My dad an I played golf at the resort twice and finished in 3 1/2 hours both times. We found the course to be challenging with great views. A hint on this. You can book your tee times online at one of the discount golf sites for half what they will charge you if you book through the pro shop. I think it was like $100 a round through the pro shop and we paid $59. Construction was going on right outside our room which was pretty annoying but it looked to be about done so it shouldn't be an issue much longer. They waived our $30 facility fee due to being woken up early each morning. The resort was pretty empty so I'm not sure why they didn't just put us somewhere else. Anyway, it wasn't that big a deal. The new Villas looked really nice and when we go back we will probably look to book one of those. The access to South Mountain park was very cool and we went hiking each morning. One other suggestion. You can rent a car from Enteprise (I think it may have been National) at the resort and its much cheaper this way as you don't pay all the airport fees. They will bring it to you and you drop it off there so you never have to leave the resort to get it. All said I would stay here again if we go back to AZ which we likely will until we move back to the States from Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good Value, Fun Golf Course, Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: latertk
Reviews.Content: The place is great but for the lack of a decent, reasonable place to eat on site. You will need a rent car to get off the property to go eat. The golf is fun but don't plan on renting clubs to play. Their best set is 10 years old and looks like they have been dragged behind the cart. Fun place for the kids, rooms are very nice, staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: barbiegrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of a week in Arizona. The location was a little closer to the airport and freeway than I expected and was larger than I thought. The room was okay. Shoe print on the bedroom wall, large dead bug on the wall behind the door. The bedroom "patio" was laughable. It was basically just a small walkout balcony with no seating. Our room was on the second floor at the end of a corridor near the service elevator, with the stairway right outside. At the bottom of the stairway, was where the linen service truck picked up the carts of dirty linens. The view from our bedroom "patio" consisted of a parking lot along a busy road, with carts filled with dirty linens, and an occasional visit from the linen service truck for 10-15 minutes or so while they loaded the carts. The resort seemed understaffed and the staff was not overly friendly. Cleaning carts were in the corridors from morning til night. The first night when we went to dinner, there was a towel on the ground outside our room. It was still there in the morning. We had coffee by our pool in the morning and there was a table next to us where someone had eaten breakfast and the tray of dishes and food was left on the table. It was still there when we went to dinner at 5:00 and when we returned we saw someone finally going to clean it up. I chose this resort partly for the waterpark, but my 12 year old son was unimpressed. There was inadequate seating available. We finally found seats only to have a group of older teenage boys come over and tell us that they had left towels on them earlier to reserve them. Once we found new seats, we actually enjoyed sunbathing there. After waiting unsuccessfully for food service at our seats, I went to the bar to order lunch for my son.
